review_content: Clear pale gold, thin white head. Minimal aroma, faint malt. Taste, slightly hoppy, touch of spice, lemon, malt, mild lingering bitterness. Ok lager, not memorable.
Ljusgul och filtrerad vätska med fingertjockt och fluffigt skum. Lätt arom av deg, säd och lite gräs. Lätt söt maltkropp som möter en lite torr och lätt krispig beska. Kort eftersmak.
Bottle. Clear yellow, big bubbly head. Vegetal, corn aroma. Sweet, corn water, grassy, vegetal flavors. Light medium bodied, dry, fizzy.
Fin lys med fint skum. Let syrlig bitter duft. Let bitter, men ikke speciel.

Bright  golden with a white head that quickly disintegrates. Beautiful.

White bread and sweet malty spices on the nose. Grassy fresh in a good way. 

Watery liquid bread mouthfeel . Quite bitter finish. 

Uncomplicated, watery, plain and perfectly easy drink
Bottle pours pale yella with loads of head. Metallic cardboard aroma. Similar flavor. Butt and empty water finish.
Beer with ramen. Pours clear light yellow, malts, grass. Medium body and average carbonation.
Light european lager, not bad - has some aroma from malt, some grassy note, which is a plus against the backdrop of other lagers. Tastes of something, some bitterness even, ofc relative to the style.
Bottle @ home. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of grain, corn grass and some flowers. Low bitterness.
Light pilsner Asian beer. It's okay with sushi, but other than that, meh...
Bottle.  Taste like malt water with faint hop.  Light taste. Above average carbonation.  It’s not very appealing.  But not bad.
0.33l bottle. Clear golden color with stable white head. Aroma of grain, malt, rice and vegetables. Taste is bitter and little sweet.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Pilsner glass; from the fridge.

Okay ish pilsner, really clear.
Troppo gassata, tanto che si fa fatica a percepire il gusto (comunque amaro e poco aromatico)
Old rating from 04-03-15 - 330ml bottle, pours clear golden with a small white foamy head. Aromas & tastes of corn, grain, herbal & sweet malt. Moderate body. Dry moderate bitter finish.
Clear, pale golden color and a nice white head. Grainy, malty, less hoppy than expected.
Uma larger encorpada, com leve amargor. Aroma bem discreto, coloração dourada e epuma branca. Bem saborosa e refrescante.
Goldgelbes Bier flacher schaum, im Geruch eher klassisch asiatisch Getreide malz, so auch im Geschmack, naja is ok
0,33l Flasche. Als „Special Edition“. Goldgelb , heller Schaum. Getreideduft. Antrunk ok. Getreide und Stroh.
La Kirin Ichiban est une lager légère et rafraîchissante, l'amertume y est subtile. Bouteille 650 ml.

341 ml bottle. Pours a clear bright amber with moderate foamy head.
Aromas of grain and soft fruit. Mild flavors follow same. Malty sweet with a light bitterness at the end. A clean quaffer, but otherwise quite unremarkable
Whole box on the Internet, 3 months aged, very pale, amber color. Bitterness with deep roast malt.
Adding in my 300 Beers To Try ticks because I want to see how they impact my stats and some of them I will never see again. Will however re-rate them when practical.
Bevuta in bottiglia al Koj. Birra bionda.  Tipica lager senza pretese. Nulla da dire.

Color dorado translúcido con espuma media blanca de retención media y buen residuo. Aroma a cereal blanco, lúpulos nobles con notas a frutas blancas. Sabor similar, cereal blanco, lúpulos nobles con notas ligeras a hierba, frutas blancas y metal. Dulzor ligero y amargor medio ligero con regusto corto. Textura acuosa, cuerpo ligero  y carbonatación medio-alta. Una Pale Lager de sabor a cereal y un punto lupulado fresco. Simple, algo industrial pero pasable.

Aroma e gosto inicial de trigo
Cerveja moderada...
Cai bem com um japonês junto
It was OK. It´s a shame that it is no different from any other lager that I can buy. I don´t see the point then...
Blik gedeelt door Inoven. Het is een helder goudgeel bier met een volle witte schuimkraag. Het heeft een moutige geur. De smaak is moutig en zacht. Gewoon pils achtig.

Flesje gedeeld met Tomhendriksen. 
Goudgeel helder bier met veel schuim. Weinig aroma maar in de verte een beetje hoppig. Smaak is fruitig en hoppig. Voor mij een standaard pils.
0,33l Flasche. Hellgebes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Typisches Lagerbier, relativ soft im Geschmack.
Bardzo jasne, wręcz przeźroczyste, na początku wydaje się, że będzie goryczka ale zamiast tego mamy wielką pustkę, woda i nic poza tym.
Bottle buy in Asian grocery store in Valencia Spain. Taste sweet smell like apples not bad beer.
Japanese version of the standard easy-drinking lager. A little deeper in colour than expected - more amber than gold. Some depth to the flavours, but overall pretty average.

33 cl. bottle.

Clear, straw-coloured with white head. Classic lager aroma: malt and some grass. Taste is not pleasant. There's some hop but it's not in the way I like my hop -- it has a poor bitterness along with medium sweetness. It has a light body, thin-to-oily texture, and medium carbonation. Mouthfeel is similar to that of sparkling water. This is below average even for a lager.
Aroma : Very lightly malted, light straw/grassy hop.  Taste : As nose, bitter-sweet balance is o.k. just about all that can said about this one...bland!

Bottle 0.33 beer is brewed at Weihenstephan

Golden straw color with a thin film of foam.
Nose. Malt, a little grain and hops. nicely
Taste. The beer body is pleasant, carbonation is weak. The taste is malt, with a pleasant hop aftertaste.

Very nice lager!

Bought the bottle at the Asia Market in the station district of Luxembourg-City. The beer I'm drinking has been brewed in Bavaria.

Clear golden with a frothy head.
Grainy and hoppy smell. Mainly malty taste with a citric ending, but in general very bland. It's not even very drinkable, not like many other rather tasteless beers.

Excellent pale lager, one of the best I've had. Very refreshing light body with medium to strong carbonation. Would prefer a little more flavour, but as a refreshing lager at the end of the day there is little better.
500ml bottle from Tesco, Watford and drunk on 15/08/2006.  Pale golden lager.  Some cereal notes in the aroma.  Very light body.  I think this was brewed under licence in the UK.

[as Kirin Ichiban Special Edition, German version brewed at Weihenstephan in Dusseldorf] Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso è indirizzato verso l'orzo. La finezza olfattiva è normale e la maniera in cui permane è corta. Il manto birroso superiore è caratterizzato da una schiuma dalla scarsa tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è media. Il liquido è di aspetto trasparente. Il colore è giallo dorato brillante. Il corpo è medio. L'amaro è moderato. La forza gustativa è normale e permane in maniera appena percepibile. Le sensazioni boccali finali risultano di facile beva. Il retrogusto è delicato. Al palato arrivano indizi di miele, orzo ed erbaceo.
Golden pour. Great carbonation. Very little aroma. Flavor is very well balanced.  Clean and refreshing.
İçimi rahat altın sarı renkli az köpüklü, şerbitçiotundan dolayı tatlı içimi olan hafif bir Japon birası.
Cerveza muy carbonatada, con poco aroma, con mucho toque a arro. Amargor bastante ligero, pero con poco sabor. Poca retención de espuma. Filtrada
Schaumkragen zerfällt innert kürzester Zeit. Bier verliert schnell Perligkeit. Klassische Farbe eines Lagerbiers. Ebenso klassisch ist der Geschmack; Einheitspfütze!

65 cl at Kazoku Sushi. Clear golden appearance with a thin white head. Mild aroma of toasted grain and light grassy notes. Similar flavor, adding mild sweetness and a touch of bitterness. Light body with a slight watery finish. Boring.
Fles. Gebrouwen Duitsland, Weihenstephan. Aroma mout, vlak (het onaffe van veel lagers). Wat waterig in mond, maar wel goed qua bitterheid. Dat laatste maakt het nog tot redelijk lager

Bottle - Clear golden colour, small white head, poor retention. Grainy aromas with some yeasty note. Taste is weak malty with some corny and metallic aftetrtaste. Thin body, high carbonation, watery texture, dry and empty finish. Featureless.
Paxhni niczym, może trochę mineralnosci i żelaza. Wysycenie spoko, wodniste, niewiele różni się od Leszka, może trochę więcej slodowosci. plusem jest to że wchodzi dobrze.

330ml bottle [as "Kirin Ichiban First Press", German version brewed at Weihenstephan]. Clear, yellow-ish, golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Minimally sweet-ish, grainy and strawy, pale malty aroma. Taste is sweet-ish grainy, minimally strawy, minimally dry hoppy, slightly watery.
Kirin Ichiban is my all-time favorite beer. Most sushi restaurants will carry this brand, so be sure to try it when available! It's served both in bottle and on tap. Either is great!
Tap @ Wasabi. Édeskés kevés szénsavval, olyan rizses, jól eltalált pale lager.

La lager industrielle japonaise, concurrente de l’asahi. Robe jaune bulleuse assez jolie avec des arômes terreux, épicé. En bouche, une lager industrielle lambda qui sort du lot avec des saveurs légèrement sucrées et épicées . Ça demeure une pils élaborée sans grand intérêt

How: bottle, Euro version @ 5% abv. Enjoyed directly from bottle.
Colour: pale straw, as I poured some to kitchen sink.
Head: creates nice two finger head in bottle.
Aroma: light bread, some herbal hoppy notes, slight metallic off flavor. 
Taste: thin/ medium body, lively carbonation, a bit watery, bread, hops. Bread in quite short aftertaste.
Clean, boring, bulk beer.
Barwa złota, piwo klarowne, piana biała skromna. Aromat nijaki, w smaku lekka słodycz, trochę utlenione w miód i zaznaczona, ziołowa goryczka.
Très bonne lager. Un petit goût de miel et de céréales qui permet à cette bière de ce différencier du tout venant des lager. A tester
33 cl bottle at home. Drank on August 17th 2019 as Kirin Ichiban (5,0%). Decent taste, but too watery.

0,33l bottle. Pours clear gold with white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, grains, cardboard. Taste is initially sweet, turns hoppy bitter, but with quite some off-taste of poor quality ingredients. Metallic. Not good.
Carbonated, yellow coloured with a white head, good lacing, for a lager beer it's quite good because it's light and easy to drink with food.

Blek, är det genomgående intrycket. Metallisk, ljus maltarom och en tämligen tysk pilsnerkänsla. Dock med en skaplig fyllighet och en smak som hänger i förvånansvärt länge. Sämre nationalklenoder har jag sett.
Cerveza que es casi un refresco casi insipida con un ligero amargor y mucho gas

A: Clear straw colour with a small white head. 
N: Faint hint of pale malt sweetness
T: Faint malty profile with a hint of bitterness.
P: Thin
O: Standard light lager.
I think this one is a ok. Light easy drinking and crisp. I would love try this one in Japan. Kirin is brewed all over and that can mess up it´s original taste a bit.
Tastes like a really stale Budweiser. Pretty mediocre even for mediocre beer standards.
A taste that either grows on you or you will reject outright. No strong flavours but moreish

Couleur dorée pâle bien limpide. Mousse généreuse pas très coriace. Nez un peu sur les grains, un peu sur le miel mais tout en faiblesse. Bien crispy en bouche, carbo puissante, amertume modérée et herbacée. Rien de neuf dans le monde de la Lager industrielle ou tout se ressemble.
0,33 l Flasche, gebraut in Freising von der Brauerei Weihenstephaner. Malzig, süßlich in der Nase, ähnlich im Geschmack mit leichter grasiger Note
Goud geel, mooi wit schuimend bier. Smaakt lekker bitter en zacht. Mooie combinatie tussen het zoete granige begin, en het bittere einde. Zeker niet slecht.

Somewhere between a pils and a lager. Nothing unpleasant about it, but then not exciting either (Edit: didn't know that it was brewed in Dusseldorf, but there was a hint of a German pils taste as I noted).

Sunday, May 5, 2019. Can 33cL. 5%. Purchase ("Géant Casino", Chauray (79), FR). Japanese beer brewed in Düsseldorf ! Home. A golden clear beer with a medium white head ;  medium retention ; ok lacing. Light cereal, light malt, herbal note, honey note. Light dry refreshing bitter, sweet note. Light body, thin texture, average gaseous, dry refreshing finish. Overall, ok !
Bottle at Yen Yen. Pale yellow pour with a white head. Crisp taste and aroma you would expect.
Bottle at Schiphol. Nose and tastes pale malts, light grain, light sweet, strong carbonation.
Nada. Lager triste del montón. Como viene un nombre japonés nos pensamos que va a ser algo diferente y toma. Poco carbonatada, poco cuerpo, poco de todo.

Blonde peu de mousse amère agrume 
Laisse un petit goût d'alcool en fin 
Brasse en Allemagne

12 oz bottle.Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Scents of malt and grass. Very malt forward with some hops balance and an astringent finish. Above average carbonation. Some lacing. Good not great.

Pale yellow color with thick foam and a typical lager beer aroma.  Flavor starts like a typical mass market lager, hop bitterness and slightly sweet malt,  and and crisp finish with an atypical taste at the end
Bottled at The Red Sun, Blaricum. Below average pilsener, rice, corn? The food was pretty good though.
Classica Lager commerciale. Birra dorata, frizzantezza abbondante, sapori metallici

Hadn't rated somehow, ticked at a dim sum joint in LA with gahb selection. Clear golden yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma is rice, grain, nondescript. Flavor is same, clean and inoffensive with but very mundane. Light, high carbonation. I guess it's fine for what it is.

AR: sehr langweiliges Lager
AP: klares goldgelb
TA: sehr langweiliges Lager

33 cl bottle at Naomi, oldest Japanese restaurant in Madrid. It pours clear golden, visible bubbles and an ephemerous off-white head. Aroma is close to non-existent: a hint of bread and honey, maybe some iron. Watery, fizzy, metallic, good umami. Longer-lasting finish than expected, but nothing outstanding. Low bitterness, more metallic tinges. Not super-bad, but forgettable.
A reasonable lager. Very smooth, not too sweet, not too fizzy. Pairs well with light Japanese food, but wouldn’t welecome it at any other time.
Average beer, i tried it in a sushi restaurant ‘cause it was from Japan but it was nothing special.
Middle to low grade light beer. Not really a special taste. But good with sushi

Bottle, "First Press", label states it's brewed by Weihenstephan. Clear rather deep golden color with foamy white head. Aroma is grains, a touch herbal. Taste is grains, sweetish malts, bready. Oily mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Clean and inoffensive.

0,33 bottle.Immediately after filling the foam, a bright yellow disembodied color disappeared. Average large-scale lager scent. Weakly carbonated. It has a sour, corn flavor, it doesn’t bring anything outstanding, it would be a dozen lager, which highlights perhaps a little interesting, delicious spicy aftertaste. Very watery.
***
 A hab kitöltés után azonnal eltűnt, világos sárga testetlen szín. Átlag nagyüzemi lager illat. Gyengén szénsavas. Savanykás, kukoricás íz, semmi kiemelkedőt nem hoz, tucat lager lenne, ami kiemeli talán, egy kicsi érdekes, finom fűszeres utóíz. Nagyon vizes.

Lata. Clear fair golden, medium white head. Aroma: maltish with plain hops, grassy bit. Fair palate. Flavour: malty like, grassy hops, mild bitterness, lightly dry. 
Earlier Rating: 4/14/2007 Total Score: 2.7
Big Bottle with 5.5% (brewed in Japan). Golden clear colour with a small white average lasting head. Aroma of malt and hops. The flavour is fresh and malty with a good touch of hops. Easy to drink smooth lager brew
Good tasting lager but very ordinary not exciting 5% alcohol, would not repurchase.

Color amarillo oscuro, transparente. Espuma blanca abundante y de muy buena retención. Aroma muy floral, cereal y un toque frutal. Sabor igual más un punto amargo un poco agresivo. Textura acuosa. Carbonatación alta.

Can from Edeka Große Bergstr., Altona - I was excited to find a beer from Japan and then it's brewed at Weihenstephan? - clear dark golden color, white head. body is far stronger than from average east asian beers. malty, some dough. okay!
From a 33 cl bottle at Dungrats. Pours a clear gold with a white head. Malty aroma. Flavors are moderately bitter. A pretty decent mass market lager.

0,33 l bottle brewed at Staatsbrauerei Weichenstephan. Pours clear yellow with a finger of white medium lasting head. Mild aroma og malt, bread and herbal hop notes. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, slick mouthfeel and carbonation average. Finish is medium, light sweetness with medium herbal bitterness. It has no off taste and It's reasonably drinkable.
Klasické japonské pivo s charakteristikou pale lager.  Pivo s lehkými sladovými tóny a velmi jemnou hořkostí. Doznívání prázdné.

Nice can but no detail information about this beer here. But this isn’t craft ;)
Clear golden beer with short heavy white head, head is perfect but very short, smell is very light sweet and honey, taste is light bitter and cereal, average carbonation, light body, more watery, thin texture. Finish is sweetness and cereal. Boring and watery 
(I have 0.33l can with best-before 23.11.2018 and batch L7327 09:02)
This beer just lacks personality. Very week flavors with carbonation that leaves you disappointed. The malts flavors fail to deliver a decent taste. Too bad!
Pours clear, bright golden with a two finger, white head. Aroma is pure skunk. Taste is corn syrup, moving to a slight hop note. Finish is limited.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.
Good looking beer, clear yellow body with white head. Faint hop aroma that vanished quickly. Light malt taste with a very thin malt finish.
Pours a clear gold from a bottle, no head. Grainy, a little oily. Sweet. Meh.

330ml can drunk at home over lunch on a perfect November day. Pours clear with a fluffy head that lasted well, heavy lacing and persistent rising carbonation. Pale gold in colour. Light bready malt aromas with the faintest hints of herbs and flowers. In the mouth, medium to high carbonation, flavours similar to the aromas but with the addition of some honey and more floral hoppiness, medium bitterness with a touch of astringency, light texture, no alcohol presence, minimal sweetness with a short crisp finish. Overall, a pretty decent and undeniably refreshing but forgettable lager that does nothing to justify its inflated price.

Auch wenn es sich komisch anhört -dieses Bier ist "deutscher" als manches Billigbier, das man bei ALDI bekommt. Auf dem Etikett steht nämlich: gebraut von der Weltenburger Brauerei in Bayern (zumindest bei der Version, welche man im China-Laden in Wien bekommt) -dazu kann man stehen wie man will, aber zumindest ist dadurch die CO2-Bilanz besser als bei einem Import.
Geschmacklich ist es weitaus besser als die meisten leichten ostasiatischen Biere, die ich bis jetzt gekostet habe. Es gibt nicht diesen, vermutlich vom Reis kommenden, süßlichen Geschmack.
Wenn auch nicht schlecht, so auch nichts besonderes.
Robe paille, limpide, mousse bof, peu durable, carbo faible. Nez de grain un peu sucré, bouche légère, un peu de malt, un peu de corps, peu d'arômes. Très facile à boire.

???; ????????????????????? ??????????+???????????  ?? ???????????????????+???????  ??????????????????? ??????????  [?????????33cl???]
Earlier Rating: 12/1/2014 Total Score: 2.4
Foamy white head, clear light golden body, 
Aroma; mild sweet malts, wheat style, dust, hay.
Taste; grassy hops, dough malts, grainy bread.
Average on palate, a bit macro’ish. Bready finish with moderate hops.
[33cl br btl, abv5%, BB18.03.15, B@Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen]
Cerveza pálida, con poca carbonatación. Tiene un sabor plano, con un suave sabor a malta. Una cerveza olvidable.
It does not bite in your face at first sip. It becomes a pleasure to finish it and you will crave to open another one.
Botella 0,33l Dorada,clara,espuma blanca,alta,fina,resistente.Aroma cereales,maiz,malta,frutal.Sabor cereales,malta,maiz,frutal, ligero amargor con fino dulzor,suave
Pours golden yellow colour. Thin white head. Malty aroma. Bit sweet too. Malty, slightly caramelly, slightly sweet taste. Malty aftertaste. High carbonation. Crisp texture. Usual macrolager.

Bottled June 22nd 2018.

It pours a pale gold, clear, not much of a head of foam even with a vigorous pour. Wee bits of lacing. 

Smell is grainy, lightly sweet and bitter. Bitter could be lemon. 

Grainy, slightly sweet like what you get in a malt Liquor. Bitter notes low and makes me question what I said aboot lemon in the smell. 

Typical mouthfeel for the style. 

Good enough for what it is.

This is Kirin Ichiban Shibori. The first beer I had in Japan, repeated experience, and now about 30 years later... Again.  Maybe the beer has changed over those years or so they claim. Light lager that goes well with Japanese food; a beverage for the land.  Certainly a macro-lager that will disappoint some and doesn’t do anything to separate itself from the others but it’s Kirin Ichiban Shibori. It may NOT be a beer god but... It is what it is.
Blonde claire, translucide, avec des arômes légers et une amertume légère elle aussi. Elle se boit facilement. Une bonne lager, sans plus.

V sushibate v centre pri medenej. Vona jemnesladova. Farba zlatista. Chut medova sladkasta.
Earlier Rating: 1/13/2018 Total Score: 2.8
0.33l flasa z Yeme. vona leziakovo ipova. farba bleda. pena nedrzi. kyslasta chut, ide do horka a akoby to bol skor weissen.
Une excellente lager. Arôme fruité et très floral, blonde couleur or, très maltée en bouche, arôme mielleux de céréales... en terme de lager industrielle, difficile de trouver mieux.
Uit een flesje in DragonI, met de oude AWV OR. Niks mis mee, helder, prima wit schuim en een lekker pilsje bij het goede Aziatische eten. Leuk en afwijkend etiket, lekker druk.

Bottle, 330 ml @ Sushi la bar. Birthday 'all u can eat' with Kirin Premium Press. Intensive golden, decent white foam, medium carbo. Sweet corn taste, a bit of popcorn, but nothing interesting. Tasty and flavourful, smooth and easy, featurless lager goes well with sushi. Liked it!
Earlier Rating: 6/23/2018 Total Score: 2.6
Bottle, 330 ml @ The Old Fishing Shack, CY. Second Japanese lager for me to taste. Shiny golden colour, not so big head, but it has a thin layer. Pure malty aromas combined with a hint of sweetness. Rich citrusy flavour on the palate, moderate bitterness. Not bold as Asahi was, pure, clean lager, nothing extraordinary.

Bottle of 4.6 % ABV shared with JMD on board Fridtjofen 29.07.18. Clear pale golden. Diminishing white head. Aroma of and clean taste of grass, continental hops and pilsner malt. Not the worst of eurolagers.

0,33 flaske (4,6%) fra lønningskontoret i Krossen, delt med skibsrederen under dagens båtpuss: klar gylden med ok skum. Enkel aroma og smak med lys malt, litt gress og bitter citrus. Kort ettersmak. Arbeidslysten trenger seg ikke akkurat på. Inoffensive.
Earlier Rating: 3/9/2013 Total Score: 2.2
Flaske fra polet: vet ikke helt hva jeg skal mene om denne, og lurer på hvilke humler som er brukt. Litt aroma av grønne epler og en ubestemmelig syrlighet, smak fra den samme eplekurven + litt tyggis. Kort ettersmak. "Beer at its purest" er det i hvertfall ikke.
Flasche. Gold-gelber Körper, wenig Schaum. Aroma wie Geschmack: Malzsüße, Hopfen, Zitrus. Nichts bemerkenswertes.
Flaska i Oslo. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Maltig doft och smak. Inget speciellt.

Pours golden amber with a very thin white head. Little to no notable aroma, typical malt hints. Taste is typical of a pale lager, nothing notable aside from that. Palate is almost completely flat, only malt is noticeable on the back of the tongue. Soft, dry mouthfeel. Unremarkable pale lager, probably the Budweiser of Japan. Worth trying for another country tick.

22oz bottle at a sushi restaurant. It pours a clear clear bubbly yellow with a white head that disappears quickly. There is not much flavor or aroma, which is perfect for sushi. It's nothing special but perfect for sushi
在ok便利店以$13買來500ml；顏色是較深的金黃色，聞起來沒有香味，還有一絲酒精味道；氣泡有活力，有一層微弱的泡沫；喝下有苦味，draft beer還好，比不上Ashai、Sapporo及Orion。
Bottle - clear pale yellow. Medium carbonation with small white head. Decent lager aroma. Heavy ting on tongue and in mouth. Lack of body and taste. Standard lager, bit too gassy.
Ocena na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji dodana na potrzeby uzupełnienia profilu.

Bottle, first Japanese beer (I rate) 
Pours headless gold. 
Aroma is light malty to none...what is okay for Asian beer IMO. Tastes sweetish bit malty, above average Asian.

I had this at Drunken Fish. Pours gold with a white head. Taste grain, grass, typical lager. I thought this was ok. I could drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear golden with a white head. Grains, honey, resin, citrus. Light to medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium sourness. Medium carbonation, sour, bitter and dry finish. Aroma is very plain, overall nothing to write home about.

Btle.
Typical bitter weat beer. Blond light (5%) so best serve cold.
Fun fact : this beer is supposed to be Japanese according to it’s label but it is in fact manufactured and bottled in... Germany (Düsseldorf). So rip off ?
Fles 32cl thuis. Vlak, weinig smaak, saai, beetje bitters, beetje zoeten. Gebrouwen bij Bayerische Staatsbrauerei Weihenstephan. (12-2013).
On tap. Poured a golden color with a medium sized head. Yeah, another pale lager, some grass and sweetness.

0.33 l bottle from K-Supermarket Kamppi, Helsinki. Golden, clear and OK head. Taste is sweetish. I would prefer more hops. This is just not my kind of lager.
Earlier Rating: 1/1/2013 Total Score: 2.1
0.33 can bought at store in Hong Kong selling Japanese food. Not much of a taste. Probably good for those who want their beer that way.

Kirin Ichiban 100% malt. 12 oz can on an airline on the way to Tokyo.
Clear fizzy yellow body with a tall head of foam that has decent retention. The aroma has a mix of attractive malts, spicy and grassy hops, and faint off-notes. The flavor is oddly more bitter mid-taste than in the aftertaste. Almost repellant at first, it improved as my taste adjusted and it warmed a bit. 
Quite poor compared to the Sam Adams lager that preceded it. I’m sure better beers await me in Japan.

Легкий солодовый аромат, светло-желтый, прозрачный цвет. Пена моментально падает. Вкус легкий, слегка терпкий на языке. Послевкусие не очень приятно и вкусное. Даже имеется намеки на хмель. В целом средний лагер. Одним словом легкий, летний вариант.

From notes. Enjoyed at Yume Japanese & Asian Restaurant with the team for dinner on February 06. 12 oz bottle. The pour is a bright golden yellow color with a thicker white head that falls away quickly without any lace left behind at all. The aroma is definitely grainy and malty. There is a lot of cereal and a hint of alcohol as it comes through. There is a hint of citrus and a light and growing sweetness. The flavor is much of the same. The graininess from the front to back is just not that good. The sweet corn comes through next and the light alcohol on the finish is a little messy. The mouth feel is watery and light bodied with a brighter carbonation and a lingeringly grainy and sweet finish. Well, if nothing else, it paired well with the sushi. 4 3 4 3 10

Couleur dorée, légère mousse. Nez sur le malt doux, note houblonnée légère. Gout sur le malt doux , note acidulée, houblonnée, papier. A peine mieux que la kirin de base

Pours a pale yellwoth with a finger of bubbly, white head. Aroma is mildly sweet with notes of roasted cereal grains, slight floral/spicy hops, and a faint creaminess. Kirin Ichiban pours a pale golden color with a medium head of medium lifespan. The nose is grainy, faintly creamy, and faintly floral. The grainy attack is followed by a dry generically bitter mid-palate. The finish is lightly bitter, dry, and snappy. A gentle alcohol glow lingers. Generic.

Bottle sampled at picnic in Strasbourg. Clear light golden with white head. Light pils malts, a touch of cardboard, old hop pellets with a dried grassy touch, soft bread, cashew paste and a bit of buckwheat. Under medium sweet and light bitter. Light bodied. Drinkeable.

Can. Clear golden body, medium white head with average retention, some lacing. Aroma of grains, rice, herbs and hints of banana. Taste of grains, banana, mineral water and harsh hops. Decent.

From 33cl bottle. Pours crisp gold, loaded, with moderate white foam, fine. Aroma is bready and grainy. Body is average. Taste is sweet mostly, only some underlying bitterness. Finish is scarce.

I think this beer tasted very good and surprised by the down votes. I would recommend this and buy it again for sure (it was 9.99).

lattina 33 cl, schiuma media grana evanescente, colore oro limpido, al naso e in bocca malto, metallica, carbonatazione moderata, lieve dolce con percettibile amaro nel finale. Una lager da battaglia come tante 27.05.17

500ml bottle. Pours light golden amber with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malt, touch of caramel, hay, honey and some lemon. Carbonation rushing up glass. Very smooth. Sweet to taste, malty, leading into a light lemony bitterness and finishing with a nice straw, honey sweetness. I rather like this, for a lager it’s well above the average muck.

Aromas de malta y maíz. Color oro pálido, con cabeza blanca, algo de persistencia y no lazada. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación animada. El sabor es malta, reminiscencias metálicas. Lager normal, fresca. Nada extraordinario.

Copenhagen 20/5 2017. 33 cl bottle from Meny, Bryggervangen, Kbh Ø. Some kind of Japanese Dragon galloping forward on the label. 

Pours clear pale yellow with big bubbly white head. Settles as dense 1cm thick layer of dense foam. Moderate lacing. 

Aroma is pretty weak. Sweet malt, grass and light notes of citrus.

Medium carbonation and watery texture. 

Flavor is medium sweet followed by medium bitterness. Well balanced - - a little bit on the sweet side. Aftertaste is lightly bitter. 

Pretty crisp and clean lager. Not especially distinctive. But it serves it’s purpose with a plate of sushi.
From old tasting notes. Bright yellow gold color. Small bubbles lead to a big creamy white head. Fresh malty aroma. Crisp light malt flavor is balanced well by a dry hop finish.

Aroma: Cereal and nuts.
Appearance: Gold color with clear sparkling liquid and minimal white head.
Taste: Light sweet notes and medium bitterness.
Palate: Light body with oily texture and lively carbonation. Short bitter astringent finish.
Overall: Soft and easy to drink. A bit of alcoholic touches in the end. Not great but not bad features either.
Can from Hotel Mystays vending in Akasaka. Clean, sweet, some sharp hops in there somewhere. Pretty dece.

This beer was purchased at the LCBO. If you are Canadian and drinking this beer, it has been brewed in Germany under licence for Kirin Ichiban. Smell is very mild lager. Pours a light gold colour with head that lasts almost to the end. Taste is mild lager, with some sweetness. Great carbonation with next to no aftertaste. Overall I enjoyed this beer, and I would purchase again. It was not offensive, easy drinking, and smooth. It is by no means the best beer I have tried, but I liked it. MB. The Beer "Bear"on.

Bottle at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) Pours a clear golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of sweet grain, banana and subtle grassy hops. Taste of grain, some banana, a little maize , slight honey, and subtle grassy hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A sweet, grainy bitterness in the finish. Not an exciting beer but it’s something different to regular lagers. It’s very sweet yes but I enjoy the honey and banana flavours in this and I don’t get any metallic/minerally flavours. Surprising decent.

33 cl can. Pale gold color, clear, big white head, lacing, grainynose. Aroma has grainy malts with sugar and hay. Some leafy hops and biscuits, very light bitterness, flasttish taste. Has a leftover of candy sugar in the finish together with aluminum. Medium bodied, average carbonation, clean finish. Average lager.

Had this more than once, and last incarnation was on tap as "frozen" at Hong Kong airport, with a weird almost icecream white top. Average asian lager, yellow color, undefined taste, easy to drink. But the frozen thing has its duty, weird feeling, quite original.


Here’s a more rational review.

35 cl can. Clear gold color, short white head, cheap nose. Aroma has grainy malts with sugar, something sticky as it may be rice starch even if it’s said to be all malt. Some leafy hops and biscuits, no bitterness, very flat taste. Has a leftover of candy sugar in the finish together with aluminum. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Very average in all terms, ok, pretty standard.

Muffiger Belgianfruitycitrusearthsmell trifft saures Spezial Lager!!! Gar nicht so übel....war allerdings auch schon leicht benebelt ;)....Aus der 0,33 Buddel vernascht. Beim Sushifuttern nach den 2017er SPRING BOCK DAY... :)

0.33 bottle. Unexpectedly nice aroma as for a pale lager, mostly hop with corny accents and hints of apple-like smell. Dimmed golden color and a small white head on top, poor retention. Overall a surprisingly good pale lager, refreshing and highly drinkable.
Good lager overall, malty nose, some barley taste, finish dry and short. A refreshing beer for the hot weather. Best served chilled!

Japanese coors light. Yellow water. Works well, when cold, to wash down the soy sauce and wasabi.

Draft. Pale gold in color poured with a frothy white head. Light malt aroma with a sweet corn and light citrus flavoring. Light bodied. An average pale lager.

30-01-2018; bottle; at home (bought somewhere in The Netherlands).
The beer looks really simple. The color of the beer is a pale golden yellow. The beer is quite clear. It has a watery look. On top of the beer, a layer of rough white foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses quickly, leaving only a small drape. 
The smell isn’t very special. Just Asian beer. It has a malty sweet smell with a minimal hoppy bitterness. It misses kick and guts. It is a bit to mild to. It also has that rice beer thing...sweet but without kick.
The same goes for the taste. It has a malty sweetness and minimal bitter hop flavors. It’s like all Asian beers, a bit to sweet and not enough hops. Just as expected actually. Not a punishment to drink though. It still is beer. 
The palate of the beer is average. The body is light, the texture smooth and the carbonation medium. The finish of the beer contains quite some sweet malts/rice and some bitter touches of hops. All in all, a low average beer...
No aroma Looks like an el-cheapo gas station beer. Looks like urine in a cup. Bright white head with okay lacing. Sour palate. Gross.

Not interested in clocking up ticks, promised myself I’d only rate the really good ones. However, since they’re so widely available in Taipei, and since I actually worked in Japan for five years, I’ll rate this one just for fun. A bottle from Welcome supermarket. Aroma: sour bread. Appearance: clear amber, minimal head. Palate: light-bodied and thin. Average carbonation, abrupt, slightly bitter finish. Taste: a medium degree of bitterness. Drinkable on a hot day with a plate of yakitori, but nothing special. Not the best Japanese macro.

Aroma... nada demais

Brewed at Weihenstephan version. Gold colour, slightly hazy, some carbonation visible. Medium and pretty dense white head, scarce retention, enough lacing. Aroma is grainy/cereal with some background grassy and lemon notes. Taste follows the aroma with maybe the slightest hint of spiciness. Sweetness is moderate but bitterness is very low (just enough balance in the finish), thus the beer feels mild and delicate. Light body, average carbonation, smooth and delicate as already mentioned. Clean and easy, not that interesting.
Keg, Japan. Maybe on nitro. Pours pale yellow with a thick white foam residing. Scent is scentless. Taste is pale lager with light flowery notes. Finish is dry. Good.

can. Poured clear gold with a big frothy white head. Sweet cereal grain aroma. Light body, low carbonation, creamy-ish mouthfeel. Flavour of pale malts, hayish, peppery hops, with a lingering aftertaste.

bottle. Poured clear gold with a thin white head. Light malt aroma. Light body with fizzy carbonation. Flavour is mainly grainy, a touch citrusy, light dry finish.

Appearance : golden yellow average white foam
 Aroma : slightly bitter

Japan pale lager

Golden clear colour, white foam head, fades away in a second. Aroma is slightly bitter, hints of corn, some hops around, nothing special. Taste is lightly sweet, again, some corn and hops on it. Lots of carbonation, weak body, watery mouthfeel. Standard "big brand" lager on all specs, but not in a negative way. It’s just one more standard beer. Try it, but don’t expect anything special.

Bright pale straw color with lots of pearly activity. Foamy white 2 finger head, lasting around 5 minutes, with fiant lacing. Flavors of corn, sweet grains, rice, lemon, red liquorice. Good sharpness with lots of sugars, not too syrupy and doesn’t feel too adjunct. Slick and smooth medium body with prickly and crispy carbonation. Light finish, slightly dry rice feel, lingering roasted malts, and slightly skunky. Very crispy and the malt is of good quality. Accessible and refreshing in a hot summer day. Decent flavors, well intensified, and balanced. Overall good quality craft.

My favorite commercial beer in Japan. I’m not a connoisseur but it was ideal for noodle based dishes.

I’ve tried several Japanese macro lagers and they’re all very similar to other countries’ popular pale lagers. I’ve actually had Kirin Ichiban several times over the years (at hibachi and sushi restaurants) and I’ve never really been impressed. This particular edition is brewed in the United States by Anheuser-Busch, though trying to find a fresh bottle is a challenge. Despite it being all-malt, it’s a pretty boring lager. 



I poured a 12oz bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 8/22/15 and cost $1.29 ($0.11 per ounce).



Appearance: Beautiful golden hue; crystal clear with visible carbonation. Pours to a large, white, foamy head which retains and laces remarkably well.



Smell: Lightly sweet pale malt blend. Faint touch of floral hops, otherwise quite mild in the nose.



Taste: As I said, I’ve drank this beer many times, and one thing I’ve noticed is that it’s consistently inconsistent. Some bottles are much sweeter than others; some are tinny and dirty-tasting. This particular bottle was somewhere in the middle, in that it was more mild and bland than anything else. I will say I notice a bit of light malt, but it’s not especially delectable or particularly sweet. This is interesting, because I recently drank a year-old bomber of this beer at a sushi restaurant that was very sweet due to its age. Light-bodied pale lagers aren’t the types of beers you usually associate with aging well, but I can honestly say that year-old bottle was better than this remotely fresh one. To its credit, I don’t really find it repugnant at all. Just a touch of metallic sensation and maybe even a faint spicy hop presence. Its only crime is being not just dull, but extremely so.



Drinkability: At only 5% ABV, Kirin Ichiban is equivalent to Budweiser in potency, though it is not a complete fizz bomb. Mouthfeel is quite light and there’s a watery sensation to each swig. Slightly refreshing while in the mouth, which is nice, along with an almost completely clean aftertaste which is also nice. Though I use that term in a relative way.



RATING: 4/10

Pours slightly darker than Bud with a white head the leaves little lacing. The nose is faint cereal. The taste is malt-cereal. Better than a Bud. Thought I was buying a genuwine Japanese beer. But Noooo! A-B’s been brewing this since long before InBev. "Under the strict supervision of Kirin" Uh-huh, that’s why the ABV is higher. InBev has A-B brewing Beck’s. Come on. Despite all the science, there seems to be more than our present science understands. Big surprise since this is the historical record.
Draught. Pours golden yellow with small foamy head, little malt aroma, high carbonation, crisp dry taste, abrupt finish. A nice lager.
Espuma bem rala, uma cor amarelo comum, apenas comprei uma por ser uma cerveja do Japão.
Aroma of sweetish malt, grains, cardboard. Flavour is moderate sweet with a light bitter finish. Well I guess I’ve had worse Pale Lagers, at least this one is drinkable and has a hint of bitterness.

Pricey 500ml bottle. Pours gold with a soapy white head. Minimal lacing on the glass. Aroma of grain, some citrus and some cardboard. Low sweetness and low bitterness. Overall a crisp, clean lager that tastes better than most.

I usually only get this when I am eating sushi or something, so decided to buy it at the grocery store to give it a try in the comfort of my own home. Actually, I was going to cook with it, but elected to go with another beer so got stuck drinking this 24 oz. can tonight. Poured it into an oversized wine glass. Has a clear golden color, almost identical to the gold in their Kirin label. The aroma is a little skunky, but taste isn’t all that bad. Barley, malts, and other sugary flavors. A little metallic, but not too bad. The aftertaste is actually what saves this beer, smooth and sweet. Not too bitter as I would expect from the skunky aroma. Just recently found out owned by Anheiser, and brewed in California, so not really a Japanese beer. I totally agree about going with Sapporo instead. Might have to drink that next time I eat Sushi so I can get a fresh review in.
Clear light gold with frothy white head. Not sickly sweet, Yes! Nice malt character. Light dryness. Nothing off putting. Much better than most mass produced pale lagers I?ve had.
On tap at Sawatdee. For what it is a very good beer. Washes my Thai food and Sushi well. Update, still great with sushi. Try your breakfast stout with your yum yum rolls.
Nothing shines in this drap lager. Worthy of kestrel circa 1982. The aftertaste is similar to that obtained through chewing leather. Not up to their motor industry.
Voilà une bière absolument quelconque sans aucune personnalité. Content de l’avoir goûtée pour ne devoir à le faire.
Bottle. Pours light yellow. Aroma is malts and hay. Taste is light malts and a bit of citrus.

Poured from the large bomber size at a Japanese Steak House in Douglasville, GA. into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has that malt aroma that I remember well from my Marine days spent in Japan.
Appearance- Has a weak clear yellow color that reminds me of watered down Miller High Life.
Taste- This is purely a Japanese version of an American Macro Lager, it is ok at best.
Palate- This is a light bodied beer with moderate carbonation. Has a slight skunk finish to it.
Overall- Kirin Ichiban is not "number one" in my book when it comes to Japanese macros. I find Asahi and Orion to be far superior in flavor both in Japan and imported into the states.

Pours golden yellow with a short white head. Aroma is yeasty with a hint of rice, taste is slightly sweet, dry, with a hoppy finish. Overall a fine lager from Japan, way better than NL’s most produced beer ’Heineken’.

Bottle. Small white head not lasting. Clear pale yellow. Aroma is malty, grainy, sligthly fruity and citrus. Taste is grainy, sligthly malty with some sweetness and acidity. Ligth body, sligthly sparklin. Easy to drink.

This beer is brewed by Weihenstephan in Bavaria. Well known for its fantastic Wheat Beers that count certainly among the best in the world. But this beer is the proof that technical expertise and high tech equipment can’t egalize a bad receipe. This beer is flat, has no character, the taste is too fizzy with a ginger aleish side taste. OK, there is hops and a subtle bitterness. But that’s far too little to be called ’Beer at its purest’... Still, it’s marked on the can. Sorry guys, back to school!
>>This Japanese beer? Give me a Saké!<< that was my verdict for the Sapporo. This one is worse! Give me a Sapporo!!!!

Can from anywhere in Tokyo. Had this at many a hanami party. One of the better Japanese macro lagers. Slight malty aroma. Grainy taste with rice also noticeable. Palate has some sweetness and a dry, crisp finish.
Fľaša. Zlatá farba, biela pena. Vôňa trávová, železitá, umelá. Chuť práznejšia, sladká, kukuričná. Opäť jemná železitosť a trávovosť. Slabá horká dochuť.

Bottle 0.33l at Beerville Beer shop Belgrade Serbia.Ciao Vlada! Pour it golden color little bit hazy with small white head.On the nose funky malt.Taste and aroma of sweet, sour, kick watery.Plum on the back.Not so bad

Draft in NYC, accompanying some amazing Korean fried chicken. Sweet, pale malt. A little rice sharpness. Great fit for food. A bit bitter in middle, sweet up front, and finishes plenty clean. Pretty fine.
Pours pale golden topped with a thin white head. Subdued aroma of barely and grains. Taste is of cereal. Relatively thin mouthfeel with a sweet finish.

Golden colour with a small white head. Aromas of straw, barnyard, some hay and some maltyness arises. Light carbonation, thin texture, light body. Brief malt, bready sweetness offers a clear hoppy bitterness which lasts only for a moment. Short finish.
Earlier Rating: 10/31/2012 Total Score: 1.7
Average golden lager colour with a fast fading white head. Aroma develops notes of wet paper, hints of straw and some malt. Light prickling on the tongue but fades quickly to flatness. Light-medium body, slick texture. Bitter-sweet. Finish is dry and short-medium.

Pours a crystal clear yellow. Visible carbonation yields a white head that vanishes immediately. Weak bread aroma. Taste is light with a bit of sweet malt. No real hop notes anywhere. Drinkable without flaws.
Sweeter than a standard lager. Notes of grain, rice, corn and faint citrus. Well carbonated.

I was surprised by this beer. Even though it is a japenese one I still have only two eyes and no tentacles, no Fukushima damages in brewery!. Out of jokes, it is a good lager which I encourage you to taste.

0.33l bottle. Clear pale golden body, thin white head. Aroma and taste of bready, grainy malts and floral hops. Minimal cardboard, but not super bad. Quite dry beer with weak body. Nothing extraordinary here, but nothing horrible either.

Bottle from Seoul Plaza. Brewed and bottled in Weihenstephan, Freising. Clear golden colour, quite stable head - probably resulting from heavy use of hop extracts. Overpasteurised aroma, raw grainy notes, metallic extract. Taste confirms everything from aroma and adds a thing or two of its own. Unpleasant metallic twang, raw grainy taste, only faint notes of what might have once been hops. Astringent. Lowly industrial beer prototype.

Una normale lager da pasto ma con un tocco orientale? Questa birra nipponica, prodotta in Germania in realtà, non ha molto di diverso da tante lager industriali. Bionda, lucente e con schiuma fine, malto e un po’ di luppolo come tutte quelle nel genere, retrogusto amarognolo, corpo molto leggero. Debole di aroma e sapore, si può bere sul momento ma non la sceglierei di certo tra tante.

Used this one to cook some beer, mixed 50-50 with Carolus Tripel so hopefully the dish won’t be ruined. Pours a clear pale gold with a rachitic white rim that leaves some lacing. Nose is of cereals and adjuncts, not too bad. Taste is of lightly sweet cereals and not hoppy at all indeed. Slight husky feel in the finish. Body is light and carbonation medium-high. Overall it wasn’t too bad but I won’t come back to it for sure.
pale yellow colour, minimal white head; aroma of some grain, cardboard and buttery notes; horrible taste of artificial metallic-cardbord notes and some butter again; really disappointing lager

golden yellow. sparkly. minimal head. light hint of rice/grain on the nose. simple lager flavor. some sweetness, but really not much flavor, other than moderate bitterness. an above average beginner (low end) beer.

Light retention and no lacing. Smells of grass, sweet biscuit and lemon. Tastes of lemon grass and malty grain. Yeasty aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
How: bottle Appearance: pale yellow, medium white head. Aroma: grass, floral tones Palate: average carbonation, thin body.

24 oz can spilt with the wife while eating sushi. Pours light straw gold, translucent, thin white head. Mild grain nose. Taste is balanced, has a light grassy note.light mouth that feels slightly chewy.

Aparência: rótulo chamativo; espuma fugaz; coloração dourada translúcida. Aroma: comum. Sabor: adocicada, não como uma Malzbier, mas diferente; será o arroz? Só para conhecer, não troco uma Heineken por ela.
Finest barley malt, premium hops, smooth finish, no bitter aftertaste. Tastes just like Budweiser.

I was excited at first. But wait, it’s an A-B product? Whether in whole or in part, it’s not exactly what you want from a beer that you think is an import. That’s one strike before the bottle is opened. 

It pours with a thin head. Not much of an aroma, a little citrusy, a little spicy, but that’s about all. The color is a little lighter than I excpected, not quite straw, but not amber. 

First sip is actually pretty good, but after a couple, it becomes slightly bitter, and not in a good way. It has a heavy mouthfeel, somewhat strange.

Interesting. The label and the name is what caught my eye. Worthy enough to try, but not to buy again,
Draught at Moshimo, Brighton. Clear golden with a small white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Quite bitter. Malts, yeast and grain. A mediocre lager.

Classica lager, tra le giapponesi commerciali forse la migliore, anche se di poco corpo, con pochi esteri tutti molto volatili. La beverinità rimane comunque discreta. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85

Bottle, 0.33l. Clear golden color with medium frothy white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of cereals, grass and citrus. Tastes light sweet grainy with bready sourness, somehow feels like it’s thinned by rice, while finish is mild bitter. Light body, slick texture and lively carbonation in palate. Just an average lager...

Poured from a 12oz bottle into a Pilsner glass. When I smelled the mouth of the emptied bottle, all I could smell was skunk. Not sure if this bottle was on the store shelf too long or if every batch is this stinky. I swirled the glass a little and tried out my sniffer one more time. I could still smell skunk, but a hint of breadlines was there this time. This brew looked appealing--golden and fizzy. It took a few minutes for the white, one-inch head to recede to a thin white sheet of fine bubbles floating atop the brew. When the beer first hit my tongue, I was fooled into thinking I’d have a refreshing, slightly sweet pale lager to enjoy. Brew had a slight bready sweetness on the tip of the tongue, but when it flowed through the rest of my mouth it tasted like I was licking the inside of a wet cardboard box. Mouthfeel was a tad richer than I expected after the initial fizziness of each sip dissipated. I would count the tiny bit of unexpected richness as a plus. Overall, I very much hated this brew and I would definitely never give it a second chance unless I knew the first one I drank was defective or old. I don’t know how I can recommend a beer that smells like skunk and tastes like cardboard.

"Never turn your back on your beer."

Pours a clear straw colour with a huge white head. Aroma includes notes of apple, pear, and cereals. Tasting notes include apple, and watery malts. The palette is very thin and watery, the finish is similar to tap water.
From a can. Pours clear amber with a medium head, not much in the way of aroma or flavour for that matter.

Light straw grain aroma. Faint whiff of spice I can’t nail down. Crystal clear straw yellow body. Very little if any head to start or finish. Mild bitterness gives way to sweet corn finish. Finish is clean.
Premium lager com sabor que lembra a Stella Artois só que mais "Aguada". Pouco Sabor. Nada de especial.
Mild floral and citrus aroma. Bitterness is a bit metallic and some more maltiness is needed to give balance to the bitterness. It is dry and light but could have done with more carbonation.
Brilliant straw colour with thick persistent white head. Faint herbal aroma. Thin bodied. Quite dry. Slightly grainy taste. Clean. Looks better than it tastes.
La lager japonaise à la meilleure rondeur à mon goût et de celles que je connais, ce qui reste limité en soi.

Bottle at Sushi-Place in Paris. Typical pale color with a minimal rocky head. Not much aroma on the nose, slightly hoppy somewhat malty with bready notes. Taste is medium bitter and gets stronger on way till the finish. There are some slight fruity hop notes. The body is light with lively carbonation. Surprisingly ok for a major lager brand.
Golden color with a small white head. Taste and aroma of hops. Medium body. Not that impressive.

- Alcoholpercentage van 4,9%
- Biertje gedronken destijds dat me niet kon bekoren
- Kan me veel lekkerder biertjes voorstellen, maar kan met mijn smaakvoorstelling te maken hebben
- Vandaar mijn lage beoordeling

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Bottle, Wagamama, Amsterdam, 22 Aug 2014) Pale golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, neutral nose with notes of bread, rice and cereal. Malty, clean taste with cereal, bread, rice and a dry finish with low bitterness. Rather thin and dry. Flawless, but quite boring.
From bottle. Golden colour. Extremely average lager. Nothing wrong with it. Sort of makes sense in a Japanese restaurant.
Light style brewed with rice, a great sessionable beer got a warm day, one of favorite japanese brews

This was surprisingly decent. Maybe because I was drinking it accompanied by delicious eats at Benihana. Pale gold beer with lively carbonation and a fluffy, white head. Aromas of grains and barley. Tastes of sweet cereal grains, corn mash, and sweet malt. Decent balancing of flavors for the style. Bittersweet finish. Refreshing.
330ml bottle. Pale yellow lager with decent whie head. Smooth, balanced and flavoursome - barley malt falvour. Decent, drinkable and inoffensive beer but nothing special by any stretch
It poured a clear golden color with a white head. The aroma was of light grain and malts. The taste was lightly sweet and bitter.
Licht geel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig, echter nogal waterig en weinig smaak. Blijft niet lang hangen.

Aroma fraco, malte quase imperceptível e lúpulo inexistente. Amarelo dourado e translúcido, além de formação média de espuma. No paladar, leve malte e uma mistura de amargor com oxidação. É uma cerveja que apenas serve pra refrescar, tomando bem gelada, mas tem um custo benefício baixo.
Dark yellow with medium off-white head. Aroma is grain, hops and wheat. Taste is malt and wheat.

Can @ some Japanese joint in DC. Anyway, why is there a 5% version split from this? Crazy. Pours gold with a large thick white head. Pretty damn attractive to be honest. Nose of croissant, honeycomb, spent grain. The usual. Not overly sweet or filled with noxious artificial apple accents, which is a good thing. Relatively robust bread and honeyed pear flavor. Pretty good for what it is. Crisp and not overly sugary on the finish. Eminently drinkable. Overall, gets the job done. I put down a 25oz can, so I can’t complain.
33 cl bottle from supermarket in Spain. Enjoyed straight from the bottle. Colour is golden. Had this poolside in sunny Spain. Did work. But I guess any beer had.

can’t really "taste the wort", but i don’t exactly know what i’m looking for either. tastes ever so slightly better than your typical american macro lager. crisp and clean, slightly drier finish. ok with sushi."

330ml can served in an ordinary glass @ Wasabi restaurant, Geneva
A: Pours a clear yellow (golden) color forming a medium bubbled and aired white head. Low retention and many thin lacings left in the glass. 
S: Sweet pale malts, corn and rice followed by flowery and grassy hops. 
T: Sightly sweet upfront. Very malty. Strong nptes of pale malts and grassy hops. Citrus and skunky. In overall, a dry and crispy taste followed by a considerable hops bitterness. 
M: Extremely light body with strong carbonation. Grassy bitterness in the aftertaste
O: Well... Refreshing.
[ BA Review @ 12/23/2011 ]
Bouteille de 650ml de blonde peu effervescence. Arôme de malt. Au gout notes de malt, petite amertume et notes sucré.
On draught. Aroma of bean and has that wet stone whiff too. Looks OK, nice white lacy head, a little palid. Watery and a little insipid.

Pale lager de 5% abv, qui porte bien son nom puisque sa couleur est jaune très 
pâle comme un soleil d’hiver …
Clarté pure. Bulles assez fines. Mousse blanche qui retombe vite.
Arômes de citron, citron vert, pain mouillé.
1ère bouche liquide sur des agrumes et du piment aigre !!
Le tout évolue en eau de lessive...
2ème sur la pils allemande.
3ème sur la pils tchèque, et la pastèque.
Sur la longueur, rien. 
L’alcool est nul.
CONCLUSION : l’empire du soleil plat. Il est vrai que c’est une pils...
Can 0.5 l. Golden color, small-medium head. In aroma boring metal, grass profile. In flavor almost the same but with some grains/malt. Just boring.

Taste like japanese version of bud light/ miller light. Golden blonde color with limited aroma. Clear pour with medium carbonation. You can see the bubbles rising in the pint glass. Smooth finish that makes this beer worth a taste especially on a sushi outing!
Light straw color; Light to medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, & subtle fruit/floral; Flavor of sweet malt, grain, and light hops; Palate is fairly light; Not too bad - has some character.
Yup, this is a Kirin Ichiban. Typical Japanese lager plus a hint of hop bitterness. Still better than BMC, but not by much.

floral, amber, clear, minimal head, lightly bitter, light sweetness, light body, thin feel, lively, 
wasn’t very good to be honest
easy drinkable water with notes of beer and honey. Sweetish with notes of bit synthetic fruitiness. Drinkable , but only use as thirst quencher.

33cl bottle. Clear golden colour with a thin white head, not so persistent. Grain and malty aroma. Average carbonation and light watery body. Taste is light bitter. Overall, a regular lager with nothing remarkable about it.
Earlier Rating: 2/10/2013 Total Score: 2.8
Long times we spent in Japan drinking Kirin. A rather simple lager for a friends reunion or a normal meal.

Bottle. Appearance: 1 finger white head, clear, straw yellow color. Aroma: floral, biscuits, light caramel. Palate: light body, average carbonation, thin texture. Taste: sweet malt throughout, light lemon citrus at the front of the beer. Overall, basic and drinkable.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 1C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: sweet and grainy (corn like) malt aroma. very faint hop aromas. APPEARANCE: gold color and very clear. thin white head with low persistance. TASTE: dry flavour with low malt sweetness. low bitterness. PALATE: thin body with low carbonation. OVERALL: yet another diluted pale lager that doesnt impress.

Eine schöne weisse Schaumkrone thront kompackt auf dem klaren, hellgoldgelben Bier. Ein eher schwacher Duft steigt in die Nase. Der erste Schluck fliesst locker, leicht, mit einem Hauch von Bitterheit und Süsse die Kehle hinunter. Prickelnd wird der Gaumen umspielt. Kurz spührt man leicht etwas Metallisches. Der Abgang ist wiederum etwas bittersüss. Der Nachhall ist angenehm. Alles in allem kein schlechtes Bier!
330 mml bottle tasted on 05/09/2014. Light yellow colour with a low white and bubble head. Taste is watery with cereals. The best is the label and the glass. Next one please!
Light, easy drinking with decidedly malty backbone. Slight acidity takes away from the overall experience. No detectable bitterness.

Pint on draught at Extra Virgin Pizza, Singapore. Good head and carbonation. Nice golden amber colour. Light malt, but not much else on the palate. Close to a pretty standard commercial pilsner, but a good effort. Safe choice.
light yellow water beer with aroma malt and wheat,small white heading disappeared quickly,heavy bitterness
630ml bottle, was expecting much more, very pale gold colour with a fluffy brief head, the aroma is bigger than the watery mildly hoppy taste
Regular , boring lager. Pale golden color , malty aroma and taste . Sweet with minimal bitterness.

0,33l bottle at Hanil Sushi in Wien 18. Tasty, pleasant bitterness. Refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours light golden, very clear with small white head. Faint malt aroma and taste, low bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hops right front of me, malty, beautiful gold yellow color, little head retention, lack of foam. Very malty taste. Nice presentation with beautiful design on the label. Lager beer.
Bottle into a larger glass. Aroma is weak malt. Pour is a light yellow. Taste is very light. Finish is clean. High end bud, nothing high end here.
Golden colour with medium fast-disappearing head. Malty aroma. Medium hops in aftertaste.

Meh this was gross. I was getting some sushi and thought what the hell I’ll try it. Wet cardboard and paper. Cream corn grass staleness. Not the best aromas. Taste is bearable but not that great. Taste is not its strong suit. Overall won’t be trying this again.
Bottle. Golden color with with white head. Malty aroma. Some hops in aftertaste. Regular lager.

Normal lager color taste and aroma. Maybe a bit softer than an European lager, a bit more citric taste and bitter aftertaste. Also, slightly lighter in the color. But again, nothing catchy, just a lager

Botella de 330ml. Copa Pilsner. Color pajizo pálido y cristalino. Espuma blanca y corona que disipa lentamente. Olores de grano, sulfuro, paño húmedo y cartón. Entrada chispeante, con sabor de grano y trazos de miel. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación moderadamente alta. Textura aguada y sensación reseca. Amargor áspero y final seco.
330ml bottle. Footed Pilsner glass. Pale straw color, clear appearance. White froth, slowly dissipated crown. Grain, sulfur, wet cloth & cardboard odors. Sparkling, cereal & hints of honey. Light body. Moderately high carbonation. Watery texture & dried sensation. Harsh bitterness, dry finish.
Tastes like lager. Cooled me down well enough, but that?s all. Only bought due to limited menu.
On draft. Clear golden color with little head. Grainy aroma. Taste is grainy too and nothing special. Is drinkable enough.
Bottle with sushi. Pale yellow, small white head, gone. The aroma and flavor have corn, grains, not much else, but it doesn’t interfere with my dinner.

Reviewed from notes. 
This was poured into a pint glass and a pilsener various times and has always shown the same qualities. 
The appearance had a nice light yellow clear color with a light half finger-ed white foamy head that dissipated within about thirty seconds. There wasn’t any lacing. 
The smell had some light sweet corn with a slight breadiness in it but coming off really light.
The taste was mainly sweet through the corn and bready notes.
On the palate, this one sat exceptionally light and was pretty sessionable. The carbonation was good for the style and for me. 
Overall, I say this was a pretty good pale lager worthy of having again.
Yellow pour with a fast dissipating white head. regular macro lager, some grainy aroma and flavour but overall fairly thin.
Average lager, smooth, easy to drink. Has golden color with white head that lasts. Average carbonation, nice on tongue, does not bite. No long lasting after taste. . Nice summery lager
(Bottle). Slightly sweet aroma and taste of malt and grassy hops. The taste is quite thin, vaguely dry finish.
Had this in the Okura Hotel Japanes Restaurant in Amsterdam. Really a tastey one-sided Lager beer. Very rewarding tough it has a simple taste.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Pours a very pale yellow with a pure white head. The smell is grain and mild malt sweetness. The taste is light sweet malt, grain with a somewhat crisp dry ending. Light in body with average carbonation.
600ml bottle from Charter Mall supermarket, Chongqing Lu, Changchun, Jilin Province, China. Medium yellow, no great aroma, some body, little aftertaste. Not great.

Review: Can of Kirin Ichiban Pale Lager, 5%ABV

Kirin Ichiban, my first time having a Japanese beer, was impressive on its first showing. In general it was pretty nice and quite drinkable

On pouring, the appearance was of a pale yellow colour with a very big creamy head that lingers for some time, and leaves a bit of lacing on the glass. Had a nice look to it.

Aroma: A pleasant sweet smell of a light grain and malt aroma.

A nice light beer to drink and went down easy enough. The taste had some initial sweetness followed by a very enjoyable bitter aftertaste of hops, kind of creamy. Tastes of hay, wheat, and light floral hops. A good clean, crisp beer, smooth, I liked it. Recommended for someone who is looking for a nice light beer to relax with
Bottle at Sumo, Den Haag. Pours clear golden with a bubbly white head. Light grain and malt aroma. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Pours clear light yellow with large white foamy head. Aroma is malt, grain and grass. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is watery and refreshing with good carbonation. Finish is short with few notes but malt.
Pours a light clear golden color with white head. Typical lager flavors on this one, mainly just cereal grain on the nose and palate.

22 FL OZ ($3.30) This is a very light tasting beer and goes down like water. Its not bad but I prefer some taste to my beer. I’ve come to expect all lager to be pretty much watered down beer. nothing too intense and I don’t recommend this one.

On tap with my brew goblin. Better than any macro brew in North America. Tastes of hay, wheat, and light floral hops. Not a bad body on it for a lager and a good white head. Taste is crisp and clean, quite a refreshing lager.
Pale golden color with white head. Hops and cereals on the aroma. Bitter taste, with hop presence. Refreshing.

helder gouden met minimale witte kraag. aroma van mout en graan. smaken zijn redelijk zoet, matig bitter, matig sterk, pilsmouten, citrus en graan, verder een lichte body, gald en dun en ietwat droge afdronk. Ook deze als Japans bier is te drinken, echter moet ik wel zeggen dat deze minder is dan de Asahi.
500 ml bottle. Clear light golden with white head. Smell is lager yeast and some malt. Taste is sweet and a bit citrus. Low bitterness and a bit watery.
Light straw color.  Light grassy to no aroma.  Light body.  Just what you'd expect from a light lager...light, light, light.  Nice with sushi.

The smooth taste and mild aroma goes perfect with sushi. Otherwise, hyst a regular lager.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650 ml bottle from LCBO. Toronto, ON. Pours a straw colour with a small white head. In the beginning the taste is malty which leads to a well balanced hoppy finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Keg looking glass Leicester. Straw colour thin head. Aroma is pale malts. Taste same light bitterness. Medium body soft carbonated. Good lager.

Bouteille de 633 ml (5% ABV) achetée dans une SAQ. Brassée le 7 janvier 2003 par Anheuser-Bush. Dégustée le 10 avril 2005. Bière blonde limpide. Mousse assez, col moyen, grossier, durable. Peu effervescente, bulles moyennes. Légère odeur de céréales et de sucre. Douce, assez sucrée, amère en finale. Bonne mais manque un peu de saveur.
Can pour. Clear gold. Small straw nose. Sweet corn. Light body. Basic malts. Grassy. Drinkable.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle marked 07JAN14 so this may be a bit old. Yellow pour that explodes to a white fizzy, lingering head. Looks right on for the style. For a brown bottle that smells pretty skunky unfortunately. But sticking my nose deeper into the mix I pick up a decent enough toasted biscuit malt character and clean hop balance. The light and refreshing body is where it should be for the style. The taste picks things up a hair with a solid roasted malt character taking over everything and a clean, crisp finish. I would drink first this one over certain other American Pale Lagers
Tap. Clear, golden, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, light body, average carbonation, & abrupt finish.

A highlight in aroma, taste and body is shown in this fine beer. maybe they matured it a bit longer, or used a different brewing process, thing is, japanese beers like this one is a surprise to the senses.
Earlier Rating: 11/5/2013 Total Score: 3.7
 A crispy, delicious and fine Japanese beer. It has a malty aroma, like cereal and hay. Also, a good body, good blond color, fuzzy and good foam. It tastes really good, sweeter than bitter. Good job Japan.

Earlier Rating: 4/5/2010 Total Score: 2.1
0,33 literes, üveges kiszerelés a Kapy utcai Koreai-Japán boltból. Kis habja hamar tovaszáll a kissé opálos világos arany testről. Illata citrusosan malátás, szájban pedig főleg gyümölcsös. Lenyelve egyszerre malátás és keserűen komlós is. Összességében egy átlag nagyüzemi lágernél kicsit gyengébben teljesít.
royal piss... boring and watery.. too sweet.. no dragons or mythical creatures in here..

Bottle, pours golden with a thin white head, slightly sweet with a bitter finish, not that great

Had on tap at the only Thai restaurant in town. Was $3 for the full pint. Pours a dark yellow with which a quickly-diminishing off-white head half a finger in length stood. Experienced rice malt, noble hops, and wheat grain. Pretty straightforward. Good for a hot day, may even surpass lemonade. Swishable.

Sehr mild, wässrig. leicht grasig-zitronig im aroma, etwas hopfen und malz auf der zunge.

350ml tinnie imported from Japan (I believe it is also brewed in Australia under licence). Clear bright gold with a transient medium-sized white head that laces minimally. Not much on the nose apart from sweet grainy malts. Mouthfeel is watery and flat with honey sweet malt flavours and a low hop bitterness. Your standard uncomplicated Asian lager.
Bottle. Pours golden with medium head that fades quickly. Initially sweet taste with long bitter aftertaste.

Cerveja clara, fraca, muito parecida com as blonds.... e semelhante com as nacionais ... Custo benefício muito bom.......vale a pena

Bottle. Pours clear light golden color with large head. Crisp aroma that is very hoppy. Light body with very light watery taste.

22oz can. Pours fizzy yellow with a foamy white head. Grainy aroma. Light bodied with slightly sweet finish. Watery. Sweet flavor with subtle grain notes. Pretty standard among fizzy yellow beer. More flavor than light beer though.
From the archives: simple pale lager, rather dry. Nothing special. Good among Japan beers though.
Pours pale golden with slight head. Mild hop-like aroma. Very slight bitterness on the finish. Typical Asian beer.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass.

Appearance: pours a 1+" white head which quickly recedes with little to no lacing. Color is clear pale straw with moderate streaming carbonation.

Aroma: yeasty bread dough, lightly toasted barley malt and some grassy/herbal hop.

Mouthfeel: light and slick with a quite dry finish.

Flavor: cracker, sweet barley malt, grassiness, bitter herbs.

Overall: a decent and enjoyable lager, but not outstanding.

50 cl. can. Brewed by Weihenstephan. Clear, golden colour with a big, fluffy white head. Sweet aroma with hay, grasses, grain, some pale malts. Taste is light bitter. Medium body with a slick texture and a lively carbonation. Finishes dry and lightly bitter with grasses and hay. Okay Lager, works fine with my sushi.
12oz bottle puts a clear yellow amber. Aroma is a unique light malt with hints of melon. Flavor is slightly sweet. Not bad.

Aroma: Corn

Appearance: Clear Golden Straw Hue, Passes All Light, White Head, No Lacing

Taste: Corn, Water, Sweet Malts

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Semi Sweet

Nice, clear beer with a firm foamy top. A slightly hop-like aroma, but not to much. It tastes a bit "umami", which is unusual for a lager. It has a somewhat bitter palate, but doesn’t last long.

Mooi, helder pils met een mooie witte kraag. Een lichte hoppigheid in het aroma, maar niet overheersend. Aardige metaalsmaak, wat voor een pils ongebruikelijk is. Iets bittere nasmaak, maar vervliegt snel.

There is nothing to this brew. It is aroma-less, looks pale bordering on clear and tastes thin. The finish is slightly floral, short, and probably the cleanest I have ever tasted. This is not necessarily a good thing as there is absolutely nothing memorable about Kirin Ichiban.

Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en un Tesco de Londres. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, muy suave, con un ligerisimo toque citrico.

Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Carrefour de Camas. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, muy suave.
Backlog. Tried it bottled. Just your standard mass-produced lager. Nothing to get excited about.

Very clear pale body with low head. Aroma is light malty, fruity, pretty weak. Taste is very light sweetness with light earthy bitterness. Nothing in the taste, nothing in the palate. High carbonation makes it at the drinkability higher, body is medium.
Pours clear gold with a small fluffy white head. Aroma is grass, citrus and hay. Taste is sweet and crisp. Light bodied and inoffensive. Good with Hibachi!

I drink this when I go to my favorite Japanese kitchen. Not every time, but more frequently. The other option is Sake, which has been wearing on me since all I taste anymore is wallpaper glue and alcohol. So I drink Kirin for the carbonation and sweetness. Some times it’s brash and corny (you can call that crispy), but lately it’s been more "smooth", as people say. It’s not Coors-level lager, at least. The malt is a bit wonky and a corn note is noted, the rice cake and saccharine resemblance is there, but it’s not all that dirty. Light body, medium sweetness, medium-low bitterness, some times carbonic. It isn’t good enough to buy anywhere else, but it is good enough to buy for the bubbly neutral accompaniment to food.
My favorite bottled lager. Nice, subtle hop bitterness. Perfect accompaniment for sushi

Ce liquide est à mille années lumières d'une bière de dégustation. Même comme bière de soif, elle n'a pas la côté. Ça pis une Molson Dry, il n'a pas de différence! Désolé pour les insultes à la Molson Dry.
Bue en bouteille. Bière plutôt fade, très peu de corps, faible présence d’alcool. Blodne type pils sans intérêt ni arôme particulier mais pas non plus désagréable à boire.
Pours piss-golden with a fairly large head. Sweet aroma. Manages to be a fairly inoffensive lager beer.
This beer is very filling has a cheap taste also bitter very very strong I’m good with just two.
Bottle. Clear gold. Lemony and malty aroma, bitter with sweetish undertones in the mouth, light-bodied, very carbonated and slightly bitter malty finish. Weird.
bottle bought at speciaalbierpakket. poured a yellow colour with a white head. corns, malts, watery, sweet and metallic, it’s ok but I wouldn’t buy it again
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht malzig, getreidig, leicht süß. Geschmack leicht malzig getreidig, minimal herb.

330ml bottle. Color of lemonade, no actually apple juice. Small head. Rice in aroma. Rice and grass in taste. (I shared it with my friend Ares and let him to do that rating. He does not fancy a beer, but I’m amazed that our numbers are not that much different)  My numbers 3+2+3+2+5=1.5

330ml bottle. Label says its brewed in Germany. Pale yellow color. Very little white head. Some grass and grain in aroma. Somewhat malty, sweet, corn taste. Very smooth to drink.

330ml bottle (?, Tallinn) (4:2:3:2:6=1.7)
Sweet pale lager. Horribly pale, tight head. Watery, fizzy. Pretty nasty harsh chemical bitterness. Not good, do not like.
En helt ordinær lager både i farge, smak og lukt. Fikk denne til sushi og det var helt greit, sikkert god på en varm sommerdag også - men ikke verdt polprisen...

Bottle. Pale golden body, tall steady head. Aroma has soft malt and sweet hops. Light and sweet malty taste. A thin and sweet lager which probably goes well with certain kinds of foods. It’s really more German than Asian.

Bottle, 5,0%. Made in Kaliningrad, Russia. Golden, light head. Citric aroma. Taste is light fruity (apple), not much malt. At least there is not too much cardboard in the taste either. Sweet watery mess.
Was the only choice at a sushi restaurant, light, tasteless Japanese lager. Absolutely forgettable beer.

Kirin’s Prime Brew, Kirin Beer, Brewed for Good times. Pours from the can a light clear yellow with a full white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of hay and grains, light sweat. Taste is hay, grains, very slightly bitter. Full carbonation. Thin mouthfeel. Easy to drink but nothing special. Purchased at a Food Mart in Narita.

Clear golden appearance with medium to low head. Malty aroma, sweet, average pale lager body. Overall decent.
