Clear golden appearance with medium head. Malty aroma, sweet, decent body for a pale lager. Overall satisfying.
I thought this Lager was really good. Had a fruity taste and aroma. Very easy drinking beer. Went well with Mt HuHot.
grassy aroma, appear pale without head. taste light bitter, a thin palate with average carbonation

Can, 50cl. Pours light pale, golden color with a airy head which quicky vanish. Aroma is weak, malty, some grain and little hops. Malt, hay and slight bitter/sourness to its end. Thin body - average carbonation. Typical mass produced lager. Nothing wrong with it per se, just boring.

Aroma: Clean but definite fruity/slight solvent aroma - hops? yeast? both?

Appearance: Brilliant, dark straw/light golden

Taste: nicely balanced - light malt flavor along with clean, noble hop flavor ending with a cleansing pleasant bitterness on the finish

Palate: medium mouthfeel, medium-high carbonation, nice balance of sweetness blended with hop flavor mid-palate, then finishing nice and dry with a delicate bitterness

Overall: A great beer to drink with practically any food, but especially spicy, flavorful Asian cuisine. Great light lager, gives you some excellent yet delicate malt and hop flavor, cleans the palate, and gets the f^$% out of the way. Also an excellent choice on a hot day, and is likely to be well received by the BMC crowd that’s curious about all of those high-falutin’ craft beers they’ve been hearing about.
Pours a clear gold with a small white head. Nice floral aroma, corn, dme and some pale malts. Taste is the same with a dry finish. Crisp and clean and better than most North American macro lagers.
Not bad, but nothing special either. A regular lager. Some extra points because of the nice bottle.
0.3 flaske sea side gdansk. Gyllen med hvit skum som varer. Aroma av gress. Smak ikke noen ting. Pils på ditt tynneste
I wouldn’t moan if I was given it on a hot day but I won’t be buying it again.
It’s a malt beer, but not nearly as bad as some ratings I’ve read. No skunk, no sweat. Actually, depending on the pour, it can produce a head. Reminds me of a Stella. Went well with Sushi.

12oz bottle pours clear pale gold with a finger of head. Nose is grain, cereal, corn, the tiniest hint of citrusy lemon just barely in there. Taste is sinilar with a lasting cereal grain and corn finish. Not offensive, but not good.

On tap @ Prince of Wales, Bromham. Unappealing colour: lager yellow. Nice bubbles, running upwards in the glass like lemmings in reverse. Minimal head. Aroma is mild skunk and sweat. At this point I can barely control my rage, then I taste it. Malty and strongly alcoholic. Aftertaste from hell: a mixture of citrus and Bisto and sick. Bubbly palette helps me get through it, and to be fair it gets slightly better over the course of the pint.

Appearance: Clear golden color with a white head. Ok lacing.
Aroma: Mild malty and mild hoppy.
Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a moderate bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Mild caramel malty and mild hoppy.
Overall impression: Plain pale lager. Not bad, not good either.
Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden

Bottle 330ml. Brewed & bottled by Wells & Young’s (UK). Well, this was a nice surprise. Golden color with white average sized white head. Aroma of malt, apples, bread, some fruitiness. Sweet and fruity, malt, rice. Light body, average to high carbonation. Not bad, not bad at all.
Very light and refreshing beer. Hight carbonation. There is nothing special. Good for a hot day.
botella de 33 cl. una rubia de producción industrial sin nada destacable. tomada en Japón
Muy buena lager, se siente muy limpia en el paladar, aroma sutil y sin embargo se nota la presencia de malta, cambió mi perspectiva de las cervezas japonesas, mucho mejor que Sapporo en mi opinión

A light body lager , yellow color plain fairly refreshing with rice malt flavor. An average beer

pours a straw yellow with a small white head. the aroma is rice, water, wet grass, malts. the taste is the same. bland.

No idea how often I wound up drinking this beer at izakayas over the years, it is remarkable in it’s consistency always the same golden yellow pour with a fluffy eggshell white head. Mild grassy aroma and fairly inoffensive body + flavor. A typical mass market lager.

Light grain, slight sourish tinge, hint of fruits. Better than the American macro counterparts. Served in an ices mug. No other option. Eh.

clear light yellow pilsner pour with smooth white head, straw aroma, taste is malty mostly. Dosent taste that great at all.

Very nice lager beer. Mild aroma of citrus hops. Light golden color with white quite high head. I think it’s both a little bit sweet and bitter in taste. Light body with a long finish. Feels good in mouth. Enjoyable!
Bottle at random japenees restaurant in Camden. Pale yellow colour with a fleeting white head. Aroma is corn and chalky. Flavour is stale pale malt and some mineral in the water. Mostly very dull.

Another Asian lager, which are in general pretty nice and quite drinkable. And Kirin is no exception to this.
Pours with a clear golden color and an average white foamy head.
There are grassy hops in the aroma, which is slightly dusty but otherwise pretty weak. 
There is some initial sweetness followed by a very pleasant bitter hoppiness. The aftertaste is also slightly bittery which is all very nice and enjoyable. A nice effort.
12oz bottle - pours pale gold with white head. Nose is rice and grass. malty like weak malt liquor. Steel Reserve cut with water.

Decent, but I felt it was a bit weak despite still having a distinct taste. Maybe more an issue with alcohol content than the ingredients themselves. Unsurprisingly, it pairs well with sushi and may work with other Japanese foods as well.

Bière couleur de blé, limpide et où flotte un fin col mousseux éphémère laissant au verre une infime dentelle. Au nez, de très légers arômes de pâte à pain, de malt fruité et de miel. Bottle from B&M; clear light yellow pilsner pour with smooth white head, straw aroma, taste is malty corny a hint of sweet honey wild carbonation.
Bottle 0.33l. Pours clear golden with low head. Aroma is malt, slightly metallic. Taste is medium sweet, low bitterness, grains, malt, corn. Drinkable but flat and boring.

33cl Can from AH XL. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of citrus, grain, paper, hops, straw, some swamp. Flavour is medium-sweet, light malty, grainy, light-bitter finish. Light-bodied. OK-ish.

Bottle @ Sushi bar. Nice tasteful lager, sweet nutty notes with a nice hoppy finish. Clean and crisp.

Good drinking beer. Nothing special but nothing wrong with it.

Pours slightly darker than the average pale lager, with a thin, white head that quickly fades into nothing. Aromas on the nose are faint, and anonymous, as most pale lagers. Aromas on the tongue are corn, cereals, apples; herbs and grassy notes in the aftertaste. The taste itself is a bit on the sugary side, but with a pleasant bitterness in the aftertaste. The mouthfeel is thin and fizzy. Generally, this is a pretty boring beer, but as far as pale lagers go, this is far from the worst.

Sweet herbed apple aroma. Ichiban pours piss yellow a tight white head. Flavor is almost nonexistent, thinned out but the finish and body are still decent. We all know this beer sucks but I could sure eat some spicy food with a cold Kirin.

Appearance with golden color and small head.
Medium aroma of hops and malt.
Medium / Low Hoppy and bitter flavor.
In my opinion, it is better than Asahi Super Dry, the other Japanese I drank.
Quite enjoyable pale lager, suited very well with good traditional Japanese food.

Appearance: Clear golden/light amber with cm thick white head.
Aroma:Corn, biscuit, floral, spicy, grassy, note of honey and citrus.
Taste: Low sweetness, low/medium bitterness and sourness.
Palate: Smooth medium texture, light/medium body, astringent lingering citrus, spicy malty finish.
Comments: Tasty, crisp, clean and enjoyable overall. Very slight glass lace.
C’est une bière un peu plu goûteuse et moins houblonne que les bières commerciale. Achetez en pas une caisse

Wells & Youngs bottle. Hazy yellow, white lace. Fresh grassy, light yeasty orangepeel nose. Relatively light body, mealy malt body which leaves a hole in the center, pleasant fruity notes, very quick grassy finish. Slightly salty aftertaste.
Clear pale yellow with a nice but short lived head. Cardboard and boiled vegetables on the nose. Bland taste with virtually no bitterness except for the medicinal metallic feel of it all..
Bottle 0.33l at Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Originally rated 28022012. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Corn, sweetness and malts. Horrible.

Aroma: smells skunky, actually it smells like a skunk peed in it. Appearance: very pale yellow and bubbly. Taste: Not good, taste like soggy corn flakes. Palate: weak and watery. Overall: wish I had my two dollars back.
Bottle@sushine. Light golden clear. Very Remote malty notes. Plenty of butterscotch.  Dry. Very boring.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of corn , some malt and fruitiness. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some herbal notes, some yeast and malt. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.

500ml bottle from hypermarket in Vyborg, brewed under licence by Moskovskaya Pivovarennaya Kompaniya, 5% abv, clear gold colour, small white head. Aroma of hay, cereal, grain and grass with some hints of citrus and floral hops, taste is a very slightly on the sweet side, some bitterness in the aftertaste. Light body, soft carbonation. Not really anything interesting going on with this very standard lager.

355 ml bottle, labelled 5.0% ABV. Pours clear light golden, with a big frothy white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma of white bread, hay, corn and a hint of citrus. Taste of white bread, corn and a little citrus and spices. Light body, light-medium carbonation, slightly sweet and bitter, somewhat dry. What I liked the most about this beer was the golden exotic label, it’s okay to drink with sushi.

Clear Pale Yellow, Huge Head, Some Spotty lacing. Lightly Sweet, Grain, Malt, Light Peppery Bitter Finish. Watery, Soft Carbonation, creamy. Easily Drinkable and refreshing. Nothing Too Bad, Nothing Too Good. Main Novelty and attraction - is from Japan (in US made under Contract by Budweiser).Rather Decent.
Una cerveza muy normalita que tiene la gracia de que es japonesa. Nada más. Muy poco cuerpo, un amargor muy ligero y por sacarle algo tiene algo de aroma a limón.
Grain, herb aroma. Mild sweet cereal, watery bitter finish. One of the most drinkable major brews in Japan, nothing fancy but not too harmful either.

33cl bottle. Pours transparent golden with small white frothy head. Smells spicy and lightly fruity. The taste is typically lager, but the palate is too sugary. Body is light, carbonation just average. I’m afraid I don’t like it.
Pours light golden, soapy white head. Light malty aroma. Taste slightly sweet malt and wet. Short fizzy finish.
Had a bottle at a sushi place in Rogers. The sushi was great. The beer not so much. Just another mass market bottle of swill.

Sampled on tap at Japan in Epcot. Obviously this is brewed at Anheuser-Busch because it sure tasted like their swill. I made it a couple sips in, couldn’t see anything that made this any different that Budweiser, tossed it and moved on.
Klar lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av noe malt. Smak av noe søt malt og fruktig humle. Chinese Restaurant.

Duft av malt. Lite tynt skumlag. Fin lys gyllen farge. Friskt og lettdrukket std øl.

Godt leskende øl.  Standard øl. ikke noe mer spannede enn at det er et japansk øl og er lett drukket og godt i sommervarmen.
4-6-13 poured from bottle: Watery pale lager, ok head. Slight bitterness on back of tongue. Hay clear color. 1.9 BD; Joek 7.9 I like Avery belgium. 6 KevMar
Bottle from local supermarket. (Brewed under licence by Charles Wells). Clear pale golden colour with an average size white head. Light aroma of malt. Light body, rather thin. Average carbonation.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a pale golden color and a small head. Aroma of hay. Flavor is grainy, with hop bitterness.

Light golden color, white head. Aroma is sweet malts, banana, some hops. Taste is malts, sweetness, onions?.
Can during a flight from HND to HNL, August 2013. Clear golden with a medium white head. Weak aroma and taste of bread, malt, some hay and citrus. The aftertaste was short.
Väldigt ljus med lite malt doft och nästan ingen humle! Smaken är maltig utan humle!
Nice straw colored body with a tall white dense foam head. Simple tinny malt profile. Weak corn and grass.

Nice, non-offensive brew. Pretty color, frothy head. Medium carbonation. Pleasant, balanced, mild. Would make an excellent pairing for casual dining & hot weather refreshment. Drink ice-cold in frosted glass.
500ml bottle at a noodle bar. Pours a transparent gold, frothy quick-to-go white head. Aroma of cheap malts. Taste of malts with light carbonation. Okay for its purpose I suppose.

330ml bottle. Normally drinks taste better the more alcohol has been consumed; When tasting this beer, I had already consumed a fair amount. It had an aroma of lemons and farts. Taste of citrus and iron. Quite refreshing though. Would go well with crisps or nuts.
Bottle. Pale golden beer with medium head. Aroma of cereal grain. Taste is cereal grain and corn. Medium carbonation. Too grainy for me, not very good.
En helt ordinær øl. Lys farge med noe hvitt skum. God tørstedrikke en varm sommerdag.

Pours a clear yellowish golden with a thin white head that fades pretty quickly. The aroma consists of yeast and corn. The taste is the same along with some mild grassy flavors. This one is watery. Light bodied, thin textured, average carbonation. Although this is without argument mediocre, it will always have a soft place in my heart as this was my favorite Japanese beer back in the day.

330 ml can bought at Market Place by Jason’s in Langham Place, Mong Kok.



Golden yellow colour; Two finger head and white foam which last for about 2 minutes; Good sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation; Sweet aroma of full malt, bread, grains, light citrus and grass; Medium sweet taste of lager malt, with light grains, wort, very light wet cardboard, off-tasting alcohol, light citrus and grass; Medium body, oily palate; Taste profile is a half-done brew, with wort sugar and bad booze dominate, unnecessarily sweet and quite unpleasant. Grain taste is also quite strong. Terrible! Hoppiness is light citrus nose, moderately strong grass taste, and detectable bitterness not enough to counter the sugar for sweet finish. Slightly dry after taste, Sweet and boozy to mouth.



Comments: So Kirin advertises the importance of the first press wort, what they fail to tell you is that they didn’t do anything serious afterwards to make this a good brew: a vet of half-done wort full of sweetness and foul booze, and they got the courage to sell this crap to the public as their flagship product after all these years. Shameful! Drain pours!

December 6th, 2010 - The Gold Standard. Literally. This is Kirin’s flagship beer, and like many beers that aim for a mass market, wide audiences, and thick profit margins, the Kirin Ichiban is an underwhelmingly bland, boring beer. It is one of Japan’s most popular macrolagers, found everywhere, advertised everywhere, enjoyed everywhere. It is what it is, and can be best enjoyed alongside a hot bowl of ramen on a cool Fall day, or watching a Giants vs. Tigers game (bonus: you can throw the can at the TV!). Where it cannot be enjoyed: in quiet, meditating thought, pondering the complexity of flavors. This is one of those beers that can accompany a walk at night along emptied roads, or sipped slowly while sitting at a Japanese park (a thousand blessings on Japan’s open container laws) but not as a Ratebeerian might enjoy his brew. Still, it is ubiquitous, fairly inexpensive, and has its purposes for the foreigner living in Japan who prefers his evenings adventuring, rather than suited and tuxed up in a cloyingly high class bar.

We organized a very interesting tasting of Lagers (basic to average quality): 16 different beers from different countries. Price range: from EUR 0.3/bt (supermarket) to EUR 3.5/bt (take-away at sushi bar). All beers have been blind-tasted; we were 4 people, great beer lovers and wanted to know If there is a difference between all these basics summer beers. Answer: no, all were more our less watery, the worst one was bad water. Kirin was water. 
Here is the ranking: #1 Sapporo Yebisu #2 Baltika 3 #3 Duff #4 Obolon Svitle #5 Svyturys Ekstra Draught #6 Heineken #7 Kirin Ichiban #8 1664 #9 Carlsberg #10 Burger #11 Kronenbourg #12 Pilsner Urquell #13 Königsbacher #14 33 Export #15 Tsingtao #16 Asahi

Pours crystal clear pale yellow with no head. Nose is corn syrup and dirt. Taste is mostly sweet with a tad bitter. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Average finish. Light body.

Nothing to write home about here. On tap at a local Japanese restaurant, so I thought I would try it. Typical light, pale beer. Too malty. Too much carbonation. I was trying it for the "japanese feel," but come to find out, Anheuser-Busch is brewing it in USA for Kirin. I wouldn’t try it again.

Clear golden colour, diminishing white head. Aroma of malts, light hops, light weizen. Quite sweet, corn, light bitter flavour. Light sweet malty finish.

Marginally better than the Asahi dry.

(From 33cL bottle @ local Japanese restaurant, Breda. Brewed in Weihenstephan.)

Bottle. Pours clear fizzy golden yellow with a medium white head that dissipates fast with some lacing. Aroma is grain, malt, and corn syrup. Flavoris the same, mildly sweet. Finish is crisp and lightly bitter.
2012.0826 - 33cl - yellow coloured, small white head. low levels of flavour, worsened by too much carbonation.
Bottle. Clear light golden color with a thin head. Mild aroma of hay, grain and some citrus from hops. Sweet malty taste. Slightly oily texture.

Aroma: sweet malts. Appearance: a clear yellow pour with a mostly sustaining white head and minimal lacing. Taste: grain, cereal, a floral finish and a bready aftertaste. Mouthfeel: medium with medium-to-minimal carbonation. Overall: I've tasted a lot worse pale largers. This a typical session beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pretty disgusting. Super malty. I get some old grains in the nose. Must be taken cold and fast. The warmer it gets, the more it tastes like artificial carbonation leaving the can and/or dirty water.

Pours pale yellow, nose of some sweet malts and yeast. Some flavor of tropical fruit, banana, and bread. Not bad for a pale lager.. Most are light and flavorless, this is light, but has lots of flavor.
Average head, little lacing, white, mostly diminishing, clear, golden color. Malty aroma and flavor, Ahh not sure if I care too much about this one.

Bottle. Pours tan yellow to golden color with thick but quickly disappearing head. Aroma is some hops, but very weak. Taste is very empty - some malt in it, but otherwise almost like a carbonated water with sugar. Carbonation is medium to high.

Unappealing cloudy light golden pour, but does have a head. Aroma is yeasty, some fruit, sweet. No real flavor, but does have a slightly bitter finish.
Might actually be worse than BMC. Couldn’t take a third taste.

Pours a clear golden yellow from the bottle with a quickly dissipating white head and little to no lacing. Aroma and taste of corn malts and shitty barley. Wow, go japan, shitty beer all over the world.

330ml bottle.  Slightly grainy aroma other than that very little.  Typical lager appearance - golden with a white head.  It has a neutral type of taste with rice and mild bitterness prominent in the taste.  The mouth feel is smooth and the drinkability is very high.  There is nothing that really stands out with this which would make me want to seek it out

On draft at Asia Cafe in D.C.

A: The beer is very effervescent and light yellow in color. Atop fthe beer sits a white head approximately a half inch thick.

S: The aroma is very faint, but has the general scent of a macro lager. Not much to report.

T: About what you would expect from a macro lager. The flavor is simple and straightforward. The beer has an aftertaste that is slightly bitter and mildly astringent.

M: Light in body with plenty of carbonation. Decent feel for the style, but nothing too impressive.

D: An OK beer to pair with various Asian cuisine, but not something worth drinking by itself.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-04-2010
Pale and clear.  Thin bubbly head that disapears quickly.  Grassy and rice grain smell.  Average smoothness with a hint of bitterness on the finish.  Not on my re-buy list.

Bière blonde de 5 % d’alcool. Bière fortement pétillante avec un col mousseux. Légère amertume en bouche. Pas de goût floral en particulier, mais un très léger goût d’épice. Peut-être également un léger goût d’agrumes. Correcte !

A lot of citrus and malt aromas coming from this beer.  Pours a medium-dark amber with a small white head that dissipates very quickly.  Light taste with a little hopps and citrus - surprising bit of bitterness/sourness on the finish.  Palate is ok, nothing to write home about.  Overall not a beer that I would recommend to friends.
Pours golden with virtually no head. Light and crisp, but doesn’t have a tremendous amount of flavor. Easy drink, but fairly unmemorable.
Pours straw with white head. Aroma of bread, and some sweet malts. Taste is standard for this beer type, nothing special.

12oz bottle poured into mug at a Chinese restaurant.  Clear golden color with frothy white head that disappeared.  Aroma is grassy, sweet and grain.  Typical lager smell.  Taste is maltier then usual macro-brew, slight hop finish.

I’m drinking it, so I might as well rate it.  I’m disappointed to find out that A-B brewed this stuff in L.A. as opposed to Japan. Grassy aroma, cereal, and both are very faint.  Looks like any other lager.  Taste is malty-sweet.  Bitterness lingers, but not much.  Alright palate with typical lager carbonation.  Overall, not bad, but not good.  There is an extra dollar on the 6-pack which totally kills it.

Nuts and dough on the aroma. Pours a see through gold with barely any foam. Flavor is a subtle caramel and nutty malt with a wheat and slightly bitter hop finish. Overall, this is a cheap, decent lager. Don’t expect a full flavor, just nice drinkability.
Of course, this beer is great to drink with an Asian dinner. It’s smooth, and we think it tastes similar to Coors Light.
Pours with a bright yellow color,  thin head,  medium level of carbonation. The taste is slightly bitter, crisp, dry except for some bitterness -- in the finish.  GOOD BEER

Stunningly crystal clear golden body. Foamy white head. Grassy aroma. Bit of a sweetish flavor, almost like a little bubble gum-like. Slight bitterness in the aftertaste no matter what they say. Its wet!l That was very important tonight. All in all, next time I need to buy Sapporo instead.
24.03.2012. Brewed in the UK. Piwo chłodne na gorące dni, słodowy posmak, goryczka lekko wyczuwalna, ale w przełyku pozostaje kukurydziany smak słodu. Pienistość obfita lecz krótkotrwała

Clear yellow, small white head. Little aroma, some grains. Neutral taste as well, some bitterness in the finish. (The US-made version, brewed by Anheuser-Busch, it clocks in at 5.0 ABV. In addition to Kirin Ichibian it reads Cuvèe de Luxe de Kirin on the bottle!)

The beer is less expressive then those Japanese Noh Theatre masks. Is it happy or just serious? Serene, perhaps? No aroma and pretty clear yellow unhealthy colour. Malty, yes but nothing after. It’s not watery. It does have a certain body, but just too gentle. However, if you have it after an abominable hop injection as Croucher Patriot, this will be soothing and pleasant, like a nectar of the gods.
Almost no aroma, with golden sparkling color. Head is white and thin. Taste is not complex at all and uninteresting. Finish is a bit bitter. Nothing special about this beer.
Nothing much to really say here. Very faint aromas and flavors of malt. Very light bodied with a dry finish. Just another macro lager without character.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors clear yellow with white head. 
Aroma malts, little grass. 
Taste is little bitter, iron, little sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
OK lager.

22 ounce bottle.  Pours a golden yellow with a half inch white head that lasts.  Has lots of carbonation.  Taste is of malt, grass, caramel, hops and is a bit sweet.  Similar aroma.  Has a decent body that is a bit on the creamy side.  The finish is a touch dry and has a slight bitterness to it.  Easy to drink, enjoyable and a great thirst quencher.  Wouldn’t mind having again.

Quarter finger white head. Very light pilsner appearance. 
Smells like Coors. Maybe a bit more malt. Corn husk and dry barley. Hint of
Citrus. 
Yeah. It's a lager. Heavy dry malts profile. Corn and meh yeast. 
80% carbonation mouth swish. Light body.

Some grass in the aroma, and a good bit of yeast.  Pours golden yellow with modest head and almost non-existent lacing.  Flavor:  light-bodied, grassy, some hops in the finish, not too bad at all for a pale lager.  Comparable to Stella, but not green-bottled, thankfully.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear yellow with a white head that quickly fades leaving no lacing. Aroma is malt, yeast, and some funk. Taste is malt and a small hint of hops.

Pours a crisp gold with a small white head that is short lived

Aroma is very faint but a slightly malt and sour note is apparent.

Crisp and, lightly carbonated.  A little heavy for a light lager

Bottled, 330ml from Tesco, Banbury. Straw to gold with fast diminishing white head. Sweet, slightly sickly pale lager, some light fruitiness perhaps with a hint of strawberry bubblegum, but it’s the sweetness that dominates. Not for me this one.
Earlier Rating: 10/23/2007 Total Score: 1.9
Tinned, 500ml, at Wagamama’s Reading. Pale gold with white head. I’d forgotten this one. Thin, corny, malt lager with little hop character. Some sweetness, quite tinny, metallic. Doesn’t really appeal.
chiara buona schiuma media persistenza piuttosto secca non molto amara beverina

Reviewed on tap, though have also drank bottled. Well, I am not a lager drinker so this was never going to get a stellar review but I have to say that it is an enjoyable beer. Very pale, light and refreshing beer... quite well carbonated with a fizzy mouth feel, quite a decent and soft aftertaste. Certainly not a bad lager and worth a try if you can get it.
golden with small head. corn wth slight sweetness. a bit better than low end american lagers, but that’s about it.

Das Bier ist hopfig, malzig, und wird im Nachgeschmack leicht wässrig, leicht bitter. Die Qualität ist mittelmäßig. Fazit: Zur Not trinkbar, wenigstens ist das Aroma recht stark!
	
Test vom 5.10.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,7,7,6,14,7 - 7,50

12 ounce bottle, bottled on 18 Jan 2012, the bottle says freshest taste within 180 days so I think I’m still good there.  Served in a pint glass, the beer pours a clear gold color with about an inch off-white head.  Head retention and lacing is average.  Aroma is sweet malt and corn, and not much else.  Taste is the same as the aroma.  Mouthfeel/body is light/medium, it is light and goes down easy.  For the style of beer it is, it’s not too bad.  Worth a try if you can pick up a single bottle somewhere.
It’s fairly pointless for this to exist. What aroma, taste, palate? Don’t think i’ll bother again.

Can. "Ichiban Shibori" Pleasant aromas of hay, weeds, and maybe lemon.
Clear, near brilliant gold with a steady of bubbles rising at different paces. 
Mild grassy flavors, very slight mid palate, and a tiny sweet aftertaste. Medium body for a lager. Stuff to more or less toss down on a hot day.
Not bad.

330ml bottle. Malt and corn aromas. Pours pale gold, with white head, some persistance and no lacing. Light body and lively carbonation. Taste is malty, some bitter. Average lager. Nothing remarkable.
22 ounce bomber. Not as bad as I thought it would be. Some apple notes, sweet pilsner, honey, and corn. Went well with my sushi.

Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear gold with white head. Aroma of corn, grains and skunk. Taste is about the same. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, another crap pale lager.

Une bouteille de 650 ml chez Mikado.  Un liquide doré et sa pauvre mousse.  Un nez de grains sucrés et son absence de houblons.  Un goût de céréales douces et la présence fantomatique de ses cultivars.  Une bouche trop gentille.  Un pétillement qui n’est pas forcé.  Une finale courte qui appartient à la grande famille des lagers commerciales.
Pours gloden with a white head. Aroma is malt, hay grass and light DMS. Flavour is malt, pine and light grass. Fresh and light bitter.
Pours light gold, with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, lemon. Taste is grainy malt, light grassy hops, light citrus, hints of wet paper. Thin body, lively carbonation

666th rating - ha! Ehh, not bad for a pale lager. Aromas of corn, stale bread and hops create a funked up scent. The taste was a lot better though - light and bready with a quick finish of stale hops. Only a hint of metallic twang is there, and it doesn’t necessarily kill this brew.

330ml bottle listed at 5.5%ABV pours a pale golden color with a huge bubbly head that settles quickly leaving only a few specks of lacing behind.  Aroma is cereal grains and grassy hops.  Taste is grainy malt sweetness with some grassy hops.  Finishes clean.  A basic macro lager that is only good for a hot summer day.

Bottle from Bierpost.de in Germany - but is actually the UK licence brewed copy at 5%, sadly! Pours golden with a fine white head, buttery biscuity nose, faint hint of hops. Body is initially crisp and a bit metallic, then that typically Wells & Youngs malty body, but dry and with some hay and hops, a decent enough bitterness coming through, but still a metallic tang on the hay and hoppy finish.

Light yellow in color but can produce a decent white frothy head. Aromas of light sweet grainy malt, grass, slight sour apple. Light flavors of grain malts, slight sour/bitter grassyness, slight skunk. Leaves a nasty malt liquor like aftertaste from the grain malt.

Clear yellow with lasting white foam head.  Slightly sparkling, not too bitter, fresh. Great with Japanese food. (Arnhem 201204€

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very pale yellow, fizzy, with aroma of corn and adjunct and watered down taste.

Had this on tap at the Blue Ribbon sushi place at the Cosmo hotel in Vegas.  I usually drift towards fuller / bigger beers, but this rocked (especially in paring with the food).  Tried bottles at home, also enjoyed.  Good easy drinker.  Nice malt.

I had this while I have a cold and not sure if it is the fair taste test. It pors a hazy golden tone on my glass. I can feel the hoppiness clearly before I try it. Taste is too bitter to me. It is a nice beer but price here is too high. I think I am not going to buy it again.
Pours clear gold, brief white head.  Malt and slight alcohol in the nose.  Sweet through the middle with a vague skunky hop finish.  just not much here.

Can--boy, I was expectIng that nitro whoosh when I opened the can--didn’t happen.  Poured with a gigantic head and pale yellow color. Not much in the smell arena, at least it doesn’t stink.  Not much taste, I guess you can say malt.  Real watery finish and lots of large bubbles.  I don’t if it was the long day before I got to the beer, but it didn’t disappoint.  Publix, 2.49.
Pours yellow...pretty much no aroma...maybe a little sweet bread... Taste is not bad.. But boring...cant complain tho.. Very easy drinking...could drink alot in a sitting

Very bland, not necessarily a bad thing if you like light beer.

THE BOTTOM OF THE BOTTLE IS DISGUSTING!! I can only drink the first 10 oz. before the skunky bitterness kicks in
Somewhat drinkable. Almost no aroma. Very pale. Light flavor of grass and malts.

330ml. Pours very pale with carbonation aplenty, short lived white head.  Slight grass aroma but other than that nothing at all.  Leaves a desperate fuzzy taste behind.  Bland, gassy, weak tasting - very poor.
Slightly worse than the Asahi I just tasted. Pours very pale straw color. Very watery and not much of aroma or taste.

Barva: velmi světle zlatá, pěna bílá, středně hustá, držící. Vůně: středně silná, výrazně chmelová. Chuť: středně hořké pivo s výrazným chmelovým akcentem  a jemnou sladovou stopou. Říz střední, středně plné pivo. Vůbec ne špatné :-).

Bottle @ Home. Pours light goldn with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, lemon. Taste is grainy malt, light grassy hops, light citrus, hints of wet paper. Thin body, lively carbonation. 120412
Earlier Rating: 12/29/2011 Total Score: 2.1
Bottle. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, weak grassy hops. Taste is malt, light grassy hops. Thin body, lively carbonation. Quite refreshing pale lager. 291211
Pours a very pale yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of corn and some herbs. Taste is clean and dry. Ok drinkability.

it’s palatable!
slighty sweet, slightly grassy, slightly malty.
nothing to offend, but nothing to commend either
A good beer, nice colour and good pour.  Good taste and the aftertaste isn’t too harsh either.  Overall, a very good beer.

Aroma is full of corn, light malts, minerals and à bit sweetish.
Light golden colour, medium white head.
Flavour is light, Clean, again, corn, bread, yeast, slightly sweet.
Very light beer, but refreshing.
Pours a very pale yellow color. Aroma is grassy hops and corn. Taste is similar. Not bad if served cold.

As pale as pale gets with a full white head with plentiful carbonation. Aromas of pilsener malt but very little else. Is cold, malty and easily quaffable. I suppose it does what it says on the label if I could read the label, but a sessionable beer and to be fair, a good sessionable beer. Tasty.

My 330ml bottle was brewed under licence by Wells and Youngs of Bedford, England: best before 8 July 2012 it was poured (twice) into a ’Veltins’ badged pilsner stemmed tulip on 14 Feb 2012.

Looks like a regular lager: golden, clear and bright, mid depth of goldness. The head a mass of white bubbles, then fading to a wispy covering and a collar.

Slight hop aroma, some hints of cereals maybe as well.

Crisp, dry and boring were my first three thoughts as the beer entered my mouth. Strangely for a lager as the mouth began to dry after each sip the palate seemed to get sweeter instead of the normal slightly bitter, sometimes metallic hit.

I suspect my beer (brewed in the UK) tastes very different to the US version. So my review will not be a lot of good to most users, but hey ho, it might interest one or two who read it.
Bottle @ Ichiban Restaurant. Corn grain aroma. Golden yellow colour, good head. Vegetable corn flavour. Sharp but served too warm.
One of the best Pale lager in my opinion, although the regular opinion makes it bad... really tasteful

Pours thin clear yellow with small white head. Little to no aroma, maybe a musty grain store room, warehouse smell. The taste is also hard to find mostly water with spritzy carbonation. There is nothing off putting about it but just not much there. Lightly sweet and musty, it tastes exactly like a Japanese lager brewed by AB.
Pours a light golden color. Smell is of grains, some sweetness. Taste is mild, light grains and malts. Overall a mediocre beer.
Pours a very light pale yellow with a big foamy head. No lacing on the glass. Aroma of sweet corn and minimal malts. Taste is much of the same. Has a clean finish.

pours very light yellow with a little white head, not bad aroma with a nice hoppiness. not alot going on in the flavour department but very refreshing and clean. a good thirst quencher and less chemicaly flavoured than other asian lagers.
Une heineken japonaise .... Même amertume. L’étiquette est jolie avec le dragon dessus.

Bottle. Pours clear light golden with a small white head. Aroma of sweet malt with just a hint of hops. Sweet and watery without much aroma and flavour, pretty clean. Tastes a bit like malty natural mineral water with alcohol. Not bad, it just doesn’t taste much. Works well as a thirst quencher.

Poured from a bottle, Japan. Smells like metal shavings. Tastes like copper. Considerable head, but very soft and light. Very little taste, but what taste there is present is not a proper beer flavor, but a corn-heavy Bud Light flavor. Roughly comparable to Bud, a very tasteless lager.

On draft at a local hibachi restaurant.  Clear, small head, typical light lacing.  Full-bodied, but lightly bitter taste.  Just crisp enough.  I liked it better than I thought I would, especially with food.
12 oz bottle  pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of sweet malt. Taste of malt and a bit of hops.

Served ice cold at a sushi place, and I’m glad for it.  Kirin is almost tasteless.  It was very refreshing, but, then again, so was the ice water I had with it.  Japan’s take one the American adjunct lager.

Bottle (33cl) from Vinmonopolet (Vika), Oslo. Inch-thick white head, quickly reducing to a thin ring with a small amount of lacing. Clear, pale golden colour. Light body, soft/average carbonation. Aroma of malt and yeast, somewhat fruity (yellow apple/banana). Taste is fairly dry, a bit papery/metallic, balanced by a discreet fruity sweetness. Mildly bitter finish.

It would be good with food, but taste like a light american lager, nothing special.  Poured very clear golden color with a good size head.  Taste is similar to any american light beer. Fun to drink because of the look of the bottle.
Bottle: crisp, one dimensional, grainy, yellow and fizzy. Food Pairing: Hot & Spicy asian food.

33cl bottle. Golden colour with a frothy and creamy white head. Aroma has herbal hops notes. Flavour is grassy moderate malty where cereal and herbal hints are present. The final is moderate bittery with an average duration. Carbonation is medium. Bdoy is light.
On tap at the Victoria, Birmingham. Standard enough lager. Pretty creamy, slightly corny. Perhaps too sweet for me, and therefore a wiggle of cloy.
It is gold color and has a head that kicks quickly and leaves no lace. It smells of puffed rice and grainy alcohol. No real malt taste. Standard low body beer and easy to drink quickly.
On tap at some touristy Asian place.  Pours standard yellow but huge creamy white head that really lasts.  Taste pretty bland og grain, grass, metal, light bitterness.

This beer succeeds in being extremely easy to drink by being completely and utterly flavourless. It seems as if they used decent ingredients to avoid any unpleasant flavours or adjunct taste, it’s actually kind of an impressive beer in that regard. Completely neutral.

Chilled dimple mug pour yielding natural straw yellow color with decent medium weight white head. Some malt, grassy hops intertwining upon taste. Light degree of bitterness towards finish. Quite drinkable if not particularly noteworthy, however found quirky sweet malt note in aftertaste of interest. Best cold.

Bottled. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Smells slight malty. Tastes very bitter and abit malty with a similar finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 330ml. A clear pale yellow colour with a medium high, white head. An aroma of malt and fruit. The taste is medium sweet and light bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a medium long, sweet duration.
Earlier Rating: 8/19/2011 Total Score: 2.6
Bottle 330ml. A clear light yellow colour with an average white head. An aroma of malt and fruit. The taste is medium sweet. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a sweet finish.

Bottle from Tesco, Syston.  I generally don’t have high hopes for commercial pale lagers but this one is better than most.  It pours a typical, clear yellow with plenty of carbonation - as you would expect.  The pleasant surprise is the head which is small but creamy and long lasting with a good amount of lacing.  This is medium bitter to taste with a short finish and lacking any notable after taste - however it is crisp and smooth in the mouth.  Not overly gassy like so many of its contemporaries.  Overall: not bad.
Bottle. Clear straw with huge lump of white on top. Grainy malty, a dry bitterness but quite sweet. A nice enough light lager, but not enough flavour here to rave about.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a pint glass.   From notes.  Originally reviewed 11/26/2008.

Although not expecting much from a Japanese macro brew, Kirin still leaves a lot to be desired. It pours a very light straw yellow, and has almost no distinct smell. The odor does vary from an American macro, probably from the use of rice.  There is a small head, leaving almost no lace on the glass. 

It tastes almost exactly as it smells, nondescript and dull. The one upside to this beer is the drinkability. Although it would not pair well with almost any food due to the lack of flavor, it was smooth enough to wash down the sushi I was enjoying without getting in the way.
(bottle 12/02-2012) large white fast fading head, clear yellow color, thin body, medium co2, thin taste. BB date 06/10/2012.

Bottle. First of all, this beer advertises two interesting statements on the bottle. "100% Malts!" and "No Bitter Aftertaste!" Why in the world would you NOT want a bitter aftertaste from a pale lager? And furthermore, how can you make anything from 100% malts? I never think it’s a good sign to laugh at a label before I even taste a beer. Golden pour with minimal head and zero lacing. I picked up a slight aroma of sweet malt, a bitter tinge. The taste was watered down lager. Kind of like taking a Yuengling (which I consider to be average) and dumping a pitcher of water into it. I will say though, that I was able to pick up on bready sweet malt notes in the aftertaste, so they did have at least 5 maybe 10% malts.

Not bad with sushi. This beer reminds me of okinawa, and the Kirin festival. Awesome memories, and iffy beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A lot better than ashi super dry but ain’t a good beer personaly a don’t think the japs make a good beer would not buy again
Yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt and grass. Taste is also malt and grass leading to a light bitter finish. M’eh
Simples, porém bem melhor que as populares brasileiras, mas porém (novamente) o custo-benefício não confere.

Had on tap at a local sushi place.

Arrived a clear straw yellow with a thin fizzy head that quickly dissipated. Good lacing, though.

Smelled of sweet grain with a tad bit of grassy hop aroma.

Tasted pretty sweet with some bready grain along with a cooked vegetable flavor. Some grass and hay hop flavor along with a mild bitterness. Finished pretty crisp and dry.

Overall a below average beer. There are much better beers out there in this category.

(Bottle 0,33l)
Malty, grainy, light hops aroma. Clear golden color. Medium creamy white head. Very light sweet, light sour. Light fizzy. Very light dry finish.
Malty, a hint of floral hops, but more on the sweet malt side. I tad metallic (from a can). But this is great very cold, and especially with sushi, sashimi, and other Japanese dishes.
En dussinöl som lätt tappas bort bland andra lättalageröl. Gräsighet och en nästan försumbar beska. Inga felsmaker, bara tråkig

Poured from a small can. Brilliantly clear with nice head and good lacing. Aroma is slightly grassy. Body is medium and bigger than expected with light bread notes. A pleasant lager beer at a very reasonable price.
Dry and fruity with a slightly stale taste, overall this is very poor and I won’t have it again
Bottle. Pale yellow with white head. Aroma straw and hay. Taste some bitterness, a little malt. A rather dull and boring pale lager.
Blond pils. Nose is malt and sweet. Texture watery, soft carbon. Rice, corn and sweetness on palate. B@H
Vegetable flavor, no bitterness, small head, no body, kind of strange beer, just ok for a hot day.
Crisp with a clean finish, foamy head - pale yellow color. Nothing to really get too jazzed up about.
Bottle. Weak hoppy aroma with pale appearance, pours a small head, medium-high carbonation. A medium sweet taste with little bitterness with a slight sour aftertaste. Refreshing pale lager
Pours like, looks like, smells like and tastes like many other pale lagers.  Little head, weak malts and weak grassy hops.  No finish.  Nothing offensive, but nothing to praise either.

Bottle at Dans. Kudos for the name - number 1 in Japanese (on Jenson Buttons helmet, and he’s my 3rd favourite F1 driver. Or maybe 4th.). Aroma is faintly of hops, with a bit of piss. Not even joking. Taste is faintly of hops too. It is, for want of a better expression, gash.
Bottle. Plain clear yellow, small white head. Smells like grassy malts, lager grain. Taste much the same. No finish to speak of.
En bouteille.  Lager asiatique typique.  Elle manque de cette fraîcheur propre aux lagers tradtionnelles.  Très ordinaire.

Can.  Moderate carbonation.  Simple yeasty hops aroma and flavor, with clean finish.  Limited flavor; can do much better with other beer brands.  Would drink if served, but would not buy with my own $.
Bottle. Light straw pour with a big foamy white head. Aroma and taste is pretty simple lager like. Not horrible for the style.

En botella.
lager con poca retencion poca carbonatacion,aromas a maltas,dulce y aguada.nada especial
Bottle.  Pours a light gold.  The aroma and flavor is lightly malty and has an initial pleasant taste on the tongue.  Not overly hoppy.  Decent overall.
It tastes, looks and smells like bland crappy malts. Avoid. This beer is freakin terrible

Originally rated November 2005. Bottled on June 20th, 2005 and says on label, freshest taste within 180 days. Also says brewed under the strict supervision of Kirin’s brewmaster by Anheuser-Busch in L.A. Pours a light yellow with a small white foamy head. Decent lacing and tiny bubble soft carbonation. Smells the fresh malt with some grain. Smooth mouthfeel with a refreshing finish. The taste is mild with malt and very slight grass. Plain old lager, just refreshing. Probably A-B’s best brew (because of strict supervision).

Not too bad, nice head. I like that this one isn’t too hoppy, but isn’t sweet either, which makes it a nice thirst quencher. That said, I wouldn’t go out of my way to look for it. Has a macro-brew taste, but it seems to be a little more hoppy than Pabst. It does taste a lot like Pabst.. Not impressed, especially for the price.

Fizzy yellow beer, goes good with spicy sushi though...when there’s no IPA around.  Not much too it, but it’s doesn’t taste bad, just doesn’t taste like much at all.  Over carbonated for me, but tolerable.
Tap at slug and wankstain. Pours golden with no head, looks like piss. Bready lager yeast aroma and taste. Pretty shit
Pours yellow with a fluffy white head. Aroma is clean, sweet, with some floral hops. taste is sweet with light bitterness, carbonation and a clean finish. good with sushi.
Bottle. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Smells crisp and grassy. Mild sweetness and hops. Light bodied. Medium carbonation. Very refreshing.

(On draught at genghis khan).  Pours clear golden with thin white head and some lacing.  Moderate carbonation. Aroma of corn, cereal and light hops. Taste is sweet with a light touch of bitterness.  Thin bodied with an oily texture. Crisp. Good stuff for the mongolian cuisine.

From a bottle at Orient Kitchen on Baum Boulevard in Pittsburgh.  Clean, refreshing and a very good taste.  My friend at work who was stationed in Japan during the Vietnam war years told me that Kirin is considered to be the king of beers and much preferred over the others like Sapporo.  I’d have to agree and would easily go back for several more in any sitting as the overall purity of this beer does not weigh you down or take away from the enjoyment of the food, be it American or Asian.  Good things can come from rice as Kirin easily proves true.

A bottle at the Cheese Factory in KC. They have a number of Boulevard beers on menu as well. Pours a beautiful deep straw colour, head dissipates quickly, not much lacing, persistent carbonation - this is the sort of beer you drink in a tall flute glass, slightly yeasty fruity nose- distinctive pears; very dry, a tad bitter, does not have the salty CO2 of many US pale lagers; quick finish, good sparking carbonation. Good example of the type. This bottle brewed in Japan. I was in Japan when it came out, the can pictured here is a garish example. It was well received by the expat community. The scores here reflect a snooty beer-bongers snootiness. This is an excellent example of the style. The fact that I only drink a bottle of this every few years is irrelevant.
Svag arom av regnigt sommargräs, smakar lite bittert med inslag av hö. Som vanligt med många av de här lagerölen är utseendet det bästa.
Bottle 50 cl @ Wagamamas, Reading. Pours clear pale amber with a great fizzt white head. Aroma is sweet, week malty and hayish. Flavor similar, nothing to get excited about. Finishes sweet.
Can.  Natural ice, japan style.  Metallic, skunky.  Happy thanksgiving !  Drain pour.

650ml bottle. Clear light golden pour with average white head that sticks around a little longer than most macro swill. Smells....rancid. Almost like someone left corn sitting out and it turned and then that same someone threw a bag of white sugar on it for reasons unknown. Tastes much better than it smells...not that that’s saying a whole lot. It’s a little sweet and has that corn mash edge to it but there’s a nice crispness. Certainly a step above most lawnmower beer, but not a big one.
Clear golden brew.  Sweet malty aroma with dull fruity notes. Somewhat malty flavor with notes of hops with a bitter ending.

Clear pale yellow Japanese industrial swill with a small white head. Slight malty/grassy aroma, but taste has no real emphasis  on either malt or hops. Very clean and light, good palate cleanser to wash down the nigiri. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)

This is a very distinct if unremarkable brew. Upon opening the bottle, one gets the nasal hint of something mass produced and frothy. After settling in a glass, some undefined sweet notes are evident. The beer is not hoppy, while the malts seem somewhat stretched. Dry finish; well attenuated all around. Mies says ’less is more,’ and in this case it means a crisp and refreshing drink with is totally inoffensive.

I’m not going to lie, I’m pretty disappointed even though my expectations weren’t that high. Even by pale-lager standards this is bland, not Bud Light bland, but definitely blander than some of the better national, mass-produced pale lagers out there. Neither the aroma nor the taste contains any trace of anything that can be ascribed to a decent malt or hop profile, and the mouthfeel is pretty standard. I couldn’t finish the whole bottle. I appreciate the lack of rice or corn, but this is still pretty subpar.
Bottle. Golden with thin head. Smells citrusy. Very light flavor. Harsh in mouth then fades to sweet aftertaste.
Medium/high carbonation. Golden color and small thin head. Barley aroma. Medium bitterness. Overal between 8 and 10.
bottle in Alexandria,VA. Below-average lager, nothing special. Light yellow color, small head.
Tap.  Floral and malty aroma.  Taste is basic lager taste.  Medium high carbonation.  Aroma was good and taste was okay.
Bottle, pours clear yellow. Aroma is some bread and malt. Taste is light sweet and minimal. Watery standard mainstream lager.

On draft at EPCOT Food and Wine Festival 2011.  Pours a clear yellow with a white head.  Nose is rice, light malt, and some very mild earthy hops.  Flavor is similar- rice all over.  This one has virtually no depth, and a light body.  So-so at best.

At a tasting in "Sar Hamashkaot" in Ramat Gan, thanks zvikar, bought in Eilat, brewed in Russia, bottle, pours light yellow color almost without head, very slightly sparkling, strong malt aroma, slightly sweetish taste, light body, overall not a bad beer.

Tasted from bottle at sushi restaurant into pint glass. Typical light lager aroma and flavor: grass, grain, not really malty or hoppy. Light body, watery mouthfeel. Crisp, dry lager finish. Fine with dinner but completely mediocre.
Pale gold, white head. Malty nose. The taste more malt, vague floral hops. Typical macro-fare, but not offensive, just really boring.
Pale blonde. Minimal aroma with faint honey and lager clean-ness. Sweet with a hint of caramel and weedy astringent bitter finish. Biting carbonation.

Probably one of the worst brews I have tasted thus far (next to Wacko and Rheingold)! Seriously I could not finish the brew. It did possess the standards of the “Add-Junk” (a.k.a. adjunct) lagers; pale golden yellow, moderate fizzy head, skunky odor (from the lesser quality grains and hops that are used), little to no real taste, and a bland but bitter aftertaste. This is one brew that is best left in the cooler for some other poor soul to purchase and consume.
Thin Head which goes very quickly. Light and not very hoppy, nothing really interesting happening.
Awesome dragon goat on the front. Other than that, is it really beer with 100% malt? not very good.

22 oz. from Chuck’s. Got made fun of for this one. Suprisingly not so bad. Looks like piss. Smells nice and flowery. Tastes like mildly sweet water. Almost over-carbonated. Not a great standalone beer but probably good with food. What is 100% malt?

Ok lager. Doesn’t really stand out from the rest (Bud, Coors...) but it is not terrible. Drank it before going out and it works fine in such settings. Kind of sweet and watery, but what can you expect.

10 cl can @ Hotel Room, Kyoto as ”Kirin Beer”, 5% abv. canned on 06/2011, BBE 02/2012

Aroma has corn, metal and some rice with slight graininess. Flavour is stale with sweetish corn and some metal. Luckily I bought the smallest can so I didn’t have to drink much of this crap.

Serving glass: Poured from draft into pint glass.

Appearance: Light pale yellow with stark white head.

Aroma: Very mild, with dry malts and very light spicy hops.

Taste: Dry grainy malts that are slightly Pilsner-like, some spicy hops.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, light body, nice crisp, dry finish.

Overall: Quite good for a Japanese Rice Lager. Easy to drink with a nice dry finish, leaving you begging for more.
330ml bottle.  Pours light gold with a large frothy head.  Aroma is corn with a touch of grass.  Taste is mostly corn with touches of lemon and grass.

Bottle at Sushi No. 1. A blonde beerr with a thin white head. Aroma of rice, yeast, barley and light caramel. Similar flavours. Moderate carbonation with a light CO2 prickle. A little caramel linger. Quite refreshing with Japanese food. OK.

Bottle from Tesco. The bottle says, "Japan’s Prime Beer’, so this clearly isn’t any old rubbish. Smells of sweet, vodka induced, sick. First sip; wow, this is any old rubbish. Even for lager this is crap. Wasn’t I drinking this in 1989 in that ropey Plymouth nightclub I wandered into after getting smashed on Exhibition Cider? Yes, I think I was. Things clearly haven’t got better in the world-of-lager since then.

Extraordinairement ordinaire. Inoffensif avec une légère amertume pas déplaisante. Rien à dire sinon que je la boirais avant n’importe quel autre macro-lager même si elle est quand même brassée par A-B.
22oz bottle. Hazy yellow-orange. Quite flowery aroma. The palate is thick and the taste surprisingly good and strong. A bit of honey in the finish.
Pours light golden with no head or lacing. Aroma is lightly lemony with a little light cereal grain. Slightly tart with a hint of hop bitterness at the end. Clean and lightly tart. Boring.

Very light beer. Not too much taste. Fair enogh, I’d rather say. Probably good if you’re hot, sweaty and dehydrated. But, on the other hand, what doesn’t taste good in such a setting?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
No aroma what so ever, and a strange taste that is hard to descibe... it not horrible just not use to it.

I haven’t had a decent Japanese lager yet, but if I had to pick one this would be my beverage of choice. I still have to get my hands on Sapporo however. Kirin is a slightly sweet tasting lager, little foam, golden color. Light bodied with lively carbonation.

Das Kirin Ichiban ordnet sich optisch im Mittelfeld ein. Der Geruch kommt süßlich mit einer Hopfennote rüber. 
Im Antrunk spritzig. Mittelteil herber mit spürbarem Malz. Der Abgang ist langandauernd und herb. 
Kirin ist eine der größten Brauereien der Welt. Das Ichiban könnte man demnach als ein Massenbier bezeichnen. Dafür ist es gut gelungen. Trinkbar.Test vom 23.3.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Bottle. Clear and yellow. Corn, malt, but not very flavourful. Thin and watery.
Not something I’d normally bother drinking unless I’m at a sushi place that doesn’t have any Hitachino or Asahi Black. Not bad as lagers go.
355ml bottle. Slightly sour tasting, it would be good with spicy food. Dry palate.
Bottle @ Hurono’s in Springfield, MO - Pale, straw color.  Strong/good aroma (especially considering overall light beer), better taste than most other Japanese beers.

Appearance: typical lager straw hues under a white head which fades into a thin head, slightly thicker along the sides. Swirls average.


Nose: grass and grains. Lemon peel. Key lime peel in the back. Golden sundried raisins. Sun-baked grains.


Palate: typically clean with lemon peel and lime in the middle while grains mingle about. Rather dry. Finish with just a touch of citric peel atop the tongue. Dry sweet bread crusts along sides.


Final Thoughts: it’s alright. Not horrible but not great either. For me it’s all about the nostalgia and the massive amount of sushi I have enjoyed with this beer…until I discovered really good cold sake.

Bottle enjoyed at home

Golden, big white head. Smells of malts and some spices. Light maltym not much sweetness. Very dry feel. Good bitter finish.
Bottle in Japan restaurant. Yellow color wit small white head. Aroma light in grass, grain and malt. Taste, very light malty, some hops and grain. Short bittersweet finish. Bad.
Clear Pee Yellow Colour. Chemical feel. Feels synthetic. Malty. Very watery and borring. With a meal it it may be ok.

12oz bottle from kyojin restaurant in fields ertel, OH. California version. Yellow clear color. One finger fading white head. Some lacing. Nice malty base is a, welcome change from the usual yeasty pale lager.
Fairly standard yellow lager. Not as thin or phony tasting as many of them, and generally what I prefer from the selection at most Japanese restaurants.
Pretty much an average pilsner. Not better or worse than most other pilsners.

Firstly all the reviews from abroad such as the UK and the USA I think you should take with a pinch of salt. I had UK Kirin recently and it is not a patch on the Japanese one......Anyway back to the real stuff : Kirin is an underrated beer in my opinion. Very thirst quenching and at 5% it can’t be described as weak. Pours golden with a fluffy head that dissipates after a few seconds. Nose is mild hops, grass and malt. Taste is again hops, sweet malts and grass and a slighly citrus/dandelion taste. Don’t ask  me how I know what dandelions taste like ( childhood experiments) . It’s a solid beer for every occasion. In many places now it is called Kirin beer and not Ichiban for some reason and I have noticed a slight variation in tthe taste. The Ichiban tends to be sweeter and maltier and the Kirin beer is slightly sourer with a sharper taste ( as described above ,,,,dandelions). I’d say the Ichiban is better and brewed in Japan....which is weird as I live in Taiwan and when I study the bottle they both seem to be brewed in Japan ( I see both variants here). Used to like the old name Ichiban Shibori...sounded more authentic. Overall it is like a sourer version of Yebisu all malt.

Pale gold in appearance and mildly malty and sweet in aroma.  The flavor is of some malts and grass and slightly metallic.  Rather thin in body but not bad really, just could stand to use more flavor and not be as watery.
Clear gold with a disappearing white head.  Grassy aroma.  Taste is malt with light bitterness and a sour/metallic finish.
Just a normal beer without any interest. Low aromas, low taste, low score. Oh yeah, it’s golden.

Relativ mild, etwas herb. Allerdings wird das Bier im Mittelteil etwas bitter. Der Nachgeschmack ist praktisch nicht vorhanden 	 
Test vom 20.9.2004, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 7,5,4,3,8,5 - 4,90

330ml Bottle:   A really skunky smelling beer. There is a grain and some vegetables but the main aroma seems to be the corn & alcohol. 

Clear, golden straw colour with bubbly white head fading to a thin lace. 

A lot of grain in the taste and a bitter-sweet flavour blended with some corn, all of which is pretty dull although not as bad after a couple of sips. Finishes with a hop-bitterness which is okay. 

Light with medium carbonation although it isn’t all that smooth to drink. Slightly dry in the finish. 

The skunkiness of this beer was a little too much for me and it didn’t have enough flavour about it to change my mind after I drank some. 

* * * This beer is one of 1001 to try before you die:  * * *

7 June 2011, bottle. light yellow, clear, steady bubbles. foamy white head. really sweet smelling lager. thin body and fairly fizzy. slightly sweet malty flavour with a fair amount of a bitter twinge. too sweet for me though.

Tap. Light clear yellow served with zero head. Lightly sweet veggie aromas, but fairly clean and really don’t catch any sweetness there. Only main downside is a bit of paper in the finish, but fairly dry and reasonable. Light body (of course).  Not the worst out there.
I had this on draught at a restaurant.  I found it to be very generic tasting and almost metallic.
22 oz bottle. Clear yellow no head. Grainy rice nose. Taste is crisp, rice, grainy but not offensive.

33cl bottle at Sumo’s, Scheveningen.
Decent white head.  Normal pils colour.  Ok.

355ml bottle 

5.0% ABV 

Brewed in America by Anheuser-Busch, under license from Kirin 

I tried this beer on May 19, 2011 at "Smokeless Joe" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a translucent pale yellow with a medium sized white head.  The aroma was grass, weak hops, and sour stuff.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was sour grains, weak hops, and bitter

I drank the US-brewed version, while having a sushi. 
I found the taste average, and the palate a litlle creamy.
It’s a beer that I would drink again if someone offers to me, bu it’s not remarkable enough for me to buy it again.
A solid clean lager.clean light malt aroma and crisp malt flavor. Nothing too special but refreshing and clean overall.
Clear golden fizzy nice white head. A: Herbacy, a tiny metallic. F: thin body finish is bitter and short. It’s crisp. O: nothing special but pretty much on the style.

(bottle, 33cl) Clear, pale golden colour with a blond and thick foamy head. Strawy and skunky malty aroma with notes of sour dough and a tinge of grassy hops. Slightly sweet and bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a crisp carbonation. Plain strawy and doughy malty taste with grassy hops spots. Despite the aroma it is at least thirst quenching. 24.IV.11

330 ml bottle. Pale yellow colour, thin white head. Sweetish, mild aroma of grainy malt. Very mild, grainy malty and cardboard-like flavour. Light-bodied, smoothly carbonated. Nearly odorless and tasteless, waste of time and money.

On tap into a frosted mug. Appearance is a translucent gold with a thin, creamy white head. Aroma is pilsner malt with little hop influence. Thin body and easy drinking. Alright for a pale lager. I wouldn’t mind having another.

12 oz; bottled Feb 17, 2011. Beautiful pale golden with tight little bubbles and a creamy lasting head. Nose of honey, dry grass and roasted peanut. Flavor is the same, but heavier on the honey. Smooth, light-medium body is creamy, well-balanced and a tad heavier than most industrial pales. Not too bad, if you must.
From the bottle. Light and watery with a hint of skunky maltiness. The finish is slow with a dirty aftertaste.

Tap.  Pours clear pale straw with a small persistent white head.  Aromas of grass and other vegetation, apples/cider.  Slightly malty flavour, fairly dry, faint bitterness and something stale.  Light bodied, slightly below average carbonation with a lingering finish.
Clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is light malty and corn. Flavor is medium sweet and sligthly bitter. Finishes slightly bitter. Light bodied. 051009

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and light hops. Taste is light to medium sweet. Body is light , texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

This was actually a 33cl bottle brewed in the UK under licence. So, I’m not sure if this is exactly the same product. Anyway, it poured golden and with expected carbonation - the head is better than expected. It looks good! The nose has unsweetened muesli. The taste has more muesli but with just a hint of the dreaded sweetcorn. However, it has the expected body and it cleans very well on the end. This is a better lager than I expected to find outside of Germany and the Czech Republic.
Aroma is dominated by malts. Taste is the typical weak pale lager with no bitterness. Overall it doesn’t have a lot of character, but is certainly drinkable.

On tap in Izakaya, Tokyo. Japanese mass market lager. Nothing special, but when the weather is hot in Japan and you order one of these in an ice cold glass, it’s hard to beat. However, on an ordinary day this is a fairly bland and uniform. Pours clear amber, lots of carbonation. Nose is bit of malt which is backed up on the tongue, with a dry bitter lager finish. Bit too fizzy.
Hey it’s a japanese pale mass market lager that I’m rating. So there’s that.
Light sweet nose. Taste was a bit fizzy at the start then finished in a  watery manner.  Was lacking in substance from my perspective. Nothing offensive; nothing to write home about.

This is what I usually order when I eat sushi. I’m not sure why because it’s not that good but I guess I want to get the whole Japanese experience. Ugh. Anyhow onto the the review: 

Pours a pale golden yellow with a fizzy white head. 
Not much aroma to speak of, grainy and corn malt.
Flavor is typical for a lager. Light and unflavorful, but I do find it to be pretty crisp and refreshing. Thin, fizzy. Quick finish. Not bad for the style though.

Can (brewed in the U.K by ’Wells and Young’): Pale greenish-golden, relatively quickly collapsing big white extremely fluffy head; delicate perfumed grainy-hoppy nose with a slight papery touch; light sweet-bitter flavour, pretty watery; short and also watery finish with a faint tartness in the aftertaste. Only suitable for Mazda-drivers......

Bottle.  Pretty average, piss-poor lager.  It’s always fun to come on here and read the history and other opinions on beer, such as the fact that Anheuser-Busch produces this beer in the States, for example.  Much like what I’d expect from them, this is a pretty below-average beer.  For a lager, it’s certainly decent.  Not much flavor to be had other than...meh, beer.  No aroma to speak of, and no lingering body.  Squarely alongside Dos Equis, Miller Lite etc.  Good with chips and salsa.  4.9% alcohol.
I thought this was a drinkable, pleasant mass lager. Nice combo of somewhat deep malt and bittering hops for pleasant clean crisp lager

Bottle at Ginza of Tokyo in Madison, WI - Pours clear straw yellow with a small white head. Smells of sweet malt, honey, lemon, and a bit of fruitiness. Real malty taste, though real watery. Barley, with a faint hop bitterness on the finish. Straightforward, light, and crisp. Smooth and well-carbonated. This hit the spot with dinner, as I didn’t want anything heavy. Surprisingly good for the style.
It is just not a noteworthy beer. They only time I have ever had it was at a Japanese restaurant and it was boring.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a pale yellow with a medium white head and an aroma of malts and maybe some vanilla. The taste is medium sweet, with hints of malts, hops and maybe some caramel somewhere in the background. The finish is medium bitter. Really drinkable, but not outstanding or special at all.
Pale yellow colour with a thick white head. Sweet aroma. Medium bitterness. Ok taste.

Kirin Ichiban has a very thick, white head and a clear, golden appearance with lots of bubbles streaming up and a decent amount of lacing left behind. The aroma is a typical, run-of-the-mill beer smell. Taste is grainy, sweet, and there is some hop bitterness showing up. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Kirin Ichiban finishes crisp, refreshing, and mostly dry. Overall, this is an enjoyable beer, and I highly recommend it.

RJT

The beer poured a pale and clear golden tint with great clarity. A very creamy and frothy white head developed two fingers thick. It reminded me of what shaving soap looks like when it is all lathered up. There was excellent lacing and average retention.

The aroma is a bit sweet and is understated overall. There isn’t a lot going on here. You can smell the malts and a faint amount of hops.

The taste is a little sweet and, at the same time, a little bit tart. There is a bit of hoppy bitterness in the finish that is setting this beer apart from the other competitors in this style. This is not an overly complicated flavor profile but it is done quite well. There is a noticeable absence of the metallic or skunky aftertaste present in many beers of this style. Bonus points for a brown bottle.

The mouthfeel is fairly thin and carbonation is medium to high. The beer remained effervescent through the entire drink. This is a very smooth drinking beer.

Overall – this is not a beer with flavor or aromas you can write an essay on. This is a beer that presents nothing objectionable and does a few simple things well. If you are looking for a Pale Lager that goes down smooth and tastes reasonably good I would recommend Kirin Ichiban. I actually enjoyed it. Many reviews I see are hammering this beer but I honestly didn’t find anything about it to complain about. Check this one out for yourself. You may be pleasantly surprised.

Pours into the glass, as expected, a slightly pale yellow beer with medium-pored and short-lived head. The beer smells sweet and subtle metallic hoppy. Starts delicately hoppy, balanced sweet-tart. Not bad, at all! The aftertaste is grainy hoppy, very short-lasting. To the center part, the beer is somewhat artificial sweet and slight watery, which lowers the overall score a bit.
Had this at ichiban sushi in downtown puyallup. U can also buy this at any safe way. Decent beer crisp smooth and light
Sladke, ale nakonec vcelku pitelne. Tretinka ale stacila. Puvod divny: japonske pivo vyrabene v rusku pod licenci nemeckeho heinekena:-)
can, donated by pivnizub! Clear pale yellow, large white head, malty nose. Light-bodied, malty with some shy hops in the background.
From can. Pours yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is cereal, sweet fruit and malt. Sweet malty flavour with some light hoppy notes. Rather anonymous overall.

Very clear straw colored.  Bright white head that was very fizzy with little retention or lacing.  This looks like a "macro" for sure.  Several bubbles streaming to the top.  The aromas was corn and grain.  Some malt character.  Maybe a faint biscuit.  Everything was very faint.  The taste was of a cereal grain and corn.  Some minute bitterness.  Not a real pleasing taste.  Tastes like a "macro" also.  Getting a stale, metallic taste too.  The mouthfeel was light and watery.  It is refreshing and crisp.  Doesn’t leave much aftertaste at all.  This might be fairly refreshing if it was 110 degrees in the shade.  I probably wouldn’t want this under any other circumstances however.  I could finish it, which is always positive I guess.  Does have a cool little label on the bottle though.

Blind taste test. Sheridan, Wyoming.
This pale’s in comparison to real lagers. There, I said it. Just not a pleasing beer. Malty in the same way most mass produced lagers are. Dull. Synthetic aroma. Decent colour, if anyone cares how a beer looks over how it tastes.

12 oz bottle pours a bright gold with big white head. Nose of malts citrus and dry sweetness. Tastes refreshing and finishs clean. Comparing apples to apples not a bad beer especially when paired with hamachi or spicy tuna hand rolls. Definitely not as complex as a tripel.

Bottle. Clear golden yellow with a bleached white head that first looks pretty good but quickly falls. Aroma is light malty with a chalky straw like character, some bread. Taste is much sweeter than the nose in a citrus fruity style. Some faint grassy hops. Not much bitterness to talk of in the aftertaste. A bit watery. Carbonation is soft. It doesnt taste bad really, it’s just a bit too watery and blaha. On a warm sunny day it could work if it was all you had. A very smooth easy lager.

On-tap in Tachikawa, Japan. Served a light golden color with a big head that fades to nominal lacing. Aroma is sweet with grain and a trace of citrus mixed in. Taste is a mixture of sweetness and citrus mixed with a light flavot of grain. has a fairly dry finish. Light body, clean and crisp. Quite refreshing. Decent drinker, good for a couple.

A pale golden colour, with a white head.
Aroma; A good maltaroma, also getting some grass, floral components. Even some fruit.
Flavour; Pretty much the same as the nose, with some extra grass it seems. Alittle agressive carbonation, but a good balanced beer with almost no bitternes.
Summary; Love this with sushi and almost all fish with good flavour. Not a extreme beer, but a good lager!
On tap at the Yard House in Kansas City.  Looks like, smells like and tastes like a macro lager.  Exactly what it is.  Watery.  Was expecting more.

Appearance: goldenrod, white one-finger head.  Aroma:  bready, light citrus.  Taste:  very light, clean sweet undertone is subtle, crackers.  Finish:  short and slightly sweet and malty.  Notes:  Slight sweet and bready character and the nice finish make it  a session-worthy sushi beer.
A clear, pale yellow pour with white head.  It has a light grain aroma with a hint of skunk.  The light body has a thin texture and fizzy carbonation.  It is virtually tasteless.

Poured a clear yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is sweet and malty with some skunky notes.  No rice in the aroma.  Taste is pretty sweet with some nice malty flavors.  Very smooth for an Asian lager, I didn’t taste any rice at all, which I’ve noticed in a lot of beers from the region.  Slightly skunky, but overall pretty drinkable.  A decent pale lager.

Got this at Mei-Da, a Japanese supermarket in the Beethovenstraat in Amsterdam. It’s not vile, but I’ve had better things from Asia. It’s the Heineken/European kind, if that makes any difference for taste.
It tastes like a Busch Lite. I than I found out that is made by Anheuser-Busch and I was disappointed but not surprised of the taste. I SUX.

12 oz. bottle my brother brought back from South Korea.  Nothing too exotic here, either, but it’s a rate I’ve never gotten yet.  Pours a clear, pale yellow with a small white head that leaves some large bubbles.  Aroma of stale grains, old grass clippings, corn, straw, and pale malts.  Flavor of grassy skunk, sugar, pale malts, corn and other grains, and minerals.  Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a skunky mouthfeel.  Not very good at all but it is better than the Tsingtao right before this.

0.33l bottle. Pours a pale yellow/gold body with a thin creamy white head. Lively carbonation, medium bodied, some grassy hops and a nice crisp mouthfeeling makes this a nice lager. Perfect along with sushi!

Bottled.  Poured clear, brighter golden with a short-lived white head.  The aroma picked up rice, honey, and pale malts with just a little floral character around.. not bad.  The flavor found rice and pale malts at the core.. mild bitterness and some metallic character surrounded.. prickly finish with higher carbonation.  Light-bodied and tart on the palate.. crisp carbonation.. I don’t need another.
Crisp and clean, with a thick, foamy head. Golden color. Has a corn/rice aroma to it. Not a ton of flavor, but drinkable.

Tasted from a 22 oz bottle purchased in Aurora, Colorado.  Medium sized white head with a light pale yellow appearance.  Sweet pale malts with a bit of fruitiness in the head.  Very smooth Pale Lager with a good barley and rice (?) flavor.  No bitter aftertaste.  Solid Pale Lager.

12oz bottle.  Aroma of a pale lager, with light malts and hardly any hops.  Flavor pretty bland with a slightly more wheat beer taste than most plae lagers.  Not really worth trying unless at a japanese restaurant.

Pours a pale yellow with a small white head that dissipates quickly without any lacing. The aroma is a little bit of grainy sweetness and almost no hop presence. The taste is grainy and mildly sweet. Mouthfeel is light with quite a bit of carbonation. Drinkability is okay in that it goes down easy, but nothing to really bring me back to it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-04-2009
Moderate malty aroma, light notes of straw. Large, frothy, white head. Good lacing. Mostly lasting longevity. Clear, light yellow body. Moderate bitter flavor. Light to medium palate.
Bottle. Pours golden ith a quickly dissipating head. Taste is mild, with hint of bitternesss, palate is watery and harshly carbonated. Aroma has light malts, hay.
Bottle at a tasting, thanks zvikar: weak malt, weak honey notes, faint bittermess, a little dry, somewhat like a stale soda water, very light bodied, bland but drinkable.
Bottle at a tasting. Thanks zvikar. Clear golden. Aroma of adjuncts and chemical notes. Flavor has some corny notes and a drier and slightly bitter finish. Light-bodied.

Actually better than I was expecting.  Not much aroma that’s pleasant anyway.  A little malt taste and very unfresh bitterness that melds into more of a sour.  Not good, for sure, but better than many bad beers....I guess that’s not saying much, is it?
At a tasting, thanks zvikar, very little head, clear pale yellow colour, light honey and candy aroma, light coarse bitterness and very little. malty flavour, feels like soda water. Not good.
At a tasting, bought in Eilat, brewed in Russia, pale with a small head, aroma is winey with some lightly roasted malt, flavor is a bit dry with some honey and acetone, light body.
Fra dåse, dufter lidt af humle,flot gylden farve med medium hvidt skum,smager lidt metalisk, men virker ellers frisk. næsten ingen fylde.... en ok pils

Pours a clear pale golden yellow with a minimal head that goes away very quickly, not viscous, not lively... Aroma is defined by what im assuming is rice, a touch malty, no hoppiness, a little sweetness... Flavor follows suit to the rice... A little sweet, quite thin...

on draft at sushi restaurant.  From my memory if having this in the bottle, being on draft does seem to help this beer.  Pretty mild aroma of mild hops and malts, standard pale lager flavor with somewhat of a crisp, ricey bite.  Palate is smooth, medium to light in body without being excessively thin.  It’s not a great beer but it exceeded my expectations and hit the spot at the time, complemented the sushi nicely although nothing like a nice saison would have.
