Not good.  But not absolutely horrible either.  That’s the best that I can say to describe this beer.  Wonder why they sell it at the cheapo conveyor belt sushi place? Well it’s a fairly good pairing to rolled sushi and better yet "cheap" aka "old" sushi.  Bubbly with very little to no distinguishing flavors, this pale lager definitely can act as a palate cleanser.  Especially good with "cheap" sushi.
Clear, good head, good carbonation, malty aroma.  Some malty, but very light taste.  Drinkable - really no flaws, but not my style.
330ml can at hotel in Taiwan. This one is okay to drink. A little thin and fizzy but not too bad for what it is. I think I will be able to finish this one.

Experienced from a 12oz bottle in a kolsch glass.  The beer pours a straw-colored yellow hue, with a smallish white head.  Aromas coming through in the nose are faint to nearly non-existent.  A very slight pilsner malt character, and little else.  Notes were to restrained, even for this very light style.  The palate reflected the adjunct-enhanced character of beers like Miller and Bud Light.  Low levels of flavor, worsened by high carbonation.  The finish is spritzy, crisp, and not a little boring.  Overall, a disappointing effort, even with showing respect for the confines of the style.
Tried on bottle. Common lager taste, no bitterness, very watery. Disappointing.

Another poor pale lager.  Pours a pale straw yellow with a thin white head and decent lacing.  Aroma is almost non existent but rice and grassy.  Taste is grassy, rice with a faint hop.  Fairly crappy beer.

Overly gassy, grainy with hints of rice and not much hop character. Poor pale lager, sold at inflated price in London as its from Japan and therefore in some way ’exotic’, when its basically just a below-average lager with distinctly Budweiserish tendencies.

Pours pale yellow with a small head.
Nose is very faint but does shows some grassy hops and light malt.
Flavours are similarly lacking, with weak notes of grainy, cardboardy malt and some grassy more hops.
Carbonation is too high.
This is a Japanese pale lager with a fair amount of rice adjunct. Not great but fine. What else can you say. Serving: Can and Bottle

330 ml bottle. Rated @ 12.12.2009.

Pours a clear yellow colour without a head. Weak aroma of malts. Flavour of some malts and hops, nothing remarkable. Light bodied and a very watery mouthfeel. Just a basic pale lager.
(22 oz bottle)  Picked up for a Japanese dinner with friends.  Although it went well with the meal, I’ve had better Japanese beers than this.  I defiantly could taste the AB in it.
0.33L bottle at Fuji Sushi in Trier. Pale yellow with good head but almost no carbonation. Smell is unremarkable. Taste is thin in a bitter trend. Not a great beer IMO.
Very light lager.  Foamy white head that lasts a while.  Smooth with little real taste.

A: The pour is a light golden straw color with a voluminous white head that settles down to a thin layer.

S: The nose is sweet and lightly grainy with notes of rice in the background that become more prominent as the beer sits in the glass for awhile. Pretty standard and unoffensive.

T: A similar story with the flavor. Plenty of sweetness with a definite adjunct taste, but it’s a fairly mild and crisp beer, not like the adjunct lagers of this country.

M: Light in body with a lively level of carbonation.

D: For what this beer is and the meal I had it with, it worked quite well. I don’t really think I’ll be sitting down with a sixer of Kirin Ichiban all the time, but it’s a nice light beer.
Draught in The Chimney House, Brighton - 28/8/10. Golden colouring and grainy taste. Pretty standard lager.
Bottled. Clear yellow color, short head. Aroma of some hop, bit grain, bit rice, bit skunky. Typical pale lager taste, bit dryish.
Golden colored brew. Dusty nose. Watery. Some malts, butter, metallic. Drinkable, but really not outstanding.

330 ml bottle from Alcool NB Liquor.  Pours a clear pale yellow gold with thin white head.  Grainy aroma with corn, rice and a very light spiciness.  Taste quite similar.  Mediocre but better than one might expect for a macro lager.

Bottle from Alko. Standard lager colour with small white head. Grainy malts on the nose. Sweetish malty taste is a bit buttery. Light/medium palate and oily mouthfeel. Quite good quality but dull lager beer.
Aroma and color of a pale lager macro, but the hop content is a little bit stronger here.   This tastes remarkably similar to Miller Lite.
A good standard beer. It’s nice when bottled, but terrific when served cold from the tap.

Van dit bier proefden we eentje met een vervallen versheiddatum(26.01.10) en eentje die nog niet vervallen (18.12.10) was. Het verschil was duidelijk: zoetig karton bij het ‘oude’ pintje, een frisse pils met zachte hoptoetsen (en een lichte zwavelgeur) bij het ‘jonge’exemplaar. Moraal van het verhaal: Pils moet zo jong mogelijk gedronken worden.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. It poured a very pale golden colour with a big white foamy head. Aroma is not very inviting, metallic nose with notes of grains and grass. The flavour is a slight improvement over the aroma, but still not what I would call good. Notes of malts, grass and a faint hint of hops. This is a nice lawnmower-beer, but if you’d like to actually taste something stay away.

The beer pours a straw yellow color with a white head. The aroma is rice, corn and some grassy hops. The flavor is very sweet. I get a lot of grass along with some corn and bready malts. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Not as bad as expected but not something I care to try again.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a small frothy white head that leaves good sticky lacing. The aroma is corn malt and rice. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet malt with honey and a bitter finish. A decent pale lager from Kirin.

Bouteille 650 ml. 5%. Couleur jaune doré, effervescence grossière, mousse blanche. Arôme de malt. Une bière qui ne sort pas de l’rodinaire mais qui se boit bien. Notes de malt, un goût légèrement sucré et une finale presque sans amertume. Bonne

Can. Pale golden pour, medium head. Aroma of faint grains and malt.
Flavour is quite sweet with grains corn and rice, some bitterness in the after taste. (unlike the commercial description) Not too bad.
Fairly basic foreign Pale Lager. What can I expect, there are so many beers out there just like this. Nothing special at all. And its made by Budweiser, not the Japanese.

Well, the color is a light clear yellow. Head doesn’t last long. Little lacing. Smell and taste is of rice and grain. Where are the hops and malts? I guess beer from across the country is way different than ours.

Mouthfeel is very clean and crisp.

Overall, nothing I would ever recommend or buy again. Very light beer, I’d rather spend money on an American marco.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-18-2008 05:09:39
Draft at a Japanese food joint. No wonder this is brewed by AB; tastes like a typical AB macro product. Corn is abundant. The only high point is its moderately crispy dry finish.

Clear golden color with a rich sparkle. Nice shining white head. Aroma is light malty with a hint of citrus. Quite plain malt flavor yet refreshing. Very dry finish with a sugar and tobacco aftertaste.

Had taste from bottle at Goten in Nashville. Tried this next to a Sapporo, and Kirin didn’t compare all that kindly. Very pale light yellow. Boring nothing nose. Body of the beer was less full to me than the Sapporo. Didn’t like this beer long ago in my past, and I still don’t love it now.

12 oz. bottle from a lady at work. She is from Taiwan and loves this beer, and so she decided to give me a bottle; thanks Marida. Transparent golden body with a fluffy head that seems to be sticking around, wait....no it’s fading quickly. Brewed by Anheuser-Busch in Los Angeles. Skunk and grass make up the aroma. Very watery in terms of palate. The flavor is watered-down. Light grass flavor is all that I can taste. Truly a shit bomb.

Bottle. Skunked. The bottle date only went back to October of 2009, but apparently that was enough to allow the photochemical reaction to take place turning my lovely hops into putrid smelling and tasting evil. Because the process had not fully completed, I was able to get the general idea of the beer, which unfortunately was nothing to brag about. The beer was light and crisp with minimal flavor. I did get some corn.

Bottle [12oz] at Sushi Xtra.  Pours a clear, bubbly gold with a small diminishing fizzy white head. Aroma is sweet, with rice and grain -- overly sweet and dull. Flavour is watery and sweet, grainy with rice. Light to average bodied. A whole lot of ’meh’.

Not very good at all...I was given this bottle by a friend who got a six pack and didn’t like the beer and I am beginning to see why.  It tastes like a skunky Natural Ice...well, maybe a little bit better than that, but not very good at all.  Has little to no aroma, the appearance is nothing short of bland and the taste is near the same....there is a hint of hops in there, but it is overwhelmed by skunk (this beer is not old and is in a brown bottle...).  Overall, not a very good beer, but I guess its ok for a pale lager.  If you like beer flavored water, then you might like it.  1.8

12oz bottle at a local Chinese restaurant 

Appearance: Clear golden with a small white head, no lacing 

Aroma: Pale malts, honey and citrus 

Taste: Honey and citrus 

Clean and refreshing beer
Pours light golden color, small white head and medium to high carbonation.  Light barley and hay aroma with fairly clean finish.  Not a lot of taste in this beer.

12 ounce bottle - $1.29 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia. Bottled on March 2, 2010.

Appearance: Pours a clear, dandelion-hued body with a billowing, white head with some staying power.

Smell: Simple, rudimentary nose of lightly sweet-scented barley, sun-dried grain husks, and a modestly spicy, grassy hops.

Taste: Faint maltiness with a light cereal sweetness and a pervasive, disagreeable husk accent. Noble hop character with a light spiciness and balancing bitterness. Crisp, dry finish.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation. Mouthfeel is a tad watery.

Drinkability: Unremarkable, unmemorable lager, though, it does serve to provide a modicum of refreshment. Still, it’s not particularly pleasant and one I don’t see myself revisiting, even at the local sushi joint, as I tend to stick to the sake. It did look nice, but if that was enough, then I could skip the beer store and just cruise Google Image.

Bottle. Pours a pale golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of cereal malt and grass. Malt and corn flavour with a light grassy hop bitterness. Quite bland and boring. Overall not that enjoyable.
Pours pale yellow. Nose and mouth is skunk grass and mildew. Rated 2/8/2000
Had on draft.  Pours a clear yellow with a thin white head.  Grainy and grassy taste.  Watery.
Bottle@Home, says Brewed in Russia. Grainy aroma. Flavour is very refreshing but I had it pretty cold. Overall not bad, but interesting of course.
Golden pour from bottle, fast fading medium white head. Standard lager. Better than the other Japanese lagers.
Bottle 330ml. Another boring pale lager. Aroma of straw; and sweet taste with light bitterness. Palate is fizzy and thin. Yellow, with a thin head.
Smooth golden color, typical lager taste with a heavy aroma when poured from the bottle.  My first Asian beer, but I hope to try more to see if there is anything better out there.

09/03 A 0.33 l bottle brought to Croatia from an Asian shop in Mitte, Berlin. Brewed in Kaliningrad. It poured golden body with small head. Some hay and grainy aroma, a little bit of rice don’t miss of course. Grainy and honey malt flavor, watery and thin bodied. Finish was shorter, with some herbal hop bitterness finally emerged. Still, it’s quite boring and typical pale lager, not so much in Asian style though.
Classic pilsner taste and look.  Not much else to say...  Goes well with Sushi however.
Pours a medium yellow with a white head. Aroma is a bit like bleach. Taste is pretty smooth, but flavor is of a sharp earthy cheese.
toast, yellow,clear, white foam, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, flat, the beer need more tast.
Sweetish-bland. Or just bland. Dunno really. Don’t care. A waste of your money if you expect anything but a glass filler.
Pours golden with white head, aroma is corn, cereal, and hay.  Taste is corn, rice, and hay with a bit of dryness at the end.  Not very good.
This was a pretty standard asian beer albeit a little heavier in the malts than others i have tasted. Color was pale gold and it didnt have much of an aroma. Pretty hard to drink.

Bottle in Folkets Park, Malmö.
Clear yellow coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet aroma of malts, caramel and hay.
Sweet flavour of malts, hay and corn with notes of hops.
Hoppy finish.

Bottle.

A - Light golden yellow. Large, fluffy white head. Recedes about average with a bit of lacing.

S - Slight sweet, cooked grain malts.

T - Lots of sweet grain malt taste. Not a lot else, really. A little bit of grassy hops. Very adjunct lager tasting.

M - Light and crisp. High carbonation, and fizzy.

D - Alright. Light and easy to drink, but the flavor isn’t really great. Not much flavor, just sweet grain corn/rice flavor.

Notes: Taste a lot like a macro. A bit more sweet and grain taste than other Macros, but that’s not necessarily a good or bad thing.

Bottle:
Hoppy citrus smell.
Opaque hazy golden yellow color.
Very small white head disappears quick to no head.
Taste is a bit spicy, slight hoppy and s amll hint of corn.

Longneck bottle poured into tulip. Golden yellow and crystalline color, with a fluffy, dense and thick head. Quite carbonated. Aroma is malty at most. Taste is at first very pleasant, with some quick sweet notes, soon followed by an acidic, fishy taste that I really don’t dig. I am not sure if this one had been stocked in poor condition and got ruined, but anyway... Watery as it should be for the genre. Refreshing. Supposed to go really well with seafood, sushi. I can only wish my next one won’t taste fishier than the sushi itself!

Bottle at home. Pours clear gold with a thick creamy, foamy, white head. Aroma of soapy grainy malts with some nice oak and complexity. Flavor is pub ale with some smooth malts, not bad. Creamy texture makes a good mouthfeel. Quite a decent lager.
Bouteille achetée en Ontario. Bière blonde-dorée classique, commerciale, bière qui ne se démarque pas de ses concurrents. agréable sans plus. 2/10

Eh, ruining the chronological order of my rates because I can’t be bothered not to rate these beers tonight online while I’m tasting it now that I have internet again. 0.33l bottle brewed for Kirin Europe by PIT, Kaliningrad. A Japanese beer brewed under license in Russia for a German distributor. Cute. Pale golden colour, small white head, went away fast.  Sweetish grainy nose mingling with somehow fresh grassy hop notes. Sweetish, alcohol-like sweaty taste. Odd fruity notes pop up from there. Some very light hoppiness, herbal-grainy, carrying some bitterness near the end. Meh.
Refrigerated bottle.  Taste is corn, some alcohol (the ABV on  this one should have been easy to hide behind some taste) and a hint of metallic.  This is not very good beer.

Arrrrgh! Once again, we here in New Jersey are left to settle for a seemingly Japanese import beer that’s really made in Canada! There; now that I’ve gotten that off my chest...
the beer pours a nice deep gold, with a fairly long lasting white head. Nose of citrus and honey, maybe some fresh baked bread tossed in there too.
Nice flavor that resembles the same charcteristics as the nose, maybe with a bit more fruitiness to it. Good, medium-light body.One of the more heartier efforts from Kirin.
Perhaps this is nit-picking, but I’d prefer my Japanes beer to actually COME from Japan, not Canada; especially when I’m paying import prices!

0,33 l bottle (I think this was brewed in Kaliningrad of all places...). Nice golden color with a big and fluffy white head. Nose is very malty, with a hint of grass. Flavor is also malty, but a very watery body domiates. Not very memorable.
Tried this at a Japanese Restaurant in Albany.  There was nothing offensive about this beer.  I was expecting some refreshment and maybe a touch of hop character, but it was more on the sweet side.
12 oz. pour from bottle.  Very smooth, well balanced lager.  Maybe I had one too many, but this goes very well with sushi and edamame.  Decent go to beer when you need a break from the big boys.
Although not remarkable, it was enjoyable. Pours pretty much like a typical American macro.  Slightly hoppy aroma, that drinks easy with a light malted corn taste and a crisp dry finish.
Yellow colored with little white head. Fruity and estery aroma. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is same with apple and lemon in start, aftertaste turns to only mildly hopped.
american mass market lager taste...a bit dry, peppery. would rather drink a bud.
355 ml bottle.  Pours golden in colour, no head. No aroma, macro lager taste. Made by A-B, not Japanese.  Not good.
Not much to say here.  Another POS light lager...does anyone actually drink this sh*t?

Bottle , Brewed By AB in the US . A clear light straw color pour with a thin fizzy short lasting white head , no lacing , medium carbonation . Aroma is slightly grainy ,a little corn and a hint of sweetness in the background , faint hops . Flavor is light and crisp , again a very light sweetness with some faint hop notes , nothing offensive , light body , thin watery mouthfeel typical of the style , light grainy finish , sessionable and drinkable , a good try but probably nothing I would buy again . . . meh

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
It pours a pale gold color with a foamy white head.  The nose is what you would expect, some grain and a whiff of hops.  The flavor is crisp and clean with slight notes of grain and a bit of grass.  It has a little more sweetness than the average Japanese macro.  It is highly carbonated, light on the tongue, and has a hint of dryness.  Not bad to go with your sushi or hibachi.

This one pour a somewhat pale golden color with a big white head. Aroma was corn, adjuncts and some copper. Flavor was a little metallic, somewhat grassy, and corn. Not good but nothing too offensive for this style.
Bottle.Pours pale straw with a 2 " creamy white head. Aroma of grain and light grass.Taste of ceral grain, lingering sweet, with a strange metallic touch at the end. Not interesting.

This beer is effortlessly bland. Another bubbly hot spring of a lager, that tastes like an unfortunate tandem of dish water and tinfoil. Not quite as loose and aimless as its Budweiser contemporary, Kirin Ichiban’s flavor is still a soapy abyss of fizzy carbonation and soppy yellowness - both in color and courage - that leaves the consumer feeling empty. On a plus side, that deer/dragon hybrid on the label looks pretty cool.
bottle - not a whole lot to say about this one, typical malty, sweet asian brew, with undertones of rice and corn.

Pours pale yellow with two finger pillowy, white head. Aroma is cereal grain, dried grass, light bready sweetness, and metallic notes. Flavor is cereal grain, sweet grass, light toast and metallic notes. Palate is light, slightly slick and dry. Not very good, for $9/6pk (here) it is a huge ripoff.

A - Grainy with a touch of citrus
A - pale gold with thick white head
T - Sweet and slightly sour with a dry finish
P - Thin
O - It is alright, but not too memorable

Can.  Pours a crystal clear amber color with absolutely no head.  Aromas of sugar, hay, and floral which are all very light.  Palate is very thin and crisp which I am sure is what the brewer wanted.  Absolutely a clean finish, no lingering taste.  Taste consists of tin, bits of sugar, and some hay.  If you are going to drink Japanese beer, I would recommend Sapporo.

(12 ounce bottle - pint glass)  Pours a clear yellow liquid with a medium to large white head.  That head dissapates rather fast but leads to some decent lacing.  Taste is a blend of hay malt and a less noticable herbal hop taste, it also has a bad yeast component too.  It is light bodied, thin texture, and has a lively carbonation.  Kind of dissapointed.
Pours clear yellow with a fluffy white head and a cheap beer aroma. There is a faint caramel malt flavor with some hop bitterness. There’s nothing else to say about this one.

In NY on Tap.  No much aroma and taste - very Bud like.  Light gold and rough (not creamy) head.  Flavor was limited so the bitterness was more a distraction.  Very limited finish except for a "metalic" after-taste.  This is not the Ichiban I had in Japan, and being Japanese, this is disappointing.

(wh-can gl-lbl, "Original Brew", "Draft Beer", 5%)



gl-opq, ^co2, no head, musty T1T2, bitter T3, crisp, ~thru.
Bottle from Føtex. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Moderate malty bready aroma. Light bitter slightly bready flavor. Short light bitter finish. Watery palate.

Bottle/22 - Poured a pale yellow in color with a medium white head that stuck around to produce some nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma, unfortunately is mildly hoppy with the distinct presence of corn and other brewing adjuncts.  Flavor is typical of a megabrew, as one might expect, washed out, indistinct, corn, almost no hops... brewed to be cheap to produce and transportable... decidedly not for drinking pleasure...

Smells like any other macro lager. Drank from a can and the only way I could judge the appearance was when it accidentally poured on my shirt - looked okay, boring yellow. Boring lager, really, but it’s drinkable.

Can &#40Thanks FatPhil&#41 - Golden with a white head.  Grainy, grassy and malty aroma with hints of corn and lime.  Grassy and malty taste, with a faint bitterness. Quite refreshing, but rather bland.

330 ml bottle. Golden color, frothy white head. Vegetable aroma. Medicinal alcohol flavor (for this ABV!?), malty background. Medium body, medium carbonation. I think the most informative review I can offer is that I have a second bottle in my fridge and I just don’t WANT to drink it.

05.10.2007, 0,33l Bottle. Pale yellow color. weak malty aroma. thin body with no aftertaste.
14.06.2019. 0,33l Can. Asakusa, Tokyo. Thanks Eivind. Still pale yellow with no head.
Golden yellow color with a very faint white head.  Barely any noticeable smell and tastes much like drinking Bud.
22nd June 2008. On tap in an Edinburgh bar. Smooth lager with a mild malt tone. Inoffensive and drinkable.

640ml bottle. Very clear and a light gold c]olour with a large rocky head with slight carbonation. Corn starch, hops and grain aromas dominate. Despaite the bland aroma nd appearance the taste is not too bad and it is quite refreshing.

bottle from asian shop in antwerp, yellow/golden colour with unstable although not so bad white head. strange smell. Taste: grassy, much too sweet, bitter and watery. Very artificial beer! If this is a ’good’ japanese beer, I won’t know how bad the ’average’ japanese beers will be! Bwéik! They don’t make me happy with such a beers!

2009-07-04, botle 7 C,
This one is licens brewed in Russia
AP: Great creamy head like marshmallow, pilsner coloured body
AR: Pilsner.
F: Dry, light hoppy, wee bitterness ie the prefect grasscutting lager (but there are better ones...)
Canned, thanks fatphil! Hazy yellow-orange. Quite flowery aroma. The palate is thick and the taste surprisingly good and strong. A bit of honey in the finish.

12oz bottle, can and on tap.  Drank alot while in Thailand.  Pours a cloudless golden straw, with a pertinent white head.  Malt dominates the aroma with a  light sweetness.  The taste is a real smooth, yet dry tasting malt base with a dash of hops.  Japanese bud.
Pours yellow with a white head.  Your standard fair lager.  Not much to the nose or taste but decent enough.  Slight metallic finish.
Not bad, but basically a Japanese Bud but with a nice rich darker color, ricey and Budsy with a premium price... will stick with Bud for $2 less per six pack.

Draft  Pours a clear gold with a decent white head.  The ehead lasts fairly well and laces spottingly.  The aroma is grains and grass.  The carbonation is okay.  Has a sweet flavor which is clean and refreshing.  Not a great beer but drinkable   Has a light body.  The finish and aftertaste are weak at best.  I didn’t expect this to be half as good as it was.
Bottle.  Pours a clear glowing golden with large carbonation bubbles.  Light aroma, some cereal sweetness.  Tastes like rice jello, sweet with a light clean hoppiness.
Very pale yellow, scant head.  Aroma of grass and grain.  Mild taste, almost absent.  Faint bitterness.  Overall not worth the effort.

Poured a clear medium yellow. 
Nose was of biscuit and grains.
Taste is grainy, a little sweet in the middle, mild hop bitterness, finishes with an off chalky graininess.

Appearance: Transparent yellow with a white head that lasts longer than many other all malt Japanese lagers.
Aroma: Earthy hop, mildly roasted grain.
Flavor: Balanced roasted grain with gentle earthy bitterness.
Comment: Dry, soft mouthfeel.  From start through the finish this had a surprisingly good balance of malt, hop and carbonation.  It was hard to tease out the individual flavors; the whole seems better than the sum of the parts, making this moderately successful.  The malt is a bit thin on the finish but then the bittering takes over.  I prefer this drier, earthy hop character to other Japanese makers use of sweeter malts and floral hops in their 100% malt beers.

My favorite faux japanese beer, made by Bud but doesn’t taste like bud. 

Goes down smooth at Arrirang.
I thought this was an acceptable beer, considering its ingredients. Palatable but average. The best thing I can say about this beer is that its not a bad beer.

(bottle). Clear gold color. Medium white head, which is mostly diminishing. Light grainy aroma and flavor. Avg duration. Fizzy finish with light bitterness. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.
Bottle. 12 oz. Where do I start? All around pure garbage. Pours like water, smells vaguely like urine, tastes similar. I never want to drink this again. Ever.

Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head. It has a faint aroma of malted corn and hops. This beer tastes of corn and bitter hops. Not the best beer, but a pretty good well-rounded lager that is neither too hoppy nor too malty.
Golden brown color, thin head, malty sort of gritty taste, won’t be buying it again anytime soon.
Another bland, gross, and unwanted Asian pale lager.  Why is this the only beer they export so widely?

Mega-disappointment when I discovered what I thought was an import was in fact "manufactured" in Los Angeles by Anheuser-Busch.  That makes this the Bud of Japan, and it really wasn’t any better than that.  Is the "real", made-in-Japan Kirin any better?

24 oz can. Pours a crystal clear pale golden color with a thick billowy white head. Aroma is grassy and grainy, with mostly malt and just a bit of spicy hops and a slight fruitiness to it. Flavor is very bland, slightly metallic and awfully grainy. The finish isn’t quite as smooth as they say though there isn’t too much bitterness. Mostly sweet with a little bit of grassy hops. Light bodied and pretty weak all around. I need to put it back in the fridge because this needs to be served ice cold
Though it’s all over these days, I tried it a couple of years back while visiting Hawaii.  Pretty much your typical pale lager in cool packaging &#40well... compared to American versions!&#41.

On tap at PF Changs. Decent but light headed. Vivid golden color. Aroma is some malt but nothing distinguishable. Flavor is a bit sweet, bitter aftertaste (for an int’l style pilsener), quite crisp but a bit thin. Nothing to write home about but a decent pilsener.

12oz bottle: appearance is golden brown with small white head, aroma is very grainy and slightly skunky, flavor is pretty malty with a slightly sweet flavor it it, very light bodied and no off flavors.
Bottle. Poured a pale golden body with thin head. Aroma is light citrus and grain. Flavor is the same. Went flat too quick.

Pour from a 12oz bottle. Clear golden brew with two fingers of head and good head retention. Malty aroma - bread and caramel - with a weak floral hops and slightly metallic overtones. Taste is light sweet malt - again bread with caramel overtones - with modest floral hops emerging later in the swallow. End with a very nice though restrained grassy bitter. I enjoyed Kirin now and then in the 70’s and 80;s but really drifted away from it. I first reviewed it in 2009 and wondered why I ever liked it - it was skunky, adjunct laden and devoid of character. The new 100% malt formula is a huge improvement and return to the brew that I liked in the past. Not to be too glowing in praise here... it has risen to the level of passable mediocrity, up from being banal and marginally offensive. But let’s celebrate every success... 

8/17/2009: Pour from a 22 Oz brown bottle. Typical pale lager look - light yellow with two fingers of white head. Slightly skunky aromoa, though checking the bottle it is well within the freshness date. Not much to the aroma. Not much to the flavor either - weak malts and slightly dry finish. Brewed by AB, it has all the zest zing and excitement of a Budweiser. Which is to say - not much.
Pours a light gold with a quickly disppearing thin white head. Has a very slight hoppy aroma. The taste is a bit sweet with plenty of carbonation. Light body, dry finish.

330 ml bottle. Brewed by Co Pit Ltd, Kaliningrad, Russia. Finland.
Clear golden colour with small white head. Malts and rice in aroma. Malty flavour with some hoppiness. Nothing interesting. 



350 ml can. 5.5%. Brewed by Kirin Brewery Zhuhai Co Ltd, Zhuhai Guangdong, China. Thanks FatPhil!

Slightly hazy golden colour with small white head. Grain malt and rice in aroma. Some hoppiness in flavour. Boring.

500 ml can from Japan (arigato, Daddy-san!) shared with Lubiere, served cold in a Scotch-Irish taster glass. JL 29/09. 



App.:  Clear golden, remnants of a white head.
  
Aroma:  Light grain, a little wet ash and dust, very light, vague fruitiness, a little biscuit.
  
Palate:  Medium body and fairly full carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Light biscuity, fruity malt, some light grass, hay, minerals; dry with a littel bitterness and a pleasant biscuit finish, better than the nose!



Not great
A pale lager with a thick collapsing white head. A lightly herbal malt aroma, lightly hopped. In mouth, run of the mill lager, with light German hops. 500 ml can from japan, thanks Karl.

Appearance: Clear and golden in color with a thick white head. The head leave a nice lace ring at the top of the glass.

Smell: Nothing outstanding. It smelled of grains and rice. There were faint hints of caramel malt and a bit of grass.

Taste: Starts with a bit of sweet malt but ends a bit bitter. The rice and grass dominate the taste and there is a bit of underlying skunk to it.

Mouthfeel/drinkability: Light bodied and in taste overall I this is a great beer with oriental cuisine. By its self it is nothing special but pair it up with some sushi or Thai food and it is wonderful.
Pint can: pint glass: Macro, macro, macro.  Pours a dark honey, leaving 1/2 finger head.  Thin nose of hops and skunk.  Mild taste, some hops, some wheats.  OK.

I typically drink this beer at the local sushi joint. It goes well without overpowering the fare. Light, mild flavor with a good head and moderate amounts of carbonation. Light, almost nonexistent finish. I don’t find anything bad about this beer, but nothing to put the asses in the seats either.

[330ml bottle from Wing Yip, Edgeware Road, London] This is for the UK version produced under license by Wells & Young at 5% ABV.  My wife and sister-in-law insisted that I buy an oriental beer to go with an oriental banquet that they were preparing, and this was the most unusual (hah!) one in the oriental supermarket we visited to get supplies.  It pours the usual gold with a moderate, diminishing white head.  Slight fizz, definitely less than is usual for a mass-market "world lager".  It smells quite attractive - lemony with light malts - and I was starting to hope it might be better than my expectations.  However, none of this is evident in the taste which is very bland, with some cardboard and corn.  The finish does have more bitterness than many other lagers.  Not the worse pale lager I’ve had by a long stretch, but nevertheless a forgettable beer indistinguishable from the millions of other "world lagers".  Interestingly though, whilst it held little attraction as a drink in its own right it did seem to be the best drink of those we tried to go with my wife’s delicious spread of neoodles and dim sums - no flavour to compete with the food, and just enough fizz to cut through the carbs without being so fizzy that it made you bloated.  So it does have its uses... c3

Somewhat filtered straw colour; almost no head.

Not quite pee like aroma - but close. Weak aroma anyway.

Some bitterness and sourness.

Thin body, fizzy fresh.

 Palate and sourness makes it fresh. Not bad if offered. But not good.

 Purchased in SuperBrugsen.

Bottle from a Japanese restaurant. I saw the beer in the book “300 beers to try before you die”. Well, I could live without ever trying it.
 Pours a straw color with thin head. Aroma is light with notes of pine hops, lemon grass, and biscuit malt. Light body. Flavor is light pine hops, some citrus and sweet malt. Finish is long but barely noticeable. On a plus side I did not notice any adjuncts, but it still tastes like a pale lager to me.

Was attracted to the neat looking can. Unfortunately this is a very run-of-the-mill lager beer. From a Japanese company I really expected something a bit more than a crappy Budweiser wannabe beverage.

Pours a golden yellow with little to no head.  Light smell of grains but nothing distinct.  Tastes like it smells, nothing special, just some light grains.  Goes down pretty easily, like water.  It has a odd aftertaste that pretty much kills the beer.  Overall, something to drink when there isn’t any other option available.  Just slightly better than a Coors Light or Bud.

33cl bottle poured into a dimpled mug.  Clear straw with about one finger white head.  Aroma is dirty socks and belly button.  Flavor seems artificially sweet.  Probably a rice adjunct.  Almost no hops presence.  Very little carbonation.  Watery.  Not bad but not good.
Pours a pale gold with a small white head. Flat grain, slight grape, corn in aroma and flavors. Very dry mouth.

I have passed on this beer many times while dining and now I know why. Light washed out lager aroma, look and taste. Nothing about this beer is outstanding or even satisfactory. Leave beer making to the europeans.
meh...............boring pale lager......what more can i say? corny, vegetal, boring lawnmower beer.

Bottle. Aromas of grain, herbs and cooked vegetables. Head is large, frothy, white with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is bubbly, clear light amber. Flavor starts and finishes lightly acidic. Palate is light, watery with a lively carbonation and a dry finish. A light and refreshing Asian Pale Lager. Goes well with typical Japanese cuisine.

Bottle from a local Thai restaurant. Pours a light yellow color with thin head. Aroma is light with notes of wheat, wet grass, some light yeast hints of honey. Flavor is light as well with notes of hay, yeast, honey, slight floral notes toward finish. Generally light body with watery finish. Not bad for a pale lager.
bottle, pours light gold, thin white head.  Skunk and malt nose.  Pale malt flavor with a thin hop bitter finish.  Boring.
Pale yellow of color wtih a white head. A pretty ordinary lager aroma - flat, malty and almost no hops. A thin flavor of malt and no hops.

12 oz bottle. Pours a piss yellow color with a small white head. This one taste mostly water but a slightly fruit taste to it. It’s smooth with no aftertaste, but nothing about it stands out significantly.
Fairly bland. Smooth tasting. Little to no aftertaste. Pretty dry with a bit of a grape flavor.
Tap. This beer is quite boring. It was a good match for the food i was eating. Otherwise, this beer has no flavor and can be pounded like domestic cheap beers, at least it doesn’t taste like them.

Boring and light, poured a suprisingly decent head . Somewhat unsavoury aroma. Quite dry and too fizzy, this is obvioulsy a one dimentional beer. Gold in colour. Clean and easy to slam, it’s not horrible, its just not that good. You could easily drain all 6 in under 20 minutes. Feed the leftover bottles to friends who want to try something foreign.

Had a few of these while eating sushi the other night.  Just seemed the appropriate thing to do.  Not much good for anything besides pretending to be cultured at Japanese restaurants and saki bombing.
Light drinkuing very clear golden beer witk mall frothy head leaving almost no lacing. Slight malt aroma end hardly any finish. Good malt/bitter balance.
Major corn/rice  flavor and aroma. Medium clear yellow color with a dry finish.  Better than some other pale lagers but not many.  Extremely watery.

Golden color...fluffy head, with good lacing.  Light aroma.  Mild malt flavor up front, with just a touch of sweetness...crisp mouthfeel.  Back is very light, with somewhat of a dry finish.  Nothing really too complex with this brew...pretty light and very easy drinking.
Bottle, #476. Straw yellow pour with small head. Cheap corn beer aroma and flavor. Bud Light from Japan!!
Smooth pale lager, nothing special here besides being my first Japanese beer...smooth and refreshing though
22 oz. bottle shared with friends. Pours very pale yellow with fairly large white head. Aroma of pils and rice. Taste is nice and crisp, goes down easy. Much tastier and better than BMC.

12oz bottle.  pale yellow pour with a thin white head.  light malt aroma with hints of grass.  thin to medium texture.  little carbonation.  tastes are bready malts with lemon.  not horrible, but not necessarily good.
your standard asin beer. pale yellow pour with very small white head, sweet aroma and taste. not bad
Bottle. Poured a pale yellow color, almost no head at all. Aroma was grains, grass, and malts. Flavor was weak malts and grains. Not a lot to this beer. Very light body, thin smooth beer.
Very light in color and aroma.  The aroma really doesn’t have much in it.  The taste is bland and watery.  It’s an ok beer.
12oz bottle of this at the Cherry Blast art event in SE Washington DC.  Slightly grassy, slightly metallic aroma.  Flavor is slightly malty, a little more grass.  Dry on the finish.

Pours a golden yellow color.  Very little malt in the taste, beer taste is very light, very watery.  Little to no aftertaste but a drinkable beer.  Not a beer I’d go out of my way to drink but overall just okay.

Pours clear golden into the glass, with a white, nitrous-induced head that diminishes quickly to trace lace. The nose is fairly sweet, with some corn and grain notes. Overly carbonated, the flavors are dull and lost under the zesty mouthfeel.  Some macro corn, grain and bitters, then light hops to close, but it’s so underdone and thin... almost too seltzer-like.  Too bad, not a complement to my menu.

Unpasteurized can. Drank next to the new, all-malt version. Don’t know what to do with that one on RB...This one was much lighter than the other, and fruitier, with more hop flavor, actually. The other one gets better points for the malt, but this one might be a better drinker. Light and easy to down, but nothing special in the least.
12 oz bottle.  This is very good with sushi, but just tastes bad on its own.  Hint of metallic bitterness in the finish.

No 703

Rated: 06.03.2009

Bottle brown, 330 ml

Appearance: Pours citrusy, lemony orange, very hazy body body but now without any sediments, definitely too hazy for such a wattery commercial lager, head is initially small, white, foamy, quickly decreasing to a minimal froth, no lacing, body carbonation is medium.

Aroma: Definitely very expressed cooked potatoes at front, when you plongue deeper some notes of salty minerality, citruses, mainly lemon, corn, rice, barley malt quite non-existant, wattery rug, milk, water from ready boiled steam rice.

Flavour: Storngly alcoholic as usual, Polish European Strong Lagers has much more alcohol and it is as felt much smaller ammount in those Japanese Pale Lagers. They do taste strongly alcoholic, gentle citrusy accent, gentle chalkyness, highly mineral, salty, thin, corn, rise, some positive aspect of refreshing citrusy and aromatic herbal hoppyness of German-like origin. Finish duration is rather short.

Palate: Body is light, texture is rather wattery, carbonation on palate is soft, finish feel is moderately mineral, moderately astringent, salty, quite clean.
This beer has almost no flavor at all.  It goes down easy, but seriously, it tastes like rotten water.  Pour is piss yellow with a white head.
Bottle. Look: Yellow. No head. Smell: Malt, some matured cheese thing going on (in a bad way). Taste: Malt and sweet corn. Overall: Thin.
bottle from thai place outside knoxville. darker gold than sapporo. and more carbonated. lasting head. smells more like old style.  tastes the same, too.

Poured a glowing, clear yellow orange into a tall glass. Aroma is very sterile. taste is smooth and lightly sweet in the aftertaste. Mellow hops in the finish. Very smooth and almost Bohemian in flavor. A nice brew for A-B.

I had expected better out of this Japanese beer. Not as great as I had hoped.  At the time I rated this, my girlfriend at the time shared the same name as the first part of this beer.  They both were bitter and ended terribly. 1.6

RE-RATE 3/16/11 Bottle from World Market.  This beer pours a clear golden yellow color with a very fizzy white head.  Looks fairly standard and straightforward.



Right off the bat the aroma is very corny and metallic.  Lots of grain and cornbread.  I could smell it before I even got close to the glass. 



The flavor is bitter grain, soured bread and metallic notes.  Distasteful finish which is very bitter indeed.  Not good.
Bottle. Apperance; Golden yello, clear with a small white head.  Aroma of fruit and some sence of pear and sweet hops. and taste of some malt. Lightly sweet at the end.
Draught. Gold color with thin white head. Aroma: some malt and some citrus fruit. Flavor: some grass and corn. quite watery

Typical pale lager color with club soda like carbonation and a club soda like fizzy, instantly dissipating head.  Nose of pale malts.  Sweet taste with a subtle tang of mild hops.  A fairly drinkable brew, but certainly nothing to write home about.
Pale yellow with a white head. Light malty aroma. Flavor of rice and light malt with a sort of herby aftertaste. Not a pleasant beer.

ersma: auf meinem bier steht zwar nich "ichiban" sondern "premium lager", aber als sprachwissenschaftlich gebildeter mensch hab ich das mal als passend übersetzt :-) 
kräftig goldene farbe, mäßiger, mittelfeiner schaum, der schnell weg ist. 
geruch ist süßlich-pappig mit medizinischer note. 
antrunk ist sehr verhalten. pappig, mit chemischer süßlichkeit. die mitte ist herber, wird aber vom chemischen geschmack beherrscht. der abgang ist hopfig-süßlich und wird - na, ihr wisst schon... 
die hauseigene flasche mit geprägten drachen kommt mit schönem etikett daher. ein bunter drache dominiert die front, dazu rot, gold und weiß. sehr nett. punktabzug fürs zugeballerte rücketiket. vorne 15 hinten naja. 
fazit: außen hui, innen pfui. ein weiterer beweis für meine abneigung gegen alles, wo "premium" draufsteht. oder, um es in den worten der werbung zu sagen: nur wo "premium" draufsteht, ist auch scheixx drin.

Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia!Era migliore la mia! Ristorante Giapponese di Torino, chi non ci è mai stato è un otorino.

2/17/2009:  I was surprised to see on the label that this beer was actually brewed by A-B under the strict supervision of Kirin.  I guess that explains why this golden, transparent, highly-carbonated, and under-flavored beer tastes much like the typical American macro-lagers.  I guess that’s okay though as I don’t really want the flavor of the beer to overpower the subtle flavors of the sushi.  Outside of having one of these to accomapny my sushi dinner, I would not reach for one on the shelf to just sit down and drink on its own!



500 ml bottle enjoyed at Mr. Sushi in Gahanna,Ohio.  Rating #793 for this beer.

Golden body with a small lacing head. Malty aroma with a light hop-resiny aroma. Medium body, some malt taste and a fine hop-resin flavor. Easy drinkable beer, little bit better than the avarage lager stuffs.

12 oz bottle.  Pours golden yellow with a small head.  Smells like some corn malts and lightly hopped.  Tastes very thin like an american lager and has some corn malt taste.  Not so much that I wouldnt drink it again, but as long as someone buys it for me.
Aroma imperceptível. Coloração amarelo ouro, densa. Sabor inicialmente adocicado, mas com residual amargo, com predomínio de lúpulo.
Solid yellow with a very soft white cover.  Lightly sweet faint aroma.  Taste is better, grassy, malt cereal sweetness, lightly bitter finish.
gold blond coloured body with a white head a hoppy spicy aroma a hoppy spicy herby wattery taste with a spicy bitter finish
Clear pale goldblond coloured beer with small white head. Few aroma, a bit herby. Full bit sparkling palate. Finish is sweet and bit spicy.
Pale yellow/golden with a thin creamy just off white head.  Light malty aroma, flavor is light a bit sweet.  Finiish is dry with faint grassy hops and a sweet aftertaste.

Light golden in color with a mediocre head that disappears rather quickly.  Aroma is lightly hoppy but vague and leaves you guessing.  Typical macro lager like which is not a good thing.  Very weak in taste.

Brown bottle, 650 ml, production date 20 JUN 05, purchased at the SAQ on April 7 2006, savoured on January 24 2009; eye: golden, clear, slight effervescence, white head, no lacing; nose: corn, grain, light honey, light floral; mouth: corn, light honey, short honeyish finale, a bit thin, not much carbonation, mildly sweet, light body, foamy texture; overall: ordinary

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 650 ml, date de production : 20 JUN 05, achetée à la SAQ le 7 avril 2006, savourée le 24 janvier 2009; œil : dorée, claire, très légère effervescence, mousse blanche, pas de dentelle; nez : maïs, grain, léger miel, léger floral; bouche : maïs, léger miel, finale mielleuse courte, un peu mince, peu carbonatée, moyennement sucrée, corps léger, texture mousseuse; en résumé : ordinaire
Crushed with Jakebra.  Kinda like yeasty chlorine.  Fuckin goes down really fast though.

Pours golden color with white head.  Lots of adjunct (rice), grass, straw, some citrus.  Minimal hops.  Light bodied and easily drinkable, good with sushi.  Nothing complex or exciting here as expected.

Oct 31, 2006  
Bottle at Yamashiro, Hollywood Hills, Calif. A nice light lager, with proud head, that complemented my excellent sushi well. A tad sweet, malty with watery finish.

24 ounce can. Pours a clear golden color with a large billowy 

head, decent head retention and lacing. Very rice-like, sweet 

aroma with some very grassy, almost metallic hops. Taste is tart 

and bitter malts along with bitter hops. Sort of a gummy bear 

fruitiness is in there too. Clearly rice is used in large 

quantities here. Medium bodied.

Gillar man öl tackar man kanske inte nej till det här ölet - förutsatt att alternativ saknas - men det lär inte ge upphov till några sinnliga extaser. Den främsta reaktionen är inte njutning, det är berusning (i alla fall om man dricker tillräckliga mängder).

330 ml bottle. Very pale crsitaline colour, foamy head that doesn’t hold much. Grainy and herbs smell with maybe some citric. Anodyne watery flavor, taste of herbs with some malty sweetness and bitter end. Just another beer more, I’ve drunk some worst ones.

Draught at Jabez Clegg, Manchester.  Look, there was nothing else on and I was thirsty, OK?  Other than appearance (typical lager colouring with attractive, lasting white head) there’s very little of anything here, aroma, taste or palate.  Just an alcohol delivery system and not a very satisfactory one at that.

Pale gold color out of the bottle with a fizzy white head.  Light lemony nose with some artificial sweetness.  There is some grainy astringency with some sour lemony tones.  Not a bad generic lager, and it goes well with a sandwich, but not a very interesting beer.

Bottle from BevMo. Bottled on 03OCT08. Gold color with a substantial white head. Aromas of honey and fruit. Near medium body with frothy carbonation. Flavor is clean with some grassy hop. That touch of honey - flavor, not sweet - stays to the end. It is just a bit bitter in the finish. AB does a great job, just not very picky about which job, but this is a good thing.
Color of pee. Little head. Grassy, cardboard aroma. Flavor is gross and has some B.O in the finish. Horrible, horrible beer.
it was an ok beer. i was not to impressed with it. but i didnt expect much.  it was watery and had little flavor.
I couldnt tell the difference between this and sapporo.  I remember in college when i thought it was so flavorful! now its pretty watery but it would still do the trick in hot weather.
light golden color, white head that disappears, not alot of flavor..is this saporro in a different can?
Typical oriental macro brewed lager. Corny grassy taste. Hot day beer. Very watery.

Light malt, barely hopped. Yellow pour with white fluffy head. There is nothing special about this whatsoever. But there is nothing horrible about it either. Good enough for an everyday brew, too expensive for an everyday brew. Bottle.

<i>A Mes rate: bottle from beermerchants.com</i><br />Pale yellow gold. Cardboard and pukey malt aroma. Shit cardboard flavour with a bit of cereal. I was in a dilemma, do I drink it and rate it properly or do I give in to the Cad who is demanding the rest of my glass. Fuck it, it’s the Cad’s...

Brown glass, but skunky nonetheless. Lightly sweet. Clear golden body with a creamy eggshell head. Body is pure watery. Light grainy bitterness with a touch of stale malt. Soft. Sampled in a side-by-side, I’d usually take this over the sharper Siwo, the extreme softness here is quite redeeming.
Pale yellow pour with no head.  Regular macro beer.  No flavor and watery.  Only plus was that it came in a 22oz bottle.

draft, 16 oz, NYC. Pours a crystal clear golden color with moderate head. Aroma is a little less doughy and skunky than its american pale lager counterparts. Taste was pretty nondescript with some sweetness and a hint of hops. Palate was smooth and was the best part of the beer. Better than bud/miller but nothing too great.

bottle, carrefour, mallorca, spain. as "japan’s prime brew kirin beer"
aroma slight fruity, other than that any ordinary ale, appears clear yellow, small white head, flavor is sugar, malts, slight hops (spicy, good), great for the style.

(bottle): Pours a very pale yellow straw colored body.  small white head. Malty sweet aroma, some graininess. Grainy malty taste, maybe rice or corn. Fizzy, some alcoholic aftertaste. okay with spicy kung pao.
bottle. has a bit of a sour, grassy aroma. very plain tasting. reminds me of bud light. good to get you drunk but thats about it.

Another fine gift from Phil_L and beermerchant.com. Bottle. Pale straw yellow gold with thin quickly fading white head. Malty, a little grassy and a little watery. Not too big on flavour but not that bad either.

2008 Bottle @ Fuji Bay in NSC - Pours clear yellow with a small white head, aroma is nil except for a bit of malt and rice pilsner funk, flavour is grain, slight bitters and shit loads of water, next time, I’ll just order OJ or Iced Tea and save some money...
Pours a clear gold with a decent head and light lacing.  Light malty aroma.  Some grain is evident in the taste, overall reminds me of a mass produced american beer (like bud).
Looked like a light beer in the glass. Light to no taste, lots of bubbles. Nothing indistinguishable.

This is for "Kirin Ichiban Special Premium Reserve"

Pours a golden transparent color with a white head that disapates quickly. There is not much aroma to speak of. Budwiesser comes to mind as I drink it. Not a good taste at all. In fact it will be hard to finish the bottle. Overall this is a pretty undrinkable beer.

Bombber bottle.
Definite must at a Japanese restaurant, but otherwise pretty forgettable unless Sake bombing. Malty aroma, crisp with very light (almost undetectable) flavor.
Pours bright, clear gold into a shaker.  Sickly white head recedes to hug rim. Off malt aromas. Dry and crisp with no flavor whatsoever.

Draft at a japanese steakhouse. Reminds me faintly of a cream ale.  Clear amber yellow pour with adequate white head.  Almost no discernable aroma.  Astringent, butter, corn, grain flavors.  Budweiser of the Orient?
Pale carbonated yellow with a frothy white head. Smells and tastes pretty much the same. Sweet and easy to drink. Crisp, grassy hop bitterness. very carbonated. cardboard basement flavor.
A gift froma griend after a nights work. What can is ay about this beer besides its like a bud in a slightly better looking bottle.
Really nothing special here - but also nothing wrong with this beer. Little flavor, but it’s crisp, clean and refreshing. Would make for a great beer after mowing the grass on a hot day.
I have always hesitated to buy this beer. I found it cheap so I bought it. And boy do I regret it. It looks and tastes just like Budweiser. Shame

clear gold color, white, quickly disappearing head which leaves tiny bubbles floating on top.  mildly grassy aroma.  mild grain in the flavor.  palate is a touch fizzy.  light bodied.  not a bad brew, mostly just inoffensive.

Transparent golden beer with a weak head and no bubbles. Bitter smell like fermented rice. Somewhat citric.
Balanced bitter-watery flavour with a touch of lemon cest. Bit too watery for my taste but in general a refreshing drinkable beer.
Pours a medium golden color with the aroma of bread (yeast).  Slight hoppy initial flavor with a dry bitter finish

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a pale yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is rice with a little sourness and malts. The flavor is almost no-existing but leaves traces of rice and notes of malts. The mouthfeel is a little refreshing but i have tried better pale lagers.

huge frothy white head. excellent lacing. mostly diminishing. clear thin dark yellow body. aroma: light bread, moderate hoppy, honey. if: light bitter. ff: light sweet bitter; long duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, medium carbonastion, metallic finish. dulçor de mel,  na media commercial brasileira, sem defeitos, 5 s

Poured pale golden color into a pint glass; very little head which quickly dissipated.  Very mild cereal aroma.  Taste is very mildly sweet and malty at the front with a very slight hoppy finish.  Overall, though, there wasn’t a very strong flavor presence throughout.  Still, though, I would not say this was a terrible beer, just average.  Mouthfeel was decent, and this is very drinkable.
Pretty much no taste with a very pale color. It goes down easy and and I think thats pretty much what its made for. Cheers!!!

White head on a pale yellow body. This brew is intented to be a thirst-quencher, no more. It is obviously manuractured from rice, and there is not much taste in it. However, on a hot Summer day, it it a drinkable beer, but taste is not present.
Pale Golden beer. Has a very light taste. It’s not a very good beer, but very drinkable.

Name: Kirin Ichiban

Date: 08/03/2008

Mode: Draft

Source: Summits - Woodstock



Appearance: crystal clear yellow, fine white head, lots of patterned lace, 

Aroma: light sweet malt aroma with light floral hops, 

Flavor: cereal malt flavor that is mostly dry with only a hint of malty sweetness, light floral hops, light bitter finish, 



Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 6/20

Rating: 1.8/5.0
Drinkability: 6/10

Score: */4

(Bottle, brewed by Wells & Young, on 2008-08-09) Pale golden. Clear. Largish white head. Metallic nose with light hoppy aroma. Light-bodied soft palate with lot of carbonation. Bitterness and bit of sweetness in taste. Boring.

Love this Beer way better than Sapporo its very easy drinking and simple it is not heavy had this recently in ChinaTown in Victoria, BC pours a nice golden color and a typical lager taste it just goes well with sushi over sapporo nothing exciting just good japanese swill

This was my favorite beer when I was 15 and taking Japanese language class.  There is no denying this.  I think what I liked about it was its crisp body, pearly carbonation, and easy-to-drink grass and malt.  Tastes like a light beer, I suppose in a good way.  I won’t trash talk this beer, just know it isn’t going to win any awards anytime soon.
Bottle.  Pours yellow.  Smells and tastes light.  Like a nice American Macro.  Not bad on a hot day, but not one of my faves.
Japanese equivalent to Coors Light... still better than Bud Light though!  Good to have with Sushi since there are not many other beers and I don’t like Saki.
Light golden color, thin white head from the tap. Light malts in the nose, not much else. High drinkability but really no beer flavor.

Tap at Senor Wongs in St Paul. Tastes like nothing at all, typicall macro lager. No way you would ever be able to tell this from Bud, Miller, etc. More expensive though of course, being its brewed in Japan.
Gold pour with little head it has no real distinct elements good or bad. Better than most beers from the Japan/China area
Probobly my favorite beer from the land of the rising sun.  It is highly drinkable and sepecially goes well with sushi.  Gold color and light aroma with no real lingering taste.
Fairly standard pale lager.  Pale gold color with a small white fast disappearing head.  MIld corn aroma and taste.  Slight bitterness and dryness in finish.

Thin colour. Enormous head. Minimal fizz  (the head probably consumes most of the carbonation on pour). Metallic, but in a postive way, tastes coppery (blood?). Mild to non-existance smell. Slight wheat and hops trace.  Not much i can or want to say about it.  One of the better Japanese lagers but nothing to write home to DruncanVeasey about.
Standard fair for a lager, a little more malty than avereage.  Other than that nothing special
Pours a light gold with a quickly disppearing thin white head. Has a very slight hoppy aroma. The taste is a bit sweet with plenty of carbonation. Light body, dry finish. Good with sushi!

Bottle 0.33 l. Bought Kvickly Hilleroed. Aroma weak with notes of citrus and yeast. Clear light yellow colour with small white head. Watery taste. The barley malt is easily detected, but I cannot get a hold of the rice.

Appearance: Blond, very pale, almost no head.
Aroma: Not much, hint of fruit and malt.
Taste: Hopsy, bitter aftertaste.
Info: 330ml bottle, 17/9-2005, 17/300

At a local Japanese restaurant, I succumb to "wanting" a beer. My wife orders one. Why not? I think. Why not indeed. Pale Bud taste. No different than a Bud basically. I haven’t tasted that awful, bland beer taste in so long. Why, I scream. Why!!!!!
Lesson learned.

bottle, 33CL...
Nothing special, good pilsner. Fun to drink, it is easy to drink. A good Japanese beer.
Golden color, fresh taste no afterdrink.

Nothing special, but its like the cliche Japanese beer (along with Sapporo).  You can imagine a bunch of Japanese salary men laughing and eating at a sushi bar or izakaya and pouring each other mugs of kirin.  Fun to drink when you’re in that Japanese mood.
bottled, clean pale golden pour with almost nonexistant white head, aroma of mild malt, flavor of mild malt/hop combo, fairly light palate, nothing exciting but went well with sushi
Pale golden colour, white head. Aroma has bread and corn. Flavour is sweet and grassy. Average.

355ml bottle from the black heart of the big bad Brewer’s Retail a.k.a. The Beer Store. Pours the typical pale lager colour with a large but quickly diminishing head. Aroma is mostly corn and vegetables. Flavour is definitely better, with some hop bite in the finish and a touch of pepper? Very dry finish. Bland and watery palate, with some weird element to it that I can’t quite put my finger on, sort of boozyish. Maybe there’s some Steelback still lingering on my palate! Not too bad actually, drinkable, and there are much worse pale lagers out there. Cool design on the label too.

Gold with decent, creamy white head / Simple toasted grain nose / Medium body, with a surprisingly fine, creamy body and fair finish / Clean, simple flavors of toasted grain with honey undertones / As far as pale lagers go, this is a good one.
Bottle. Pours a clear amber/straw. Aroma is cereal and malt. Flavor is more of the same. Thin body. Better than the Light version, obviously,
...bottle.  Rice, water, and that’s it.  Cleanses the palate, but otherwise no use for this.
pretty much the same as an american lager with less rice and other adjuncts so no funky aftertaste.  No real pleasant after taste either though...
An extremely refreshing beer. If you’re really thirsty, these get the job done.

Had straight from the bottle at Memorial Day Cookout. Shared while brother in law lectured me. So it gets bonus points for distracting me from his lecture! Cant really comment on smell or appearance, but the flavor was more than decent for a hot day on the deck. Went well with the burgers and brats. Sweet, grassy, taste with a hint of fruit. Very drinkable.

Pours a pale tan with a 1/2-inch head. This is the best of the Japweisers I’ve had, which isn’t saying much. A decent lager if you like them. I personally will not be having it again because this beer is utterly boring and there are enough like it here in The United States.

suave y rica pero sin mucho pegue una alternativa cuando se como comida picante como les gustan a los asiaticos que tambien tienen su poco de salsa soya
boyeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

Have drink this on draught, & am considering stocking it myself. Was blown away by how smooth, crisp, & refreshing this was for a premium lager. Perfect for sitting outside on a hot summer day. Incredibly easy-drinking, quite sweet for a lager, not a trace of bitterness. Good head retention on draught, looked like a whirlwind was in the glass. Have also drunk this in bottle, slightly sweeter taste, probably due to not being as chilled as the draught product. Both draught & bottle versions are 5% a.b.v. however, maybe a difference due to being brewed here in the UK under licence by Wells-Young?

Nice gold pour,good carbonation,head not big,some mild lace covering.Aroma,malt grain,a sweetness.Flavour is sweet,grainy,rice,corn,malt,hops,refreshing beer.Slight green hops taste,it,s not tops but an okay drink for outings and cooling off.Finish sweet and grassy,okay.

Golden pour with a frothy white head.  Mostly sweet malt in the nose with some apples and pears.  Body followed as fairly sweet with ridiculous carbonation.  Did well with salty food.  A stretch to call it a Pilsener.  Also, cannibus.
Botella 330 ML. version elaborada en el reino unido. cerveza bastante normalita.

12 oz. bottle at Shima Sushi in Webster, NY.  Kirin Ichiban is a clear and sparkling pale yellow lager with a small white head that quickly fades.  The aroma is soft and fruity with some light grain.  It is light bodied and watery in the mouth.  The flavor is pretty corny, fairly bitter and not-so-fresh.  Good for washing down Unagi Nigiri, I suppose.

65cl bottle made by AB in LA; should have read the fine print when I picked it up! Nose of sweet grain and bananas; clear gold with a medium white head; taste of graininess, and fruity banana notes with a faint background bitterness that becomes slightly stronger as the banana fades. At least it don’t taste like Bud!
Draught: Poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was sweet and grassy. Taste was grassy but nice sweet corn slips in at finish.
12 ounce bottle at Kiko Japanese Restaurant Plantation, FL. Available at Total Wine for $1.29
Large bottle.  Clear pale yellow pour white thin head.  Clear clean lager, nothing odd or off but rather refreshing yet plane.  A little pale with some malt and tinge of hops.  Cool and crisp.
Clear golden with large white head. Sweet malty aroma with fruity notes. Somewhat malty flavor with notes of hops and caramel. Ends bitter.
Pale yellow with thin white head.  Aroma of sweet malts, a touch sour.  Taste is of sweet malts with a sour astringent finish that’s a little tart.
This is one of 2 beers that I drink with sushi.  It isn’t really a great beer, but somehow it goes well with sashimi and soy sauce.  Typical asian style beer now brewed by my least favorite brewer.
Bottle. Pours fizzy yellow with a white head. Light malty aroma with a grassy note and faint hops. Light body with light malt, grain, and again, just a touch of hops. Not bad.
Bottle. Clear yellow color with a white head. Light aroma and taste of grain, malt, sweetness and maybe some hop bitterness.
Bottle, with sushi.  Made by A-B and you can tell.  Color is not bad, but that’s about it.

Beautiful golden colour, extremely mild aroma, light beer, slight banana yeastyness, stronger flavour than most japanese beer i have tried, but still quiet mild, easy drinking, not great but not all bad

bottle: tasted exactly like my wife’s asahi beer, probably because both were served at about -666 degress below 0. It’s ok I guess, grainy taste, no smell, not much more to say. Probably rating this too high.

This beer was awful. Although I at first percieved it to be an import, the A-B at the back later revealed otherwise. Pours a pee-pee yellow colour with with a tiny white head that had an aroma of hops but a taste that was incredbly grainy. Almost salty at first it tapers off into a corn like flavor.
Had from the bottle. Bland and watery. Not impressed. There was was was little to no aroma
Had many times at sushi restaurants. Good with sushi. Disapointing to hear that AB brews it.
Bottled. Boring dead lager; I find it difficult to differentiate between these. Shame there was nothing better at the Japanese restaurant where I drank this.

Sampled from the bottle, but trust me their artwork on that was quite impressive as well. As far as the beer goes.... golden colored, seemed to pour a pretty decent head but halfway through the beer it was pretty much gone. There isn’t much aroma. You can smell all you want, you just won’t find much. This is what it is, a notch above the American swill we have here. Very light bodied and smooth. Slightly sweet and somewhat grassy.

(cleaning out my beer bottle collection as pictured in my profile and utilizing ratebeer.com)
As I recall, it is skunky and watery.
Pours dark yellow with quickly falling white head.  Smells of grain.  Taste is overly bitter.  Very little carbonation.  Not very good at all.
Decent lager. Very little after taste so it’s pretty good for drinking with a mild Japanese meal like sushi.
very average lager.  nothing fancy, just a nice beer to put next to a plate of sushi.
Clear light golden color with a large white head.  Grain and malt aromas.  Light body and medium carbonation.  Grassy and malty flavors.  Finishes with that cereal mash, at least its refreshing.
Gold. Corn, grains, and slightly sweet. Refreshing needs some hop bite to it.

Poured from a bottle at Japanes Sushi resturant.About as heavy an adjunct aroma as I’ve ever experienced,probaly more rice then corn,grain and hints of bitterness. The heavy adjunct taste may be to big for a summer sipper, but it did seem to cleanse my palate, the sushi was some of the best I ever tasted,so I give the beer I was sipping some of the credit. I don’t know if its ichiban, but I’ll order it again when I go back
Light golden color.  Smell of pale malt, hops and some grainy/corn.  Taste of hops, malt, and toasted grain.  Crisp and refreshing.

I do not know how great a review of "not offensive" or "easy drinking fizz" would sound, but regardless of my English professor’s criticisms, it is good ol’ fashion beer’s beer.  Much more flavor than traditional American macros. It has a class unbitter, outerworldly smoothness....good for not thinking about what you are drinking.
Pours a clear golden. Very limited smell. Not much taste at all.This beer isn’t anything special. Anyone who lets Anheuser-Bucsh brew their beer is retarded and I wouldn’t buy this one again

Yes, it’s golden clear with a very clean white head and it’s a lager.  It goes great with Asian food--I  wouldn’t laze on a summer afternoon guzzling them.  No strong taste of its own makes it a good choice for certain cuisine.

Pale clear golden pours with 1 inch quickly diminishing head. Faint hop and sweet malt aroma. Flavor is bitter and bland, a little sweet and moderately carbonated. Taste like decent, but mediocre cereal grains were used when brewing this brew. It has a little bite and a sharp finish.
Another disappointing pale lager.  Sweet and malty, but unfortunately skunk at the end.

Drank this often in Hawaii.  Its your typical lager style beer.  Very crisp and clean flavoured, aroma of hops, malts and wet forrest.  Color is light golden.  When poured it forms a large white foamy head.  Clean, easy beer.

I always did say it reminded me of Budweiser, perhaps a bit sweeter.
pretty good beer nice flavor, goes down smooth. a bit heavier than your typical American  beer. not my favorite but im sure ill have another someday
Uma cerveja que agradou. Espuma branca de boa formação. Dourada. Cheiro de cereais, suavemente frutado. Sabor também suavemente frutado, levemente amarga. Densa. Bem maltada.

Bottle @ Lee’s, Toronto, ON: Comes recommended by the waiter who said it’s all he’s drank for five years.  Hopefully he meant beer because drinking nothing but one beer for five years can probably cause issues.  Pours pale, golden, no head.  Aroma is mostly absentee but if you really suck it in you might find the finest barley malt and premium hops.. AHAHA.. I mean corn.  Flavour is sweet, surprisingly so, and slightly nutty.  Not offensive, but I’m pretty sure I’ll be drinking other things for the next five years.

Aroma is typical of the pale lager, not much character, no real hop or malt signature.  Mostly the adjuncts of the brew, like corn.  The appearance is also the same yellow color.  The flavor is also typical to the pale lager, maybe a little better.  The palate is also typical to the style.  On the whole, this is like a slightly improved version of Budweiser.  I would drink it if I was in a place where it was the only beer being served.
1 pint 8 fl. oz. can.  A decent lager....good, but not great.  Reminds me of a typical American "macro-brew" with a heavier body.
Not bad, just not much aroma or body. But above standard lager. (Bottle 33cl 5,0 alcohol % in my version)

12oz bottle: This thing pours so crystal clear it is almost scary.  Static, bright white head.  Wet earth, creamed corn, and grass clippings that have been in a closed metal trash can for seven days in southern Indiana summer heat make up the rancid nose.  A touch of butter and honey come forth as it warms.  Spritzy carbonation.  More corn in the body mixes roughly with earthy yeast and grassy hops.  Average at best.
This clear yellow brew poured a medium head that also had a yellow hew to it.  The aroma was average as was the flavor.   Had a slight sweet finish.
Bottle-Memphis. Very disappointing.  Was looking forward to a crisp, refreshing lager and wound up with a stale beer - I guess this is the AB trademark.
Bottle, Clear yellow coloured beer with average carbonation and an average white head. Sweet malty aroma. Medium palate. Finish is little bittersweet hoppy. Ok
What can I say.  A pale lager.  It won’t kill you but there is not much there.

A lager, so nothing to exciting.  Aroma is not present.  Apperance is yellowish, slight head.  Flavor is a little malty, nice.  No bitterness to speak of.  Overall it’s a lager, it’s an average to above average one at that.

12 oz. bottle poured into my trusty stein- poured transparent golden yellow, white head formed but collapsed, aroma of yeast and light malt, light carbonation.  Hits the mouth with a thin body, kinda a sweet corn ring to it, hops and malt are very weak, finish goes away rapidly.  Very uninspiring.

22oz bottle at kyoto in Santa Barbara.   Gold with a big but unstable head.   Biscuit  malt aroma.   The flavor is surprisingly malty and clean with almost no bitterness.  Light and fizzy body.   Not a bad beer for some sushi, and definitely nicer one than the asahi, but still boring and bland on its own.   Much nicer than Budweiser, FWIW.
Draft poured in a flute.  Light golden in color, quickly fading head.  Very light corn and yeast aroma.  No rice filler detected.  Slighly hoppy, fairly clean.  Smooth drinking.
...interesting! not normally a fan of asian beers, but this is probably one of the best. very smooth, no aftertaste.

Thought I would try a Japanese beer, then found out it is actually brewed by A-B. I don’t think this one is made with rice though. Nose is really strong of yeast and biscuit. Tasted a little to sweet, kind of like corn syrup, Too yeasty too. Not a good beer. Wasted money with this one
A cut above most A-B products, less corny-sweet, a little more hoppy and slightly bitter. Nice dry finish. Decent macro. (Brewed in L.A. by A-B)
(Japan) Golden Yellow color with Med-White Head. Has a mild Citrus aroma, Taste is smooth and clean!!!  Not Bad.

33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow with a huge, dense and white head. Light citrus fruity hops/grassy nose. One dimensional flavour of grass, mild malt note and a mild bitterness into the finish.

12oz bottle at Mr. Fuji’s Japanese Restaurant (Hibachi and Sushi). Pours a light, clear gold (almost straw) with a thick, large-bubbled, white head that fades quickly. The aroma is mostly of bready, pilsner malt. The flavor follows the nose: light, bready malts. There is a subtle touch of balancing bitterness in the finish - just enough to make it slightly dry - but this is very far from a hoppy beer. It is refreshing, however. The mouthfeel is medium-full in body and well-carbonated. Overall, not bad for a mass-produced, pale lager. It tastes like it’s made from all-malt (just not a lot of it). But, like other pale lagers, it is a bit watery, especially in the finish and back for the palate.
Bottle 330ml. Pours a clear golden head with medium size head. Fruity hops in the nose. Traces of malt and hops in the flavour - but really neutral clear feeling. Hops in the aftertaste.

A very light beer..... but again it is very good.....
.
a agree with mgoy...

Light golden in color with a mediocre head that disappears rather quickly.  Aroma is lightly hoppy but vague and leaves you guessing.  Typical macro lager like which is not a good thing.  Very weak in taste.

Like other Japanese pale lagers, Kirin Ichiban is a fun beer to order at a sushi bar. Unlike the others, Kirin is actually a decent beer. With some aroma, a nice clear color, and a little bit of flavor, Kirin is a managable beer.
Not a real good beer. Just a standard cheap tasting beer like a Bud or Heineken.

22 OZ BOTTLE via safeway. Pours a clear gold with an average whitE head. NOSE IS LAGER YEAST, BARLEY AND a little hoppiness. Tastes like it smells and is syrupy sweet...yet watery in the finish. A step above Bud, but only barely.
Pale lager #200... yeah!  Pale straw-colour with a fast fading white head.  Aroma of thin pale malt.  Ricey cleanness.  Very little in the way of hop aroma of flavour.  Tastes wet.  Mmmm.

Draft. Or if I were English or Canadian it came Draught. Whatever. Anyway, it came a deep golden color with a suprisingly thick billowing white head that lasted throughout. Aroma is very light and almost fruity with little to no hop prescence at all. Taste is very smooth and slightly sweet and doughy of malts. Again, just like in the nose, little to no hops at all. Finishes very dry and clean. I can see why the Japanese really like this beer. It’s a mindless and easy drinking beer, it has almost a creamy effect and sits thicker in the mouth than you would expect for such a light pale ale. I will give the mouthfeel a decent rating.
16 0z bottle, straw colored lager with small head a little hops but not buch else, usually have with sushi and it does go with the typical mild flavors of fish
This beer was alright.  It had a pale yellow body and was very light.  Theres usually not much to say about a pale lager.
12 oz. bottle. Pours clear, light golden with small white head. Taste resembles a budweiser but with a bit more body. Not a great aroma or aftertaste.
Bottle. Golden yellow with minimal head. Slightly sour barley malt flavor - light hops with a VERY dry finish.  The only time I drink it is with sushi, but it does go great with it.
nice looking lager beer, crisp, clean taste with a bit more body and hoppier than Bud, not much hop flavor though which detracts from the overall drinkability of this beer

12oz Can - The Liquor Collection - Honolulu, Hawaii 

2008 – Great Hawaii Beer Run

Aroma – Light lager aroma with some off bitterness.  Just a can that traveled a long way. Deep 

Appearance – Light golden color, nice head and clear.   

Flavor – A light pale flavor.  Very little to no hops tasted.  
 
Palate – Had nice Mouthfeel, easy to drink and a good beer for a super hot day. 

Overall – A decent beer could have been much worse but it was a good Pale lager.

12oz bottle.  Pours an effervescent clear pale amber with a solid but fleeting head.  Aroma is sweet and earthy, with aromas of hops, yeast, straw, and a twinge of malt.  Taste is light and crisp, with a slight hoppy-yeasty flavor quickly overpowered by a sour and unpleasant rubbery aftertaste somewhat muted by further drinking.  Probably a tolerable companion to spicy food, but there are much better lagers to be had for session drinking.
A fairly nonedememo  beer. Not much going on neither in the taste nor the aroma appartment. But still aquite drinkable, clean tasting beer with no off-flavours.

Suprisingly young, bottled on January 4th, 2008 in Los Angeles. Aroma is moderate malts, light grassy hops along with wet cardboard and urine. Pours with a forced carbonation large soapy white head. Supprisingly it has fair lacing. Flavor is pretty bitter. Goes down dry. I still believe this is the best of the main stream Jappanese beers.

On tap at Koi sushi Boise, ID. Pours out a clear gold topped with a foam white head. An aroma to match bud. This must be the Japan version of bud. and to think the bartender was giving this beer love. O ya this is the most popular Japan beer. Ok I see.

This beer is thin in all departments. Clear amber color with a little head when poured. Flavor was almost nonexistent. This basically tastes like any other American macrobrewed lager - oh, wait, that’s because it’s owned by Anheuser-Busch.
Nothing special to it, light and mildly refreshing. A little bit of a funky taste but nothing to bad. Badass logo is probably the best part of the beer.
