friday, may 06, 2005: Original rating A:2 A:1 F:1 P:1 O:2 = 0.7
Looks like piss in a glass with some floating pieces of dust.  No head and the aroma is that nasty pale lager smell. Dissgusting to drink and just a horrible beer to have a mouthfull of it.

What the heck is this, Japanese Budweiser?  It’s not as thick tasting as Budweiser, but it clones it in every other respect: rice in the nose and in the flavor, weak hops, paltry malt, and some weird straw aftertaste happening.  Only rated better than Bud ’cause it’s not Bud, and it goes good with sake.  Sake bomb!   HAPPY BIRTHDAY, ACE FREHLEY!
Ligth golden with disapearing white head. Bitter sweet aroma with a hint of alcohol. Refresing taste with growing bitter sweet aftertaste.
Bottled. Pours a light golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet malty. Taste is malty, and ever so slightly hoppy. Medium bitter sweet aftertaste

A very light and an obvious cheap beer... despite all this Kirin Ichiban is an enjoyable ale. Its so smooth and to top it all off... there is an obvious vanilla hint in this asian delight. I definatly can’t complain!
Bottle.  Brewed by Charles Wells in the UK.  Golden with a white head.  Aromas are grain and sweetcorn can juice.  Flavours are sweet grain, corn and some hops.  Its very mediocre but inoffensive.

Contract brewed in LA by Anhueser-Busch? That seriously detracted from the beer before I even tasted it. Born on dating? Please. It poured light and clear with a thin white head. very little aroma, but with slight notes of grass and grain. Thin and watery mouthfeel. Very bland and watered down. Not a lot of flavor. It’s neither good nor bad. It’s drinkable. It’ll wash sushi down, but so will water.
This is your standard pale lager. Doesn’t do much to stand out. Just fits in with all the others. In other words... there’s nothing to describe here.
Not bad for a light pilsner--that is, when combined with pickled ginger and wasabi.  In other words, my beer of choice with sushi.

clear dark yellow gold like urine after a steady diet of highly processed food.  white thick foamy head that lasts. sweet aroma, like refined sugar.  flavor starts chickenfeed sweet, then slight hop finish.  easy to ignore while hanging out with a large group.

Light beer japanese style.  Decent aroma, not much body and o.k. flavor light and ricey though.  This is the best of the 3 that I tried tonight at the Japanese restaurant and you have to love the bottle size!!
had this at a japanese restaurant,  is this the bud of Japan?  Not too bad, could see drinking a few of these in a session
Bottle. Pale clear yellow with a ring of white lace. Old Milwaukee with a little more finishing hops. Whoopee.

An extremely crisp and airy lager that tended towards perfuminess and occasional bursts of interest, but mostly bland...and not really that great a compliment to sushi...especially after a real nice wasabi blast. I guess this ends a meal allright, but not my first choice.

American style macro lager.  Pours from the bottle with a bit of a head, but it doesn’t last.   Any aroma dissapears well before the head.  I just can’t find anything to like or dislike.  It’s pretty good, but that’s not saying much.

great looking design on the bottle and actually was a really great asian beer. i enjoyed this one very much. easy to  drink tasted kinda like a budweiser but not with the nasty aftertaste. very nice different beer
Of course I order this with Sushi and thats about it. The beer is malty and I would say skunky too, but for some reason it has a good alcoholic kick compared to other japanese beers.
The impressive label does not do this beer justice.  It is a plain import sold to people who like strange names on their beer.  Pale, little taste.  On the positive side, it is very easy to drink.
Yellow with a moderate white head. Hops and some very minor floral elements in the flavor.
Bottle. Pale yellow with a white head. Big bubbles. Harsh aroma and taste. Not much else going on. Crisp. I’ll pass on another.

Bottle. Pale clear glimmiering gold color. Pungent skunky aroma, assorted grains. Sweet grainy cheap lager taste, with a handful of corn kernals. Low on the offensive scale, also low on the flavor scale.
Bottle.  Yikes....did somone put Sapporo in my glass?  See my review on Sapporo Premium Draft.....no difference...well, this might be worse.
Weak, bland, & completely awful but hey it’s Japanese beer brewed in California by Bud. What do you expect?

Tops Store Phuket Town (72 baht): Clean pale gold. Commercial larger nose, nothing special. Slightly stale mouthfeel, very clean, refreshing, high filtered style. Holiday drinking standard but nothing more (albeit super quaffable).

Wow, look at that can!  Not only is this can bigger than any can of beer I have purchased, it has the best artwork.  Be that as it may, from other raters, this beer may fall far short of the can design suggests.  Pours clear, with giant quickly dissapating head.  Nice clean fresh aroma, nothing skunky yet.  The taste is highly metallic, I should have guessed.  Still, refreshing it is, and I think it is better a little warmer than normal.  Still not everything can be roses and peachtrees.  Tastes like the normal swill served up by macro brewers.
Ligth golden color big white head. Flat taste no bobble´s and no finish... very boring beer!
Clear golden colour with small white head. Malty soapy aroma with some sweetness. Flavor is sweet in an artificial way. Thin palate.

Didn’t know what to make of this one, talk about parched..... I need a glass of water!! Poured a brilliant gold, with effervescent bubbles holding up a decent white head, with good lacing. Aroma was subtle, rice wine, apples and bitter hops. In the mouth, it tasted like I imagine a rusting car body would taste, only dry, crisp and weirdly refreshing. Subdued, but unusual. Not for my liking, but has it’s place.
Japanese Beer is sexy.  And this is the best Japanese beer I’ve tried yet.  It’s got a more complex flavor than Sapporo for the same amount of money.

Pours clear and golden with no head. Aroma is light malt. Flavor is malty with slight hops flavor. Drinks like most American cheap beer, until I drop a shot of saki into it and get hammered. For 3 bucks during happy hour we have a damn good time with these 22oz bottles and sides of saki. Long live saki bombers and good asian food!

Not a bad color to this golden pale lage, especially when it sits side by side with a macro.  Still, it jsut looks watery, with no head and a crystal clear body.  Aromas are grass and barley.  Flavors are somewhat the same, with lots of grains and no hops or malt to speak of.  Body is smooth, but unremarkable.
Pours a pale gold color with a small head.  Starts bland and finishes bland with only the slightest of taste.  Not only is there no aftertaste, there is no taste to speak of.  A very mediocre beer.

According to the bottle, "Kirin is the name of an ancient mythical beast, which foretells the coming of festive and joyful events. When the Kirin appears, good fortune and good beer soon follow." I guess I had the good fortune to buy just one bottle of this. I’m still waiting for the good beer to follow. Poured a pale gold colour with a rocky 1.5cm white head. Lively carbonation - big champagne-like bubbles. Light citrusy hop aroma. Maybe some melon characters. Nothing especially inviting. Thin body with some hoppy dryness in the finish but precious little else going on. A little barley malt in the middle perhaps. Rather astringent finish. Fine with food, otherwise keep searching. 
Marketed as Kirin’s "Premium Reserve Beer".  (Bottle, Best Before June 1 2005)

It’s yellow, with a head like the one in your toilet bowel after pissing into it from standing on top of a ladder. (Big bubbles dissipating fast.) Smells like the inside of your kitchen garbage can, and beer.
Taste is bad, little hoppy and with astringency comparable to hairspray. Shameful.
If buy this, youv’e made a bad choice. If you drink it, you’’ll be sorry.

Standing on it’s own, not a very remarkable brew.  Moderately malty flavor with a nice  bit of a bite of hops.  Kind of a metallic aftertaste.  But goes really well with sushi and sashimi of all kinds.

RE-RATE - poured from bottle 5/2008.  Astringent aroma with malt.  Dark for a pale lager, head disappears.  Some malt, hardly any hops in flavor.  slightly metallic aftertaste.  Bubbly feel.    Finish disappoints.  There are better choices in this category.
Flat and grainy.  Hard to get interested in this.  Dull as dishwater except for the cool dragon on the label.
Yellowish color with almost no head.  Very mild flavor and almost no trace of hop taste.

Cheap yellow gold pour with a flimsy white head.  Unimpressive and unnatractive typical pilsner aroma.  Rice and grassy hops in flavor.  Sushi would be the best part of this meal...not so much the beer.

A little weak and the flavor and only slightly better than average. I am not sure if rice is in the mix but I swear I taste it in there somewhere. Very malty and dry. A compliment to Asian food but not something I want to drink often. A not very memorable beer.
Bottle. Pours a pale, clear yellow body with a small bone white head. Very weak grassy, malty aroma. Flavor is malty, grassy, bland. Not a very good beer. Harsh aftertaste. Eeeehhhh.
This was a rather impressive brew--not really surprised though.  It was rather plain--you can taste some hops and a bit of malt.  Goes well with food.  Singha is better, though.

Yumi, Excelsior, MN 11/19/2004 in 12 oz bottle.  This is a rather middle of the road lager that perhaps stands out more than others as being good with sushi.  Bottle pours a rather pale yellow with very little head and no lace.  The aroma is mild and Pale Lager like.  The flavor is somewhere in there, just can not seem to find it very well.  The palate is thin and fizzy.  Overall, very low end.

It’s hard for me to judge this one.  Solely as a beer on its own, it’s not very good.  But I love it with sushi, I think it balances the flavors extremely well.  And I have to give it props on the appearance.  The head is pretty thin, but what little there is actually leaves a moderate lacing.   Not too much hops, and kind of thin in general, but something about this and sushi gets me going.  THis rating is probably higher than what the average drinker will think of it, and if I never tasted it with sushi, it’d be getting a much lower score from me.
Pours light gold with not much head. Weak stale aroma. Malt taste. No hops. Watery. I thought this stuff was going to be bad, but it was awful. Nothing to it.

"Brewed under the strict supervision of Kirin’s brewmaster by Anheuser-Busch, Inc., Los Angeles, CA" 24 0z. can, with the mythological Japanese deer/dragon beast striding diagonally up the aluminum container. 
Color, a transparent bright yellow, with a prodigous, fluffy, bone white head, that hastily, noisily crumbles.(Perhaps the head size was helped by the enormous Weihenstephaner glass I poured it into?)
Aroma: rather dull and dry, and perfectly in step with a typical cheap lager smell, and am I smelling the rice? Is there rice? Taste will tell...
Very smooth on the palate, to a fault, to the point that it’s existence barely registers or makes any impact upon the senses at all. Body is so light light that it rings hollow at every turn. There’s is a decent texture, I admit, a nice grit and play on the tongue and lips, that makes it a far more bearable beer than many ordinary lagers, but...I can’t at all detect the "complex character of one of the world’s premium beers." You’ve got to have a narrow definition of "beer", and "premium"...and "world"...
Drinkability? Yeah, you can drink them, if you’ve got nothing better to do, nothing better to drink, and a mean streak of masochism...

Light golden lager color with white head.  Very light hops in the aroma, mostly a typical pale lager scent.  Flavor is fresh, lightly sweet, and clean, though weak.  Good crisp, clean, sparkling mouthfeel. Not bad, especially for a beer contract-brewed by Anheuser-Busch.  A good complement to spicy Chinese dishes.

Pours a golden body with a sudsy white head that quickly disappears.  Mild, mild malt & grass aroma.  Smooth, watery.  It’s got a sweet sticky kind of flavor, mild malt with the faintest hint of hops.  Clean finish.
Golden color, light weak aroma and taste, light watery body, light bitter finish.
(Draft) Super light color with almost no head at all. No real aroma to speak of. A slightly heinikenish flavor with a bit of skunkyness and a blittle sweetness.

Another one straight from the bottle, oh how I hate not having even a pint glass with me sometimes.  From what I could tell however, this beer would have been pretty pale, like a bud light or any other over distributed american light beer.  On the whole I was not impressed by this beer, just as with the way I thought it looked, the flavor was truly unoriginal, completely reminding me of those water american lights.

Straw colored and clear with a column of co2 rising from the bottom of the glass. Head is full and white, but dies relatively quickly. Smells a little skunky, fruity and sweet with a hoppy background. Flavor is much blander than expected. A light sweet start with a kind of Styrofoam middle and an effervescent/dry finish. Mouthfeel is quite lively, but does not make up for the almost empty taste. Quite void of character. Not bad, just bland.

Pale gold body topped with a very thin and quick-fading bubbly head. Light malty aroma with some bready and herbal notes. Even served from a bottle, its refreshing malty taste carries some metallic hints. Finish is short and discreet. Although this is better than Sapporo, it remains a very boring beer, and a pure loss of money.
Just not much to it. I’ve tried it several times at resturaunts and the results are always the same. Flat and weak. Don’t bother.

From a bottle at a sit-down chinese/japanese restaurant.  They brought it to me on a tray with a stem glass, then proceeded to pour it for me.  Wow, what a presentation.  Too bad I can’t say wow, what a beer.  Yellow in color, normal pale lager aroma.  Taste is somewhat sweet, with not much aftertaste, with a thin carbonated body.  Better than Sapporo I think, and better than a lot of American Pale Lagers I’ve tried.  It went with the food pretty well, but not something I would go out of my to drink on its own.
Fairly standard brew. Pours yellowy. Small head. Kind of sweet. Not much here.

Label sez " brewed under the strict supervision of Kirin's brewmaster by Anscheisse-Busch". This is the ultimate oxymoron!  Poured a light macro-yellow, head was gone in 57 seconds. Large bubbles that quickly disapated. Ichiban? Special Premium Reserve? This is hype!
At least there was a 1-800 # and legible  freshness date. I agree it would be good with seafood.
Another standard japanese lager. It doesn’t really leave much room for comment.  Certainly nothing special for a lager which means it isn’t much of a beer either.
Standard bland mass produced lager but excellent with sushi, and light and refreshing ice cold.

from the bottle, insane party ambience: clean and crisp bite that leads a stale grassy, skunky, and earthy aftertaste. ain’t much, y0. and it needs to be lighter so it will be in the aura of quaffiness.

a bubbly blonde that gives decent head... and who could have a problem with that?... crisp and refreshing... i think the other ratings on here are a little harsh, i felt this was a good, light, companion with my sushi lunch.

Golden in color with lots of carbonation. Decent bright white faomy head. Light beer taste that’s better than your typical mass produced lager. Goes down smooth with no nasty aftertaste and hits the spot when you out for sushi or some other Japanese cuisine. Decent Beer.
Pours a medium yellow in color, with a small white head. Taste fairly rich. A bit of grain a little maltiness. Overall not a bad pale lager, but still nothing to get excited about.
a golden colour, little head flavours and bitterness very well balanced. clean tasting lager.

Pours with a two-finger white head that leaves some lace.  Clear pale amber color.  Very light bodied and light carbonation.  Slightly hoppy nose.  Starts sweet with some hoppy overtones, finish is bland and watery.   Works as a lawn mower beer and not much more.  $1.60 for 12 oz bottle from Colonial Spirits, Acton, Ma.
A rather bland beer, that does not inspre any real emotion either way.  Works for washing down my dinner since it’s the only beer I have.
fairly bland but with just enough malt to put it ahead of the other Japanese lagers I’ve tried.  Good with sushi.
definately the winner in the Japanese lager contest...smells malty and earthy...tastes earthy and skunky...malty finish...

Light, straw appearance with virtually no head.  Aroma was lacking, except for a whiff of something like corn flakes.  Light-bodied with lots of carbonation, but little in the way of flavor.  Lesson learned.

Pours a deep gold with a very small head. Full bodied, decent lager. Seems to be higher than 4.9% alcohol, had a slight bite to it. Malty taste. Some bitterness in the finish. Not nearly as bad as the 11% percentile rating indicates.

Tap.  Initially some depth to the head that disapated quickly.  Carbonation is there and noticeable though nowhere near macros.  Pale light yellow, smooth to the taste, thin in the mouth and overall a more than average pale lager with nothing outstanding.

taste like corn.  smells and looks like budweiser.  i basically got this to get a new country rating, because i was pretty sure i wasnt going to think it was great off the start.  it has some good qualities, and im sure it would go very well with sushi.  pretty good for what it is.
A distictive lager with an odd aroma, falvor.  Hard to explain, but tastes like olives.  Pours as expected in color and gravity but no head.  Good mouthfeel.
Simply a decent beer to wash down good sashimi. Nondememo  and fizzy, but certainly not offensive.

Soft grassy aroma, not disgustingly strong like most cheap beers. Yellow in appearance, with a small head. Some bubbles rising to the surface. Flavor is small, grassy, and sweetish. Not bad, actually. But nothing I’d seek out again.
Okay, this one is okay if it is really cold and you drink it really fast, before the real flavors can sit in on your palate and you really figure out how bad it tastes.
another skunky import.  not reccommended.  buy budweiser that will at least be fresh and save your money
sunk/piss aroma,,bland but refreshing. metalic finish. better than bud but thats about it
Had with Sapporo...about the same.  Yellowish in color...bland taste...not one I need to try again.

aroma was surprisingly like a sparkling white wine with almost cidery fruitiness, fresh floral hoppiness.
light golden lager, small head, high carb.
clean hoppy flavours.
crisp, claen, lightly lingering hop bitterness.
dissappointing flavour after the promising aroma, boring lager with exciting aroma.

Sampled from bottle at Danish Beer Festival 2004 (#51).
Light yellow beer with an ok head. Sweet malty aroma. Bitter hoppy and malty flavor. Quite heavy for a lager but somewhat harsh.

This is not good. It’s a dull pale gold with a wisp of head. It’s got the bottling date on the bottle (brewed by Anheuser Busch for Kirin) and it’s fresh, but it’s still a little skunky. The flavor has a little straw malt, but also has something that’s making me think of bile.
Pours a clear, bright gold with a skunky aroma. Reminds me of the Heineken smell. No head and minimal lacing. Flavor is heavy on the corn syrup with a tinny aftertaste. Drink this one COLD!

clear, light golden, white head. aroma is slightly of malt and perspiration. flavor tastes typical of for the style, little wet papery, and adjunct...although i don’t know whether or not this beer uses adjuncts. still far and away better than the budweisers of the world.
Bright gold. Medium carbonation. White head. Moderately malty, lightly grassy aroma. Soft, mildly grainy feel. Sweet, somewhat biscuity malt flavour w/ a light, grassy bitterness in the finish.
Gold color with a small white head.  Mild adjunct laden beer aroma and taste.  Rinsed down some kobe steak tonight at hibachi.
This one was pleasant when paired with other lagers, but I’m not a lager fan. At any rate, easy to drink, reasonably balanced with minimal hops/malt. ok beer.

The smell put me off this beer before I tasted it.  Yet the fine yellowy gold appearance enticed me enough to go ahead and taste it.  The most distinctive quality of this beer, to me, is the gentleness in the mouth.

FInally a "Premium Lager" that actually lives up to it's name. Pours a dark yellowish body with a thin white head. Lots of nice carbonation present. Aroms is of candy and apples. Taste is citrusy, sweet, and reminds me of a white wine. Finishes like a wine as well, except for the carbonation, which makes this nice and crisp. Well done! A great lager.
Pale color, a bit darker than a pils.  Dry taste with hops aroma striving valiantly to rise above adjuncts.
Had this with Japanese food.  Poured pale yellow.  Aroma of adjuncts and some hops.  Not very good.  Finishes slightly sour and metallic.  Pass on this.
Tastes like shit, looks like shit, smells like shit. Do you get where i am going from here? One of the worst beers i have ever had. I would rather drink a skunky 40oz then this stuff
Amber with a weak white head.  Downhill from there.  Nothing remarkable about the aroma or the body or the taste.  On a par with a Bud or Bud Lite.  Totally unimpressive.

Bottled: My favorite beer to accompany sushi. Clean, crisp, good carbonation. Flavor is not exceptional but a slight sweet malt presence is detectable. For the purpose I use it, Ichiban is solid, palate-cleansing beer.

(Draft) Pale golden body with a minimal white foamy head. Malty, metallic, adjunt-addled aroma. Flavor is not as bad as I was expecting, but it is not so great either. The hop bitterness is very subdued. Crisp light and fizzy body. Overall not too bad compared to others in this same vein.

Pours gold with a white head.  Aroma is malty, grassy and skunk.  Flavor, although minimal, is slightly sweet and grassy.  Hop bitterness is totaly lacking.  Body is watery and overcarbonated.  Nothing to offend, but nothing to please, either.

Bottle.  Dark golden and clear with a small white head that quickly fell to a flat smooth surface.  Aroma is a bit pungent, with prominent malts, touch of hops and a bit of skunk.  Flavor is bigger than most beers brewed by AB (this one under license of Kirin in LA), with a lot of hop bite along with some spiciness and soap.  Light body and assertive carbonation.

Deep gold colour (like a Bohemian pils).  No real head, though.  Slightly malt and oily, but only slightly so, like a very light Bohemian pils.  Moderate body.  Much softer than the regular Kirin Lager (which I just had).  Maltiness dominates, but is not particularly well-extracted.  Light grassy bitterness and continental hop undertones complement the malts.  Not bitter enough to be a proper pilsner, but it has many of the same components.  Decent.
Typical light lager. Light and thin with a little sweetness. While not unpleasant, it lacks any real character.

Mildly sweet rice aroma. Pale golden colour with thin white head that diminishes fully. Very clean palate with little in the way of flavour. I'll take my sushi with something that actually has flavour to complement thank you very much... Bottle.

Refreshing,dry, full-bodied lager, but the taste doesn't linger- good for those hoping for a pash.
Spanner.
Smooth and dry finish. no much taste or alcohol here but you must appreciate its purpose, its great with japanese food.

Draft - This is golden, and flat. Not much head and it reminds me of a Bud or something. I was not enticed by its appearance. The flavor is oddly complex though. Unlike American standards it has a full flavor for such a light beer. It has little aftertaste. Each sip has you looking for deeper flavors. Overall it was not bad at all. I would drink again.
Golden, with a decent head that goes away quickly. Flavor is a bit sweet, but fairly bland.  A little bit thin, with very little aftertaste.

gold appearance, big white head that dissipates quickly.  Adjunct sweetness in aroma that is not quite malt.  Flavor has the same character.  I'm guessing that there is rice in this beer, as it reminds me of Bud.  Almost no hop character at all, but then again that is what they claim, no bitter after taste.

Ok - so the main reason I reviewed this beer so highly is that it is the best beer at the HEB supermarket for under $6 per 6-pack.  This isn't a flashy beer, it is very functional.  It compliments a Hibachi steak very well.  It is one of the few beers my wife and I actually agree on.  Light enough for her, tasty enough for me, and less than a buck a bottle.  Not a world champ, but something I like to keep in the fridge.

bottled and on draft: always smells somewhat skunky, im not sure why? if its the rice adjuncts or what, but a slight bitter taste and not in a hoppy way. little or no hop character. slight sweet taste. not my favorite of the asian lager/pilsener styles....drink sapporo instead, it tastes a little better.

Only a very slight skunk odor when the bottle is opened.  I detect some hops in the aroma, but few in the actual taste.  The flavor is a slightly sweet malt/ wheat.  The color is a light gold.  no aftertaste.  Easy to drink
[bottle] Pale straw yellow with a thin head and very little carbonation. Faint hoppy aroma. Initial sweet hoppy taste followed by a slight malt wave. Very thin and watery with not much aftertaste.
Dry grainy hoppy aroma.Pale gold appearance with small quick head.Sweetish grainy grassy flavor with some bready malt.Dry grainy finish.

Light golden color with a dissipating white head forming a lasting lid. Aromas of light hay and hint of herbal hops. Initial sweet flavor, not necessarily malt, followed by a dry malt and hop tea. Linger has a somewhat pleasent malt linger. Clear and unassuming.  Really not much here.

The beer I tasted was brewed by Lion Nathan in Sydney, dunno if that makes it a different beer. Anyway it was darker than expected for a "Japanese" beer, clear as with good head retention.
Aroma lightly malty, not much going on but no real off flavours. Sweet candyish malt with absolutely no hop character. Very clean. Boring and sweet.
This is another Macro style lager (A-B has thier hand in it what else?) Nothing spectacular. Have it at the Japanese Steak House - you'll live through it.

A pretty standard beer not far off the mark from the Kirin Lager. Some sweet malt flavor but mainly another bland lager. Clean crisp dry finish. Nothing complex at all. Something you drink at the local Japanese steak house and little else!

Okay, I gotta check the reviews *before* I go beer shopping next time...

Sorry, I'm not even gonna justify this swill with a full-on review. I should have known by the "Brewed under the strict supervisvion of Kirin's brewmaster by Anheuser-Busch" claim on the lable.

Cool "half dragon/half deer" picture on the bottle. Other than that, there is nothing interesting about this beer. 

"Special single-press process uses only the most flavorful portion of the finest ingredients. Your reward is all the nuances of flavor and complexities of the character only a first press beer can offer" aside." WTF, is this an olive oil?!? What the hell are they pressing? If there's a "second press," are they admitting that Bud is their waste-product?

Not Bad...but then, unremarkable.

Virtually no head, aroma or flavour.

Then again, I'd have another...unless I were paying for it.

(4 Jan 04, 5% ABV) A medium yellow brew with an average white head and no lacing to speak of.  I noted a light malt and grass in the slightly sweet-smelling aroma.  This is an unremarkable but drinkable beer.
Nothing special. Fizzy yellow and clean,  well made but not distinctive. Goes OK with Sushi.
Clear gold with bubbly white topping and a soapy aroma.  Highly malt-sugary flavored and light on the tongue.  Standard.
very slight aroma of yeast; pale, washed-out yellow with a very thin head; bitter taste and astringent feel - not at all to my taste

On tap at Summits Wayside Tavern-  I ordered this for the free pint glass.  Pale yellow color with a small fizzy head.  No real aroma.  Slightly better than BMC but not by much.  Dry finish.  Nothing special.

Light aroma (difficult to distinguish due to being served with other food in a Japanese restaraunt), Yellow/gold appearance, light hoppy flavor, not strong, suitably dry, but not overly so. Went well with the food being served.
Pale yellow with a small, fizzy head that dissipates quickly.  A slight hint of fruit and hops in the aroma.  Starts out very slightly sweet then turns bitter.  Dry on the end.
Draft - Had at sushi dinner.  Very thin, with light malt flavor.  Do they use hops?  Only good with food.

Bottled stuff. Not bad really. Pretty smooth. Everything else is mellow, sutble or just plain thin. No nasty aftertaste and none of that dirty plastic that some of these have. That's probably the best thing about it, it's inoffensive. Shame it's not as cheap as sparkling water really.

Oct 2019. Bottle at a Japanese restaurant in Kuala Lumpur airport Malaysia with Zelie. Brewed in Malaysia by Heineken. Allowed to warm up this reveals itself as a half decent lager with some malt flavour. [2.8]


July 2018. 330ml brown bottle, filtered, from BeerWulf - part of a World Cup Beers package. 5%. Brewed by Weihenstephan in Germany. Nondescript but drinkable. Great name. [2.4]

March, 2012  Keg - Slug & Lettuce, Woodford Green. Dry. Faint hops. Wheat flavour. Some rust. Not interesting, but drinkable. [2.3 ]

Dec, 2003 Bottle. Mine is 5.5%, brewed under licence in the UK by Charles Wells. Its cold, wet and drinkable, but it has absolutely no character. Very subtle malt and delicate hops. As my grandmother would say: There’s nothing there to offend anyone. And I suppose that’s the point. I mean, it’s not bad beer - there is some taste there, and the taste is pleasant enough - but I’ve had mineral water with more flavour and character than this. [2.0]
Draft: their attempt at BMC.  No aroma or flavor to speak of.  Maybe a touch of malt and a touch of corn.  No bitterness at all.  Forgetable ... I hope.

Piss yellow, no head. When I first tried this stuff I thought I had a cold and couldn't taste. So I had my roommate try it and he thought it was tasteless as well.  Then my other roommate bought some to try and he told me it tasted horrible so I tasted a swig and holy crap, I must have had a cold the first time I tried it cause it tasted worse than a rotten cod fish wrapped in a shitty diaper.  Its enough to gag a maggot.

Light hops detectable in the aroma, nothing else. Very clear color, light golden with quickly dispersing head. The flavor is also lightly hoppy with a hint of malt in the back. Finishes very watered down with a slight fruity end. This wasn't a bad lager, just didn't have any of the malt flavors that are good in beer.

Ok bought in the 21.4 oz bottle to go along with some sushi I had got.
Nice enough beer to look at..deep clear gold colour with a largish foamy pure white head with some active carbonation.
Smell also is pleasant yet pretty average for a lager..nicefresh hops..slighly peppery..but mostly a bread smell.
The taste however is a let down..this is almost exactly the same as Budweiser for a premium price..thin and leaves no impression at all..least its not horrible.
Pretty wishy washy on the palate.
NOt drinkable to me at all..even with sushi..I'll buy Sapporo Reserve next time.
  RE-rate after 15 years...the label  has changed Now has "First Press" and 100% Malt.
This beer has certainlly changed for the better its more hoppy more clean and deeply malty  and mush more well carbonated.
Like this now
Skunk nose. taste was...i dont even know. non existant? Dry as hell finish.
Amber in color with a nice head.A medium bodied lager with lots of malt.Goes greta with sushi.
smells like a skunk beer and looks and tastes like one.overall its worth a try
Light golden body with moderate carbonation and a fast-fading fizzy head. Aroma of grassy hops and pale malt. Light flavor and palate. The best of the 3 widely available Japanese beers.

mmm, nothing stand out. I suppose it is a japanese lager, so i shouldnt be expecting a lot. It is a nice clean colour but it has little aroma. Tastes grainy and a little too light. not too much flavour and zero aftertaste. Overpriced for a standard, inoffensive, japanise lager.
Not much aroma happening, no lasting head to speak of, fairly light in colour, not much happening flavour wise. pretty average. cheers
Tasted like Bud Light. Light yellow color with no head. Some balance...but not much from the aroma or flavor. Won't get this again.
This beer has a light yellow body - hue with a bitter initial flavor and a light body.
Smelled faintly ricey, but maybe I'm being influenced by the fact it is Japanese.  Really boring.  Fizzy medium yellow.  Just too much of nothing.  Very faint bitterness.
This tasted like a macro euro-lager to me, and a very cheaply made one at that. Husky/musty/soapy aromas and flavor. Probably adjunct laden. Kind of bitter in the finish.
Well no one brags about Asian beers ... and usually for good reason.  This was a pretty standard Asian Lager.  Just an odd varient of Budweiser.
Not too much to be said about this that hasn't been said before. A lightly sweet taste makes this an easy drinking, enjoyable beer.
Bottled Light straw gold, with pleny of fiz. Cheep and thin. Quite unimpressive really.

From a can, beer pours (in Chimay glass) an applejuice (piss, read 'urine')-golden color with virgin-white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is of strong straw, grass, vegetal.  Flavor is of a watered down straw, grass - not too prominent.  Still a drainpour.  Looks awful.  Tastes awful.  Just another sucky, yellow beer - and there's plenty of them.  Sampled at 71 degrees Fahrenheit.
In 5 words: Cold, crisp, light, refreshing, clean. I think that about sums it up.
I liked this stuff with sushi.  Decent light malty taste for a megabrew, hops were clean smelling but light.  Body was decent and aftertaste was slightly sweet and long.
didn`t fancy this one very much but was surprised to read that it was brewed in australia although under licence very small head no lacing and didn`t like the hop taste

Color is clear yellow with a gold quality, but a vigorous pour produced very little head or foam. Smell is thin malt and grain of rice or corn. Taste is mostly watered down malt, corn, and rice with real no flavor. Barely sweet. Feel is water, thin, weak, empty, nothing, have a glass a water with a lemon. Very sorry I even tried it.

Almost no aroma. Light in colour, flavour and bitterness, and has no aftertaste. It is highly carbonated. Actually made under licence by Lion-Nathan, this is sort of an Australian version of a Japanese imitation of an American Standard.

Had this on my seventh wedding anniversary for good fortune...pale yellow, highly carbonated, started out with a large head that quickly fizzled out, no lacing, mild/almost nonexistant aroma, a tinge of hoppiness with a sweet finish. Not impressive, but better than most other widely available lagers.

Not a bad lager, just doesn't do enough to distingish if from a lot of the other mass produced dreck.  Beer pours golden with big fluffy head.  Beer is yellow, but not fizzy.  Head almost completely dissipates, but there is moderate lacing.  Aroma is very light floral hops.  Taste follows, initially lightly sweet followed by a dash of hop bitterness.  Good for mass produced beer.  Not good by other standards.
not bad at all.  Almost what an american standard ought to be.  full bodied, nice hop taste, very refreshing, a little bloaty, but i'm drinking it fast.  was better cold at the top of the glass.

I didn't think this was too bad. I looked at the date at the bottom of the can and it was brewed in August 02 (last year) inspite of that, and to my surpriise that it is an Anheirser Bush product, it was actually an OK beer. I'd certainly drink it again as a nice thirst quencher on a hot day. The 24 oz can I had poured with ample carbonation. Light straw yellow which looked weaker than it tasted. Nice head at first which quickly dissapaited with not much lacing. I hate to admit this about any AB product, but I'd definitely drink this again.
another beer with a thin, white head and little carbonation.  however, it still has a nice, bubbly palate.  there's a slight corn aftertaste...

This lager poured a small white head with fine-small bubbles that quickly dissolved. There was no lacing on the sides of my glass. There was a lot of carbonation observed rising to the top. The body was gold in color. There was a bitter taste and an aftertaste observed with this lager. This lager lacked character and I was not impressed with this lager.

This brew poured a medium head of fine to medium sized white bubbles that quickly disappeared and a carbonated weak straw yellow body.  It has a strong hop aroma and a fizzy hop flavor without much character.  This brew is not impressive in the least.

Part II of the courageous "Free on the Plane, Wouldn't have it Otherwise" endeavour...A faint cereal aroma accurately predicts dry cereal flakes...Other than the sticky lacing, there is nothing tastebud warming about this bucket of swill...

24 oz. can. No longer brewed in Japan, this crap is now brewed in Los Angeles California, by none other than good old Budweiser. No wonder it tastes exactly like a Bud. Pours out a piss yellow color, with no head to speak of. Sugary aromas, no hop aromas or flavors in here at all. Tastes more like a malt liquor than a lager. I won't be buying this again, that's for certain.

hoppy start and clean finish. leaves my mouth feeling very clean, almost no after taste. flavor is light, but very unique. very light on the palate. overall I would sat that this is a great beer to drink with food, it would also be great after a hard work out or bike ride.
Efficient is the word that springs to mind. Clean, unassuming. If given this beer I would greet it with a mild thanks rather than HAI.

Not overly good looking, but acceptable for a lager, with medium gold color and a decent white head.  Aroma is also middle of the road, typical lager.  The flavor is almost non-existant here.  Not crisp like american standards/lights...just kind of bland and flat.  Not a very good lager at all.

Smells very bad, ricey almost. Head is also very bad. The beer is decent, with a pretty dry finish. Funny to see a born-on date.

Old rating (back when I was a novice) 5,3,6,4,13Orangish color, little head. Much better than Sapporo. Nice. Good finish, but still just an average beer.
Very good with my very good Japanese dinner. Pretty crisp as expected, better quality than most in that it didn't break down upon warming.
Pale yellow orange. Thick but diminishing foamy head. Intricate lacing. Grainy aroma with a hint of cut grass. Mostly flavorless. Very slightly sweet some earthy notes. Quick, clean finish.
Not too bad for a ’standard’ beer. Not much aroma, but the taste is a bit bitter, which really is a good thing.

(Paired with sushi) Clear golden body with small white head.  Aroma is light and sweet, some bread.  Taste is light, sweet and watery.  Minimal bitterness that's in the swallow.  It's not bad, but it's certainly not worth seeking out.
Blond color. Milder taste than the regular. The palate as well is too weak.
fizzy yellow with white head, A fairly run of the mill bland uninspired lager. Not as offensive as BMC, but certainly nothing to seek out either
Okay light lager with a nice malt taste.  Decent amount of carbonation with out any complexity.  Decent beer.  Goes well with Chinese food.  Go figure.

Had on tap at P.F. Chang's on March 29, 2003
A so-so beer.  Nothing really stands out - neither good nor bad.  A fizzy yellow beer, the head is slight and the taste is weak.  Niether good nor bad, this one sits right in the middle.
unremarkable but not offensive.  I was acutually able to finish the beer,  which is a good sign.  Light fizzy flavor,  a tad fruity aroma,  but not much else

Had at Chang's Mongolian Grill. Largely unspectacular. Hints of malt. Slight hops in the finish. Still more flavor than a BMC. Oh, and on the bottle it said it was brewed under the supervision of the Kirin Brewmaster by Anheuser-Busch Los Angeles Ca.

Medium white head rapidly diminishing.  Clear, light bodied and some noicable malt flavor and a moderate bitterness at the end.  Dry finish and lively carbonation.  Not bad but suggest you keep on looking.
(Bottle) Pours a thin and quick dissipating white head and a pale gold colour. Slight hop aroma. Sweet flavours and fizzy carbonation. Boring.

(10Feb2003--12oz.bottle)
Ho hum.  The 2.38 number here (as of 11Feb2003) is about right, perhaps a bit high.
Decidedly small, quickly receding head.  Inactive carbonation leaves the beer on the flat side.
Light hop aroma...well, very light.
Dry body, light, sweet fruit, with some proteins to fill the mouth.
In summary: fairly unoffensive.
Pale color, weak but pleasant aroma, fairly well balanced. Nothing that's a turn-off, but nothing special either.

Another macro beer.  It is pretty smooth, however.  Decent enough for a night at a Japanese steak house.  I was kind of suprised to see that it is now brewed in The States by that purveyor of fine brews, A-B.  Didn't they slam others a few years back for contract brewing????
a smooth beer with a refreshing palate and unique taste reminisant of ginger.
Decent for the fact that it wasn't offensive. Some malt detected. Perfect with the Tako Sushi.

Clear golden lager with a big white head.  Nose offloral hops.  Taste offloral hops bitter hops and enough light malt.  Mouth maybe a little thin but as much as one can expect from a lager-style beer.  Overall, surprisingly good factory beer.
Not the best and not the worst - as one of the previous reviewers said "a middle of the road beer". I think I liked it a bit more than most of the recent reviewers though.
Barely yellow in colour, mild but acceptable smell...acceptable taste, not too bad!
Watery, boring, sudsy, with a foul bitterness that tasted almost like medicine.  Nice golden color.  Emergency beer in a pinch, but overall, not a do-again.
Very boring, not much taste, watery, no hop flavor, waste of time...........
Standard fare lager, though slightly more enjoyable than American macro lagers.  Clean and crisp with course carbonation.

Pretty much a standard lager. Nothing special about this at all. Golden brown in color. Tall head. High carbonation. Refreshing when served cold. Tastes great with sushi and sashimi. Worth trying, as all beers are.

A dark gulden beer with a fast disappearing head. It has a malty aroma and a slightly malt sweet and slightly bitter taste. A very standard pilsener - but good for a japanese beer - it has more flavor than the standard japanese beer.
At happy hours prices ($1.5--same price as bud) with many plates of sushi is was really drinkable but nothing special.
Fairly unpleasant grassy, slightly hoppy aroma. Very smooth flavour but the finish is definately "forgetable"!?!
A middle of the road beer. Not bad though. It''s clean and sweet at times. Not bad.
For some reason I love the carbonation in this beer.  While I wouldn''t go out of my way to buy a six pack, it is the perfect combination for japanese food.
Not the worst macro in Japan - it does has some taste, but you wouldn''t drink it more than once.
Had a hard time visually telling the difference between this one and the glass of water they brought me.  Very small yeasty aroma, even smaller amounts in the mouth.  Well, not much more to say.

Nothing great, but nicer than many of the mass produced Asian lagers. Had a couple with some spicy Thai food and the matchup was okay. Looks like a light lager. Has a slight malty character. Better than Bud...

Aroma is light and tangy/hoppy...Color is a light yellow-gold---medium sudsy head and speckled lace...Taste is dominated by mellow hops; malt provides just a hint of sweetness and some body...Carbonation is moderate and adds bite...Finish is a reprise of the initial hop statement...Body is medium-light, but the lack of a meaningful malt contribution renders this pretty one-dimensional...Thoroughly drinkable, however, and better than most macro offerings...
So very clean. This is one I used to have as an easy drinking brew. That has lost its charm and appeal. Not a bad beer, just another that has become lost on me due to changing tastes.
This is slightly better than the regular Kirin Lager..it goes better with food, and finishes nice and smooth.
For a lager, this one has a fairly full body. Short palate, but definately better that U.S. lagers.

Truly a classic example of a horrific beer. I was forced to drink this while attempting to "sake bomb" and it was nothing short of a miserable experience. Thin, poorly balanced and distastefully sharp. Not good.

Color belonged somewhere between red and Green on a traffic light, head sat white and randomly dotted with bubbleez..aroma was uriney but chewy ...fizzy, lager grossness, sweet gooeyness...undercooked corn on the cob...blanched lemon peels...leaving the drinker bloated and bored.. after a while though, I started to notice a dried banana-like fruitiness and some worthy maltiness...Drinkable and a step up from U.S. swill

Had this brew in a bottle.  Light nose of caramel, toasted grains, resin, and earth.  Pours a light sparkling golden.  The large fluffy white head is mostly diminishing with fair lacing.  The mild and subtle flavor is fresh and pleasant.  The toasted nutty finish is balanced with light acidity.  The light and dry palate is smooth and lively and finishes astringent.
not much going for this one light color slight malty nose ok on the hops,clean uneventful finish. nothing special
Totally innocous, generic lager. Medium-heavy carbonation, little flavor or taste. Not good.
A light yellow in color, this is just an average beer.......................
pale yellow, nicely retained head.  faint malty aroma.  sweet flavour with decent hops for the style.  finish is short, nothing special.
How about no taste at all except for an unsatisfying bitterness.............
Not much going on here. Another treat from the macros.......................
Almost enough rice to be considered the ''King of all Beers''...............
Mild and somewhat sweet beer. The rice is clearly present in the aftertaste. Mine was 5.5% ABV. I had this with sushi. I hate sushi.
Similar to other beers from Asian countries.  Not bad, not great............

Mine says 5.5% ABV on the bottle. Pale straw clear with a large medium lasting fine bubbled off-white head. Faint sappy bitter hops aroma fading to bland nothing when warm. Very thin soda watery body and palate. Faint stale bitter and mild corn sweet flavours. Significantly less than ordinary.
Bottle bought in Kyoto, Japan.  More watery than many others, but it does have a little bite to remind you that it is beer.

Not bad for macroswill.  The nose isn't putrid, consisting of light maltiness. Taste is clean, with less adjunct and sugary tastes than the typical macro.  Finish is dry and lightly bitter.  Body is thin.  A shade or two darker than straw yellow macro color with the same wispy white head that all macros have.

Gold color, small head. Light and crisp taste. Good flavor. Good balance of hops and malts. Simple clean taste. Some hoppyness and slight tingle on tongue. Finish is crisp and clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.  Well made beer.
Well if Bud can do this for a foreign beer why can't they do it for themselves. Nice taste and finish very good wuth sushi.
No aroma to speak of. Very little head, gold in color. Nice, smooth flavor. Good at what it's trying to be. Goes great with Japanese food.
A very blah beer. Don't try this (although the name is fun to say)..........
Clear light yellow. Not much nose, but notes of malt can be recognized. Flavour is sweet and bland. Miss some hops and bitterness.
Not terrible considering this beer is associated with Anheuser Busch, but not great.  It's got a little of that dry Asian beer tast.  But the flavor is still lacking.
what the hell??? on the bottle this stuff said it was made by anheiser busch?  smelt exactly like budweiser, taste like it but with a little more flavor like how they should make budweiser.
What does "ichiban" mean?  Is that better or worse than regular Kirin lager?  Tastes the same to me.  Mine was brewed in California, US Kirin hasn't come from Japan for some time.

Boaring macro impression of a japanese lager. Find it funny that it is listed as Tokyo when it's brewed here in the U.S. Poured a light golden yellow with a small head, aroma was weak and grainy with a taste to match although there was a hint of maltiness that gave it an extra point or two.
The draught version was better, which isn't really saying much. Tastes like what it is, A-B's version of an Asian lager. Blah.
Whatever, it was made in California by Busch.  This was the blandest of beers.  Incredibly thick head, took 10 minutes to pour out of bottle.  Wasn't worth the wait.
Not a big fan of the Ichiban, thought I have to admit it hits the spot when eating good Asian food!

Can 330ml 
 Listed as 5.5%
Appearance:  Standard edition pale golden lager with light creamy top converted into fizz after while. 
Nose : Plain sweet aroma of pale malts with faint hop accents.
Flavor/Palate : Thin on body but with fair profile , malty with earthy hop feel . Sadly finish even more ghostly. Green hop shown but nothing under , you just looking for more yet nowhere to be found. This brew is waste of time on all aspects.
Brewed in Los Angeles.  Typical Japanese beer flavor.  Somewhat metallic, and an old flavor.  Need to drink this one very cold.
Easy going and efficient in its distribution of malt.  Not much else going on.
Dry bitter brew.  No real flavor.  Aroma of day old beer in a can.  Nothing really to grab a hold of here.

Stuffed full of chemicals and adjuncts (rice?) but at least there is some discernible bitterness if you concentrate very hard. Slight banana flavour as it warms which I dont think is intentional. Japanese VB.

Rerate Revisiting after 11 years - on tap at MASA in Tallahassee. Standard lager with a hint of honey sweetness. Nothing offensive. Original 2.1  Tastes like foreign Pabst with a tinny aftertaste - aroma of frat house the morning after a party.  Not overly impressed - glad I just bought a 24 ozer instead of a six! Maybe I should have tried with Sushi?
Has a zesty flavor that redeems it's fishy smell and thin appearance........
Sweet floral scent, golden, fluffy head. Bland taste, light, ordinary. This is made in Los Angeles (A.B.) It was much better when imported from Japan.
A hint of character and flavor, but Sapporo's my Japanese beer favorite by a smidge.  None of 'em are worth buying, frankly.
Better than a lot of other Asian beers, but still not really worth buying.  Very faint golden color with light carbonation and a strong malty aroma that never really materialized in the taste
Tastes like Kirin Lager but with an unpleasant bitterness added.............
Re-Rate 06/08/02: Clear gold, white head and fair lace. Nose is malt, top thin, the finish is dry, acidic and lightly hopped, a "Forgettable Beer"

I wouldn’t go out of my way to get this beer unless its the only one at a Japanese or Chinese resteraunt.    
  Looks good, and tastes OK.
This is a "situational" beer - drink with sushi. Other than that, its light in body, high in carbonation and minimal flavors. Just a tad better than the Buds, Coors and Millers of the world.
I heard good stuff about this before I tried it. Weak aroma and flavor. I should say above average, but I guess above sub-standard works better.

For boring beer.  Hoping for more but just didn't find it.  
..............
Malty, very German (Axis exchange of brewing technology?) Not bad at all, but would be best with food; I tried it by itself. The 24-oz can is cool.
I wasn't a big fan of Sapporo until I tried this poor attempt at a brew.  This isn't any better than Miller or Bud so don't spend the extra money.
I had this beer while enjoying the show put on by the Japanese cook.  I remember enjoying them both.

Pours with a bright yellow color, produces a thin head, and contains a medium level of carbonation. The taste is slightly bitter, crisp, dry -- and almost neutral, except for some bitterness -- in the finish. This is a beer that is produced through low temperature fermentation and it is cellar aged for a longer period of time than most macrobrewed beers.
This is the best beer you can often get with sushi.  Don't drink otherwise!
Thin, lacked 'oomf', tasted like a flat Budweiser.  I can drink this stuff, but I don't exactly like it.  Oh?  Imported by AB?  Now that explains the Bud taste.
Nice color, head is weak.  A malty flavor that is great with sushi and Japanese fare in general.
Typical crystal clear pale color of Japanese Lagers. Nice sweet malty nose. Crisp faint floral flavor. A nicely balanced brew but nothing special.
Pale, yellow, fizzy, sour, tinny.  Another treat from Japan.  Mine was 5.5%, so was all the versions on the net of this one.  Whatever.
It's beers like this that fuel my disdain for pilsners......................
very watery. the taste was just not very good. tasted like aluminium can.  now i know where the word "icky" comes from.
Not too bad, by far the best Anheuser Brewery product. Looks pretty weak though, a high yellow piss color.
It's a good beer to drink with a burger or pizza.  Real light but goes down well.
Taste and aroma pretty similar to Bud. No head whatsoever...................

Bottle (Jun 08, 07 production from A-B, LA, CA). Head is initially small, frothy/fizzy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is clear light to medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain, husks), with notes of detergent and DMS. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, unclean, husky. Light to medium body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Very poor...hardly anything redeeming whatsoever about this.  About as close to American macro as it gets.
The best from Kirin Brewery. Ranks a little higher than regular Kirin.......

Initial nose suggested typical-style lager, like most any big American.  At least it wasn't skunky, though, so I proceeded.   Initial taste suggested the same, but after a few sips and a little food I noticed some sweetness and a little more body in this one than many of its counterparts.  Overall, not my favorite lager but it beats most readily available brews in this area.

Cheers all around!  This Japanese beer is terrific!  I bought it as a single thinking I wouldn't like it.  I will buy it in a higher quantity next time.  Tastes like the American counterparts with an "A" in smoothness.
Yeast nose, light gold colour with nice tight head, dry bitter taste........
Uh...better than bud, maybe? I do like this better than he bottle version. I don't know why.
too thin and too much rice influence........................................

I was told that this would be good, so I was hugely disappointed after the first sip.  Im pissed that there are still 4 of these in my fridge.  Tasted about a half step above american standards.  Very watery, it wasnt even worth pouring into a glass.
I get this all the time at a local hibachi steak joint......................

Absolutely terrible.  Smells skunky, but this isn't reflected in the taste because there is virtually no taste to speak of, unless you're talking about the nasty aftertaste.  The label refers to the beer as "subtle"...I'll give them that one.
Disconcerting yellow.  Tall head.  Brothy, yeasty aroma.  Brothy, metallic, bitter flavor. Nothing to suggest that you should pay a couple of extra bucks for this over a domestic lager.

Smooth-bodied Japanese lager.  Pilsner style.  Nice flavor, especially compared to Sapporo or most other Oriental beers that are imported to the Midwest.  More enjoyable than the standard Kirin lager for me.
My first impression was, "Wow, this tastes like Bud."  Then I read the label and it says "under supervion by Anheuser-Busch".  Not bad if you want to pay twice as much for Bud in a different package.
i'm gunner be cliched and say it goes ok with sushi. quite reasonable.......

At first it seemed to have a somewhat bock-like character, fuller on the nose and slightly richer looking than the typical Japanese macro crap.  Nah, only fooling.  Does have a bit more character, more graininess and hops than Sapporo, though; if thats a recommendation.
Don't know that I could tell this from regular Kirin lager..................
Has the wet cardboard grassy flavor typical of this type. Better than Mexican anyhow, nothing special.

This is a very decent commercial beer.  I was very impressed when I tried it.  Not chemical tasting but had a very rich and pleasant taste.  No rough edges or bad aftertastes.  I recommend this beer highly.
Ok to get into the mood eating sushi........................................
I had this in a really big can. It wasn't all that bad, but i expected more from such a cool named beer. An average beer in all areas, but theres nothing wrong with that.
Very drinkable, strong, smooth, easy finishing beer excellent with sushi....
Better than regular Kirin, but is that really saying much?..................
Looks like urine. Smells of burnt rice and yeast. Slight bitterness, very bland, and not very smooth. Not worth the effort.

Anheiser-Busch has resorted to the lowest level of marketing...deception.  Printed in gold, on a GOLD label, the words "brewed by Anheiser-Busch" appear. Of course they mention that it is under the supervision of an authentic Japanese brewmaster, but what difference does it make? You have to hold the bottle at ten different angles just to read it. They are shameless, indeed...
Anyway, all that being said, this beer was not terrible.  Despite its Coors Light appearance, and burnt rice aroma, there were no real offensive qualities (and with AB, you can't ask for much more).  No distinguishable flavors; a bit earthy and grainy with a slightly bitter finish.  No head.
First time ive ever had it..nice lager, good strong and suprisingly easy to drink.
As rice beer goes this is one of the better brews, Not a Tsing Tao but better than Supporo. Light and crisp.
I like this beer.  I think it is better than Sapporo and will be drinking this with my sushi from now on.
I was told it would blow my mind, it didn't.  But, it did go well with my sushi.
Ricey and slightly bitter. Other than that just average all around..........
Looks like your standard American fare, but some hints of malt. It went well with the Hibachi food at the restaraunt and did compliment the ginger flavors in the salad dressing.
This smelled, poured, and looked like your regular macro American pale lager.  The only redeeming quality is that it slightly more malt presence.  Acceptable, but not worth the price.
Pale yellow-gold in color with a clean malt nose. Crisp hop taste with OK malt backing. Smooth going down with clean, mild hop finish. Good pairing with Oriental fare.

canned - clear pale blond colour with a little head retention; aroma of rice and nothing else; the palate is gently oily and it has a moderate malt backbone, quite sweet and with a shy bitterness; notes of malt and rice in the finish
not very impressive, almost a skunky flavor, but it's not my favorite style of beer

A competent, sweetish clean lager.
Nothing wrong with this, but its a rare
choice outside of Japanese restaurants, where
it always pairs well with the sushi.
